loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  She works as a secretary but also has a well-organized shop where she performs secretarial services. Three years ago, she opened this business due to her interest in it. Her shop is open from 7AM until 8PM daily except for Sunday, and employs two other persons. 

With this loan, Solange intends to purchase an additional computer and printer. She will save any additional profits she earns after the loan is paid off.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer and printer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 41 years old, married and has two children. He graduated from primary school, and he owns a garage for repair and painting of cars. The borrower will use this loan to develop his business and purchase paints and new equipment for painting. He has a great deal of experience in his field of work. He has a good personality and has great motivation and ambition to develop his business.

loans.use: purchasing paint and other materials

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique N. est enseignante, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Elle a 24 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle est née à Rwanda.  Ce prêt est son 4eme cycle avec ACB, et elle a bien remboursée ses prêts.  Elle a fini ses études jusqu’au niveau A2, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais d’études universitaire.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de terminer ses études universitaires.  Elle voudrait avoir le niveau de licence pour son activité d’enseignante, et construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Monique N. is a teacher. She joined ACB in 2007. She is 24 years old, single, and was born in Rwanda. 


This is her 4th loan cycle with ACB, and previous loans were repaid without incident. She completed A2 level studies, and plans to use her loan to pay for her university tuition fees. 


Her strategy is to finish her university studies. She wants to get her teaching license, and build a beautiful house.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth S., 29, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. S. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of about 2.5 USD per day. Her husband is a barber, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 28 USD on other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul C. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 28 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a daughter and two sons. The first son is at school and the other children are not yet, because they are preschool age (under seven). 

Four years ago, with the initial investment of 1,500 KGS, Jazgul started to breed goats. Reselling goats after being fattened, she makes about an additional $85 per month. With money received from the loan, she will purchase more goats for breeding. In the future, Jazgul dreams to build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en: Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who is a milk seller and wants to buy another buffalo to expand his dairy business further. The loan will help him increase the production of milk and sell to more customers. Sobia is a talented lady involved in making pranday (an ornament used to tie back hair). She sells her product to different cosmetics shops in the market and generates income for the family. She is an active young lady who performs her household activities very well. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of them are very young and have not started school yet. Sobia is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for her husband, and he will be able to take his business to a more profitable position. Sobia is a resident of Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture. She has been living with her family in the area of Bari Rakh in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean M. est commerçant de boutique il client d’ACB  depuis 2010.il a 31ans, marie et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 11ans.  Deux de ces enfants vont à l’école. Jean est ne a Nyanza au RWANDA  et il a le niveau d’étude de ‘école primaire .il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de ciment, sable, toles, pierre pour ravitailler sa maison.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est de rembourser le prêt en augmentant ses ventes d’habits dans sa boutique, profiter d’avantage, et augmenter la clientèle de sa boutique.ses ambitions pour les affaires sont d’acheter un taxi minibus pour faire le transport des personnes en taxi. Pour la famille il voudrait éduquer ses enfants et construire la maison selon le plan de la ville de Kigali.
texts.en: Jean M. is a shopkeeper.  He has been a client of ACB since 2010.  He is 31 years old, married, and has three children from 2 to 11 years in age.  Two of his children attend school.  Jean was born in Nyanza, in Rwanda, and has a primary school education.  He is going to use his loan to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, and stones to make improvements to his house.   He is not expected to have any difficulties in repaying his loan.  His strategy for growing his business is to repay the loan while increasing his clothing sales at his retail shop, making larger profits, and attracting more customers to his shop.  His business goal is to buy a minibus taxi for transporting passengers.  As for his family, he would like to have his children educated and to build a house according to the city plan of Kigali.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, and stones to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Maame Araba

texts.en: Maame is a single parent taking care of two children. Maame sells slippers and cloth at Elmina near Nkontrodo in Cape Coast. Maame uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Araba plans to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale.

loans.name: Salem Plus Group

texts.en:
Paulin, aged 47 and married, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Salem Plus” which consists of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Paulin sells fertilizer and seeds to the west of Kinshasa. He started his business in 1993. Paulin is happy right now as, with the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer and seeds, have a greater range of stock and be able to meet customer demand. Paulin makes a profit of US$100 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to, someday, own a farm. Paulin has six children aged between 2 and 35. Three of them go to school. He also takes care of his two nephews.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying sacks of fertilizer and seeds for resale

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child.

Mekdad has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has five years' experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is a 34 year old hard working business lady. She is married and blessed with three children aged; 14, 11, and 3. 

Loise sells utensils and plastic goods. Previously, she worked at a music studio. She wants 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy buckets, basins and utensils.
She hopes to have a big shop and to be a prosperous business-lady. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for improving her business skills and teaching her the art of saving.

loans.use: to buy buckets, basins and utensils.

loans.name: Dora Lorena

texts.es:
Dora es una madre de familia de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, contando con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Dora, desde hace 3 años es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (venta de arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc), al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  También cría y vende aves de corral (pavos),es otro ingreso con el que cuenta.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y adquirir alimentos balanceados para sus aves, para poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño de Dora es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a 21-year-old mother who lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Dora resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area has businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past three years, Dora has managed a business selling basic necessities such as rice, milk, oil, sugar, and other items. Her business is located in her home so that she can attend to it at any hour. This differentiates her business from other stores and allows her to generate more income to meet her family obligations. In addition, she raises and sells turkeys so that she can earn additional money.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN, which will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise and acquire balanced feed for her birds. Dora wants to expand her business with other products so that she can increase her sales. Her dream is to expand her store and generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to acquire poultry feed.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working in the agriculture field for the past 15 years. In 1999, he purchased a plot of land where he started to cultivate all types of vegetables according to the season. He has one part-time employee helping him with the farming work. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as fertilizers and seeds. This is his second Kiva loan and he has been very reliable with his repayments. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Aida Del Carmen

texts.es: Aida del Carmen D. veinticinco años D. edad, resiD. con su esposo e hijo en casa familiar. DesD. hace mucho tiempo ella  y su esposo  poseen una panadería en la cual trabajan D. la mano para salir adelante. Aida se encarga D. la fabricación del pan dulce mientras que su esposo se encarga D. venderlo. Esta panadería es su principal fuente D. ingresos por lo tanto necesitan seguir manteniéndola activa por mucho más tiempo. Aida es muy conocida en la zona donD. resiD. y cuenta con mucha clientela  ya que siempre ofrece buenos precios, calidad y sobre todo variedad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora  la cual no pierD. oportunidad para hacer negocio. Con el fin D. ver florecer a un  mas su negocio ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. los insumos necesarios en la fabricación del pan, como: harina, levadura, azúcar, leche, bandejas, etc. D. esta manera espera lograr atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel D. ventas y D. ingresos para tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aida del Carmen is twenty-five years old.  She lives with her husband and son in the family home. For a long time, she and her husband have owned a bakery where they work hand in hand to move forward in life.  Aida is responsible for making sweet breads while her husband is in charge of selling.  This bakery is their main source of income so they need to continue to keep it active for a long time.  

Aida is well known in the neighborhood where she lives, and can count on many clients as she always offers good prices, quality and above all variety.  She is an enterprising woman which misses no opportunity to do business.  With a view to seeing her business flourish further, she has decided to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing necessary supplies for the manufacture of bread such as flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.   In this way she hopes to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her level of sales and income to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 37 years old. He is married and has one child, aged three, whom he and his wife hope to educate to the university level. 

Charles sells clothes to the local people. His business is located in a residential area known as Kiembeni in Mombasa. He has been running this business for five years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so customers are not loyal as they have many choices. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

Charles is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business to wholesale and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open another clothes sales business in the future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
For the last ten years Pius has been buying and selling. He is 55 years old and married to Esther--together they have three school-aged children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. He has been loaned KES. 50,000 which he will use to buy two cows. He will later sell them at a profit.

In the future, Pius hopes to practice large-scale farming, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy two cows which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 46-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She works in the direct sale of cosmetics. She sells perfumes, lipstick and lotion. Myrna’s husband works abroad and is her partner in paying her children's school fees.
Myrna has been in business for five years. She experiences obstacles, which might be seen as reasons for not continuing the business, but she just takes them as a challenge. Myrna wants to help her husband even in a simple way, that’s why she keeps on selling even when her customers do not pay on time. She believes that patience leads to success. 
Myrna is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for the products that she purchases and then sells to her customers. She hopes to purchase more products to sell, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Laila

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui exerce dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle achète en gros du lait de beauté et des parfums qu'elle revend en détail et à crédit à ses clients.Elle arrive à générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille et de satisfaire ses propres bénéfices.Elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter des caisses de lait de beauté et de parfum. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: The borrower is a woman who trades in cosmetics. She buys beauty lotions and perfumes on a wholesale basis and then sells them on a retail basis and on credit to her customers. She manages to generate sufficient profits to take care of her family and to satisfy her own needs. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy crates of beauty lotions and perfume. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy crates of beauty lotion and perfume

loans.name: Fritz Francisco

texts.es:
Fritz tiene 44 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Fritz trabaja en la Escuela de Bellas Artes “Diego Quispe Tito” de la ciudad del Cusco como administrador personal y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Fritz y su esposa Roció tienen un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras y otras cosas más. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 

Fritz pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fritz is 44 years old and has two children. He was born in the town of Paucartambo and he currently lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Fritz works in the "Diego Quispe Tito" School of Fine Arts in the city of Cusco as a personnel administrator. He also owns a small grocery store.
Fritz and his wife Rocio run a small family business; they sell comestibles such as rice, sugar, noodles, soup and other things. He has owned the business for ten years already and it is going very well. On this occasion, he requests the loan in order to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.
Fritz is a member of the "Unión, Fuerza y Amistad" ("Union, Strength and Friendship") communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. He is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means and, at the same time, he promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Yanet sigue con el negocio de venta de maíz y sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores coomo por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos. Yanet con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y para comprar animales como cuyes y chanchos. 

Yanet se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Yanet still sells corn and raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, hens, chicks and pigs.  Yanet did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business’ capital.

On this occasion Yanet needs the loan to buy corn and to buy animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  Yanet is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy animals like guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Mayramkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 44 года, замужем и имеет троих детей. Майрамкул работает поваром в местной школе и известна как жизнерадостный и оптимистичный человек.  В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи,  Майрамкул начала свой бизнес в откорме и реализации скота, использовав для этого стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Майрамкул приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 10,000 сом , что позволяет покрывать расходы семьи и траты на корм для скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Майрамкул обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство, а часть доходов она планирует направить на  подготовку к свадьбе сына.
texts.en: Mayramkul is 44 years old, married and has three children. Mayramkul works as a cook at a local school and is known for being an optimistic and joyous person. As a way to provide additional income to her family, Mayramkul started her own business, raising and selling animals, initially investing 5,000 KGS. Today, Mayramkul's farm makes a profit of about 10,000 KGS per month, which covers the expenses of her family and the cost of feed for the animals. With the goal of increasing the number of animals, Mayramkul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS, to purchase additional animals. This will allow her to expand her farm, and she plans to use a part of her income on preparations for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix who is 47 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agitina, a frozen food dealer, and father to their three children. One of is children is already working; one is in college, and the other is in elementary grade. By the grace of God, Felix has managed to support his older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, he is working hard to send his two youngest children to college. 

Felix operates a processed meat store. It is where one can buy processed and frozen meat like hotdogs, ham, and the like, near your home. Felix earns an income by buying processed meat at wholesale prices and selling them by the kilo. Aside from this he also manage their farm. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 206 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 17, 000 loans. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more frozen foods like, hotdogs and ham. He will also buy fertilizers for his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands the business.  

Felix dreams to be able to give all his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He also hopes to have his family and community with him as he continues to serve the Lord Almighty through his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in his business.

loans.name: Zikir

texts.ru: Более 16 лет Зикир занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Он продает сахар, макароны, рис, разные виды сладостей и овощей. Ему в бизнесе помогает сын. Зикир хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Зикир запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью увлечения ассортимент продуктов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Zikir has been in the business of buying and selling of food for more than sixteen years. He sells sugar, pasta, rice, different kinds of sweets and vegetables. His son helps him in the business. Zikir wants to expand his business and make a good profit. He is requesting a loan to buy food to expand the variety of products. He looks forward to your help and thanking you in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates land. Narine has applied for a loan to purchase  tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer. Successful cultivation of the land will help Narine to develop her farm and get additional income. This is vital for Narine's family, as it will allow her to meet the ends and insure prosperous future. Narine lives together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo is a 58-year-old woman from western Kenya who is married to Cyprian Otieno. They have nine children and six grandchildren. 

Adhiambo is a food seller specializing in yams, and she has been in this business for the last 13 years. She makes a monthly profit of KES 10,000, with which she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

This is her third loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to add more yams to her stock, and part of the money to pay school fees for her grandchildren. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and also to build a good house  

Her dreams is to build a good house and to pay the fees for her orphan grandchildren.

loans.use: to add more food stuff stock and pay school fees, as well as to build a house

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de leche,ella vende leche en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta y crianza de chanchos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a los hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender la leche y tambien ampliar el negocio de crianza de chanchos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche y tambien comprar chanchos

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina continues to dedicate herself to the milk business. She sells milk on an itinerant basis from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She is also engaged in selling and raising pigs. By means of these businesses she is helping her children progress.

Bernardina’s dream is to have a shop for selling milk and also to enlarge her business of raising pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase milk and also to buy pigs. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk and pigs.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Marcela es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores, siendo Marcela la que preside al grupo. Ella tiene 42 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos que aún sigue apoyando. Con los deseos de superarse inicio su propio negocio, la cual realiza manualidades como bordado en cinta, repujado de aluminio, pintado en vidrio, entre otros la cual trabaja sobre pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, este negocio le ha beneficiado, pues nos cuenta que con los conocimientos adquiridos,  también brinda clases de manualidades, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Gracias a este negocio a podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de cintas, telas, pinturas, aluminios y pinceles y así poder elaborar sus manualidades. El deseo de Marcela es habilitar un espacio en su domicilio donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos manuales. La Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcela es la que  está ubicada al medio de su grupo, ella viste una bruza blanca con flores estampadas. En la foto grupal adjuntamos la fotografía de Yemima.
texts.en:
Marcela’s a member of the “Uniendo Fuerzas” (Uniting Strength) communal bank which has 7 responsible, hardworking members; Marcela is group President.  She’s 42 years old, separated and has two children that she still supports.  With the wish to improve she started her own business making crafts like ribbon embroidery, aluminum embossing, painting on glass, among others.  She works based on prior customer orders.  The business has benefitted her because she tells us that with the skills learned she also teaches crafts classes thus earning extra household income.  Thanks to this business she’s been able to improve her family’s quality of life.

In order to continue improving, she’s asked for a loan to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes to make her crafts.  Marcela’s wish is to equip a space at home where she can display her manual arts.

The “Uniendo Fuerzas” communal bank is grateful for the loan granted and commits to continue working well.  Marcela appears in the center of the group wearing a white blouse printed with flowers.  We have inserted Yemima’s photo in the group photo.

loans.use: to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old and married, residing at Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Manuel is operating a gardening business venture to earn a living and has been 15 years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Manuel wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married and lives with his wife. They live in their own house in Tiribe, Kenya. Juma is a very self-sacrificing person, and tells us that he has farmed for years, growing all kinds of vegetables for sale.

At the same time, he raises livestock and buys animals to slaughter and sell, as this proves much more profitable for him.

Thanks to his years of work and effort, nowadays he can offer his family a comfortable home with the necessary conveniences.

He is applying for the loan to buy animals for slaughter. He is very happy about the opportunity he is receiving through the Yehu Microfinance Trust and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide de 29 anos de idade é solteira, comerciante ambulante  ha 10 anos 
Com o valor do crédito ira comprar cimento, pedra, areia, para a construção de um estabelecimento comercial na sua casa.
Tem como sonhos crescer no negócio e gostaria de voltar a estudar.
O seu principal dasafio é terminar a sua obra de estabelecimento comercial para melhor responder as exigências de  de seus clientes.
texts.en:
Adelaide is 29 years old and single. She has been a street vendor for the past 10 years.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rocks and sand in order to build a store in her house.
Her dream is to make her business grow. She'd also like to go back to school.
Her main challenge is to finish building her store so that she can better accommodate her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and sand.

loans.name: Raul Enrique

texts.en:
My clients call me Quique. I am the owner of a print shop that makes notebooks, postcards, calendars and other goods. I have been doing this for several years and have various contracts with schools. My clients prefer me because of the high quality of my goods and the low prices I offer. Now is the end of the year and there is increased demand for notebooks, calendars and stickers. Also there is greater demand for the coupon books used by schools and high schools. For this reason, I need to buy the supplies needed to attend to my clients. I am the father of three children. I am teaching them about the business so that they can continue with it.

This loan will be used to buy paper, ink, cardboard, stickers and other supplies

Entre mis clientes me llaman Quique, y soy dueño de una imprenta en la que hago libretas, postales, calendarios, calcomanias. Tengo varios años de tener mi negocio y tengo varios contratos con escuelas, colegios y otros negocios ambulantes. Mis clientes me prefieren por la calidad de producto que les brindo y los buenos precios que les ofrezco. Ahorita que es fin de año, la demanda crece en la elaboracion de calendarios, libretas y stickers, asi como los talonarios de pago de escuelas y colegios es por eso que necesito realizar una buena inversion en la compra de los materiales necesarios para atender a todos mis clientes. Soy padre de tres hijos a quienes les enseñe el negocio para que ellos continuen con este.

loans.use: Compra de papel, tinta, cartulinas, sticker y otros

loans.name: Kereta

texts.en: Kereta L. has a small fruit and vegetable farm for her business. Kereta is a hard-working person from the village of Nofoalii.  Kereta's project is well-developed in different ways because of the support of her family and friends. She has done a great job by selling her goods at the market.  She earns a hundred tala (USD 30) a day from her selling.  Kereta is a woman with the guts to get the job done. She goes to her plantation everyday to check on it, as well as to weed and to plant more taro, banana and other fruits and vegetables.  Kereta and her family survive on the profits from this farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, planting materials, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband is retired and the pension they receive is not enough to cover all of their family expenses and so she decided to open a small store. As she didn't have the capital to start her store with, she asked the help of Coca Cola who loaned her a small lot where she began to sell small items, however, her business has grown with time. Today, the whole family works in the store and Carolina wishes to expand even more as she is very much an entrepeneur.

She is asking for a loan of $250.00 in order to buy stationary and to expand her store by offering this new product which, from her experience, she will see high demands for from her customers since they themselves have asked her for it. She proposes to pay the loan in 3-6 months and she awaits your colaboration in order to see her dreams realized and to see her family and business grow at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Carolina es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es una persona pensionada, y la pensión que recibe no era suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar por lo que ella decidió abrir una pequeña tienda, al no tener el capital para empezar, recurrió a la ayuda de la Coca Cola que en ese entonces le presto un pequeño puestito en el cual ella empezó vendiendo muy pocas cosas, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando su negocio y lo amplió, actualmente toda la familia atiende en el negocio y Carolina quiere ampliarlo aún más, es una mujer muy emprendedora.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para poder comprar papelería y ampliar su tienda ofreciendo estos productos que según su experiencia va a tener mucha demanda de sus clientes ya que ellos mismos se lo han solicitado, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses y espera tu colaboración en sus deseos de superarse y crecer junto con su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To supply the store.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en: U. Ibrohim is 33 years old. He has a wife and 2 children. He has worked with his brothers for many years. One brother sells sport clothes and shoes. Another sells spare parts of cars. They all help each other in their businesses. Ibrohim also has his own business – he sells electro meters and spare parts of electro meters. He specializes in electrical appliances and demand for his products is good. He also repairs electrical appliances.  In order to increase his sales, he decided a year ago to take out a loan, which helped to increase his sales many times. Now he is going to open a new business – selling clothes. He has rented a small shop for this purpose, and he now needs $1200 to start his business.

loans.use: to open new business – selling clothes

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong has proven to be a very reliable business partner. She has borrowed from Mekong Plus three times already; her last loan was funded by Kiva. She has repaid all of her loans on time.

Phuong would like another loan to help her continue to increase her sales. The loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva have helped Phuong increase her daily profits to 10-20,000 VND ($0.62-1.25). Without the loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Phuong would have to seek a loan from another source that has high interest rates. The high interest rates would prevent Phuong from ever escaping poverty. Since switching over to Mekong Plus, she has been able to save enough to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: María Flor

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Flower Communal Coffee Bank . It is designated for the sale of grocery products and spices such as coriander, chili, special liquified garlic, seasonings such as cumin, oregano, etc. Also sold in her post are any chopped vegetables you may have in the local market, which is the district Soritor Province of Moyobamba, San Martín region.

Maria decided to start her business to support the financial responsibilities of her home, to move ahead with her family, generate her own income and grow as a person. With the being requested by Manuela Ramos (which comes to approx. $ 225.00 USD., and which will be paid in four months), Maria will buy rice, sugar sacks, oil, milk, tuna and boxes of condiments like cumin, pepper, sillao, vinegar, ajinomoto, etc. She hopes to grow her business so she can meet the needs of her customers and the local market.

Maria is 53 years old and has 4 children, is happy with what she does and pleased with the results so far. Now that she has increased her customer base, her goal is to expand and implement more business, and rent another post which will be larger and safer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes y especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos licuados, condimentos como cominos, orégano, guisador, etc., molidos, también verduras picadas en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad que es el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Región San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio para apoyar en la economía de su casa, sacar adelante a su familia, generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche, y atún en cajas , condimentos como cominos, pimienta, sillao, vinagre, ajinomoto, etc. y demás abarrotes para surtir su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, su meta es ampliar e implementar mas su negocio, alquilar otro puesto con mayor espacio y mas seguro.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to grow her sales (rice, sugar, oil, milk, tuna, condiments, spices, etc.)

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
Mavdjuda has started her business together with her husband. After the divorce she took the business in her hands. She has been working on the market for the past 15 years. Seasonal fruits have been brining in a good profit. With time, her now ex-husband has stopped helping her out with the business. She has decided to obtain a credit that will allow her to increase the selection of goods she has for sale, which is currently impossible due to low turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мавджуда начинала свой бизнес с мужем, после развода она взяла бизнес по продажи фруктов в свои руки. На рынке 15 лет. Сезонные фрукты приносили ей не плохой доход. Со временем, когда муж перестал помогать решила взять кредит, для улучшения ассортимента и из-за нехватки оборотного капитала.

loans.use: Fruit sale

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona A. is a 54 year old single mother of 3 teenage girls. The 3 girls are studying and help their mother with the family busines and with the house chores.

She creates home cooked meals that are delivered to her clients own homes in the town of Coronel Oviedo. On the menu are a variety of hot meals, salads, desserts and drinks. Mrs. Petrona has over 30 years experience in the catering business and decided to open her own venture as she found herself unemployed when her previous employers decided to close down their restaurant and retire.

The money requested will be used to purchase a freezer to add ice cream to her menu.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Freezer purchase

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
When Alicia married she thought it was going to be for her whole life. However, due to difficulties in her marraige, it ended. After the separation Alicio entered into a depression, but she still needed to move forward and find a way to support her children. That was the motivation for her to begin her small business. Fortunately, she has great strength, which animated her to start selling meals from her house. Little by little, and with the help of her friends, she began to gain the knowledge to build her business.

Now she counts on various customers, but she's not been able to increase her production because the costs of running her home and supporting her children take most of the profit. So Alicia is requesting a credit a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months. With the money she will be able to buy merchandise, increase her food production and grow her profits. With your help, Alicia will be able to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Alicia se casó pensando que este paso sería para toda la vida. Sin embargo por desacuerdos en su matrimonio, este se terminó. Después de la separación Alicia entró en una depresión. Sin embargo tenía que salir adelante para poder mantener a sus hijos. Fue así como se decidió poner un pequeño negocio. Afortunadamente Alicia cuenta con una sazón muy rica, lo cual la hizo animarse a poner su venta de comidas en la casa. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de sus amigos, Alicia se fue haciendo conocida.

Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes, sin embargo Alicia no a podido incrementar su producción puesto que los gastos de sus hijos absorben mucho dinero. Es por eso que Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Alicia podrá comprar mercancía para incrementar su producción de comida y así poder tener mayores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Alicia podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MORE INGREDIENTS FOR HER SMALL BUSINESS PREPARING AND SELLING MEALS FROM HER HOUSE, GROW HER PROFITS AND PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Moshi's Kamano 1 Group

texts.en:
Moshi , 45 years old, is married with 3 children, ages 25, 15 and 6. Moshi sells soft drinks, a business she started in 1990. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Moshi has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending and clothes selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta conformado por dieciocho mujeres emprendedoras que dedican sus vidas al trabajo y a la unión familiar. Todas poseen actividades distintas que realizan a la par de ser esposas, amas de casa y madres. Con mucho amor, ellas deciden trabajar además de realizar sus actividades en la casa, pues deben aportar con los ingresos de la familia ya que todas ellas provienen de familias muy humildes.

Entre las actividades que realizan citamos: venta de comestibles, frutas, verduras, ropas, joyas de plata, venta de comidas rápidas y reciclaje. Ellas se encuentra actualmente en el quinto ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que tiene como objetivo principal fomentar el emprendedurismo capacitándolas en las ventas de sus productos, en la buena inversión de sus capitales y en el ahorro. El reracionamiento de las integrantes es bastante bueno, todas se ayudan entre si y son muy puntuales en sus aportes y cuotas.

El crédito que solicitan desean destinarlo en la compra de mercaderías para la venta, ingredientes para sus comidas y insumos para reciclar.

loans.use: Compra de joyas de plata, remeras, pantalones, calzados, frutas, verduras, carne, azúcar, fideos, plásticos y papeles para reciclar.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is an examplary woman, and very dedicated to her family. She’s known the value of hard work since childhood, as she comes from a humble home and was required to earn her keep at a very young age. Now she is a caring mother and hard-working spouse, putting her all into each activity. She sells clothing and beautiful weavings and accessories. With these jobs she earns essential income for her beloved family. Elena would like more than anything to provide security, stability, and education for her children. She is sure that expanding her handicrafts business would considerably improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena, es una dama ejemplar y consagrada a su familia, desde niña sabe el verdadero valor del trabajo, ya que proviene de un humilde hogar y la necesidad la obligó a ganarse el sustento diario desde muy pequeña.Actualmente es una madre cariñosa y una laboriosa esposa, que trata de poner su mayor esfuerzo y voluntad a cada una de las actividades que realiza como: la venta de ropa americana y hermosos tejidos de prendas de vestir, con estos trabajos genera indispensables ingresos económicos para su querida familia.El deseo de esta valiosa dama es brindarle seguridad, estabilidad y educación a sus queridos hijos, esta segura que ampliando su negocio de artesanía mejorará considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increased capital to purchase a wider variety of products

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Veng C. is 26 years old and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She sells soft drinks by the roadside from a large cooler earning US$5 a day. Her husband works as a motorbike mechanic and gets a lot of business each day. His income averages about US$8 a day. The young couple has two children who are still too young to attend school. Veng has several business plans for the future. She needs a loan to be able to purchase mechanic tools to help her husband in his business, as well as a plot of land to sell later once prices go up. Veng expects a rise in land prices, since the volume of tourism in the province is growing at an exponential rate.

loans.use: Purchase of mechanic tools and land

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 30-year-old young merchant. She married Benjamin 11 years ago. Her husband is 35 years old. She has a 10-year-old son who is still in school. She has a booth where she sells all kinds of clothes in the municipal market of Itá. She tells us that that previously she used to do door to door sales until one day she decided to set up her own steady business seven years ago. She tells us that she is doing well and that she already has a good clientele. She sells all kinds of clothing like: T-shirts , shoes, jeans, shirts, etc. that she buys at the capital city. Her husband works as painter in Argentina and he comes every three months. Also he usually brings some goods to her, therefore she has exclusive clothing that you cannot easily buy in the area. This time she need a loan to buy of goods like: blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es una joven comerciante de 30 años de edad. Está casada con Benjamin hace 11 años. Su esposo ha cumplido los 35 años de edad. Tiene un hijo de 10 años que aún va a la primaria y es la adoración de la pareja. Tiene un puesto de venta de ropas de todo tipo que funciona en el mercado municipal de Itá. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante, hasta que un día decidió montar su negocio estable. De ese momento ya han transcurrido 7 años. Cuenta que le va muy bien y que ya tiene una clientela muy bien formada. Vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir como: remeras, calzas, jeans, camisas, etc. que compra de la ciudad capital. Su esposo trabaja como pintor en la Argentina y viene cada tres meses. También suele traerle mercaderías de dicho país por lo que tiene prendas exclusivas que no se consiguen con facilidad en la zona. En esta ocasión necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como ser: blusas, remeras, jeans y todo tipo de ropas de estación.

loans.use: Buy blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidos (United Women) Group 6

texts.en:
Cloreta Y. lives in a very poor Haitian community outside of El Seybo with her husband, her youngest child (18 years old) and two grandchildren. Her three other children (ages 22, 26 and 29) live in the city of Higuey. Cloreta has a small collection of food products, a “paletera,” that she stores in her house and sells to her neighbors. She says the most difficult thing about her business is having enough money to buy rice, because it is in high demand but also very expensive. Cloreta has successfully paid back four loans to Esperanza and is now requesting her fourth. With this loan of $900, she plans to buy even more products to sell so that she can increase her profits and improve her way of life. She and the other four members of her group are pictured here, meeting with their loan officer to prepare to receive the next loan. This group is part of the larger Bank of Hope called “Mujeres Unidas,” or United Women.

Note: This is a group loan for five people. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food and grow her business

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan was born in 1956. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in the Absheron region. He is married and has 4 children. 10 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.en: Ravshanoy Bekmurotova  is a 30 year old widow with 2 children. For the past 12 years, Ravshanoy has dedicated herself to selling eggs in Istaravshan's central market. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband's income. As a result, she decided to invest the small amount of savings that her and her husband were able to collect over many years and started her business. She has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs which has slowly helped increase her earnings. Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. Ravshanoy has worked with IMON for loans over the past two years and, despite the competition, she is starting to see better results from her endeavors. She proposes to continue with the loans which have benefited her business greatly.

loans.use: To purchase additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S., 49 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de niébé, arachide, piment, poivre et cube maggi. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de sa famille.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fatou S., age 49 , is a widow with six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Mbousnack for six years. She want to bolster her business selling black-eye peas, peanuts, chili peppers, black pepper, and Maggi bouillon cubes. Her income allows her to ensure her family's expenses are covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Gabriela Soledad

texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Alelí Village Bank.

Gabriela is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 16, 9 and 3 years old. She sells hamburgers from a vending cart, but would like to open up a restaurant. Her hamburgers are homemade and sell very well, so she expects to have a lot of customers.

Gabriela is requesting a loan of 1750 soles to buy tables and chairs for the restaurant. She has already found a space to use in a high-traffic area on Manco Capac Street in the center of the city of Ayacucho.

This is Gabriela’s third loan cycle with the Alelí Village Bank. She says that FINCA has helped her by providing her with easily accessible investment capital. She finds the training/education sessions provided by her loan officer to be very helpful, and says that her work with FINCA has taught her to be punctual. She has almost 1000 soles in her FINCA savings account, and says she never would have saved this much were it not for the help of the institution. 

Gabriela’s dream is to eventually open up a soda fountain-style restaurant that would be open all day and sell cakes, pastries, and coffee in addition to meals.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for restaurant

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest B. is 30 years old. He is single with one kid who is currently in school. Ernest is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phone has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication.

He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him procure a stock of mobile phone and accessories. He hopes the loan would enable him to increase savings to expand his shop to include the sale of iPods and digital cameras. He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He does not sell on group meeting days and his picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Koné est  un célibataire de 28 ans qui vit chez son oncle dans le quartier Hérémakono de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il abandonna l’école dès son jeune âge au profit de la photographie qu’il a appris  auprès d’un de ses cousin. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, Monsieur Moussa Koné maîtrise son activité et est très apprécié avec une réputation et une notoriété exemplaire. En plus de sa traditionnelle activité qu’est la photographie il fait de l’animation musicale lors de différentes cérémonies(baptèmes, mariages, aniversaires...) 
Dans le souci de faire prospérer ses affaires il décida d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter un appareil photo et un appareil de sonorisation. Il s’approvisionnera en ces différents articles cités ci-dessus à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des commerçants spécialisés du domaine. Ses clients sont généralement les jeunes qui affluent beaucoup plus pendant les jours feriés, les congés et vacances scolaires. C’est pendant ces périodes  que ses activités sont très élévés.
Moussa  Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage ouvrir un autre studio, subvenir à ses besoins et enfin fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Moussa Koné is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his uncle in the Hérémakono neighbourhood of Bougouni, Mali. He left school at a very young age in order to do photography which he learned from one of his cousins. He has seven years' experience and has mastered photography. He is very popular and enjoys an excellent reputation. In addition to photography, he plays music at various ceremonies (baptisms, weddings, birthdays...) He decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program in order to bolster his business. This is his second individual loan; the first loan has been properly repaid. He will use the loan to buy a new camera and sound system. He will travel to Bamako, Mali's capital, to make his purchases, buying from specialized stores. His customers are usually young people who come most often during school holidays and school breaks: sales are highest at those times. Moussa Koné expects to make 65,000 FCFA monthly. With this income, he plans to open another studio, support himself and finally be able to start a family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera and a sound system.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met H. is 45 years old, and lives with his wife in Battambang, Cambodia. He works as a moto-taxi driver and earns around $28 each day. His wife, pictured here, earns $5 by selling charcoal in the community. This couple lives with seven children, four of whom are students and one is a construction worker. Met H. is asking for a loan for his wife to purchase rice and charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en: Lazaro J. Jr. manages a variety store  as his main source of income to raise his family. He is maried with seven children,  five of whom are in school. Lazaro has also a skills in cooking. He wants to engage in a food vending business which will be situated beside his variety store. Being an excellent cook, Lazaro is confident that he could gain patronage from their neighbors and even in their neighboring villages. He aspires to improve the building structure of his variety store and put up a food vending stall as well. Lazaro believes that this is the best thing he could do so he can send his cildren to school.  He is requesting an additional loan of PHP11000 to finance his plan.

loans.use: To improve the structure of his variety store and an extension stall for his food vending business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2008.Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ sản xuất kinh doanh đồ gỗ và lương lái xe của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 34 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, the business that brings the main source of income for her family is making and trading furniture. Together with the salary of her husband who is a driver, the total income of the family is VND 4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 9,000,000 to invest more in the business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for furniture making and trading

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Horadiz settlement. This man was born in 1965. He has been in a dairy business for 7 years. Now, he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 3 cows for improving his dairy business. Rafig is married and has 5 children.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Tujumuike Group

texts.en:
Amosi M., 27, is married with three children ages, 12, 10 and 4. He has a clothes business where they print and make different fashions to sell. He started this business about ten years ago. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $177.

This will be Amosi’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his businesses and also bought a zigzag machine and has paid back his loans successfully. He wants to use the new loan to increase his capital and to buy more material.

Amosi will share this loan with his group Tujumwike, which totals 16 members. The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amosi is the only man.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy more material

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is 28 years old and she is married.

She has been a juice and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She belongs to Tujisaidie group loan (Group code 2102). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Zuhura is looking for loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more juice and bread to sell. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more juice and bread to sell

loans.name: Maria Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora María Eulogia tiene 23años.  Está casada con el Señor Cristhian Román y ellos tienen un hijo menor de edad. Ellos tienen una despensa en su domicilio desde el año 2006. Venden todo tipo de productos comestibles, bebidas, alimentos a granel, entre otros. El Señor Cristhian posee un pequeño equipamiento de discoteca, el cual alquila los fines de semana a pequeños eventos del barrio, también se dedica a la poda de arboles para la ANDE (Administración Nacional de Electricidad).

Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el stock de mercaderías en la despensa, así como también para la adquisición de una consola para el equipamiento de discoteca,, con lo cual podrán generar mejores ingresos para su familia y podrán cumplir lentamente su anhelo de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Eulogia is a 23-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Cristhian Román, with whom she has a young son. She and her husband have run a general store in their home since 2006. They sell all types of edible products, drinks, and food in bulk, among other goods. Mr. R. has his own D.J. equipment, which he rents on weekends for neighborhood events. He also provides tree trimming services for the ANDE (National Electricity Administration).

This loan will be useful in increasing inventory for his general store, as well as purchasing a mixer for his D.J. equipment, with which he will be able to generate better profits for his family so that they can slowly realize their dream of finishing construction of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Zahra Group

texts.en: Zahra is the leader of Zahra group. There are four members in this group and they live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total requested amount is 40,000 AFN. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Zahra and Torpekay want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. Salaha wants a loan for her son’s business of selling gasoline. Nasema wants a loan for her son’s general store. They appreciate this loan process and want to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To sustain their businesses

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es: La señora Nervith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Nervith, con el apoyo de su pareja y de Manuela Ramos y teniendo  la habilidad para la costura, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos y confecciones, hechas por ellas mismas.En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Nervith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada e Independiente, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nervith belongs to the Siempre Unidas Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent son. With help from her significant other and Manuela Ramos, and having the ability to sew, Nervith decided to set up her own business in her own house. Sales are going well for her. She works on orders and clothes that she has made by herself. She currently continues making clothes, and she has loyal customers who come to her house every day to buy her work and their orders. She waits on them with her characteristic kindness. With the loan for 3,000 PEN she wants to buy meters of different types of fabric; instruments that she uses like scissors, sewing needles and machine needles, pins; and buttons. Nervith now feels very fulfilled and independent with the desire to make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and work instruments

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. C. is 48 years old and is a native of Guija in Gaza province. She moved from Guija to Boane with her parents when she was a child.

Teresa works in the Boane central market mainly selling produce, her best selling products being onions and potatoes. She is able to buy a sack of potatoes for MT 70 and sell them for MT 110 and buy a sack of onions for MT 80 and sell them for MT 140. She has been working in the market for the past twenty years and originally learned her trade in Swaziland.

Teresa is requesting this loan to help further diversify her products to satisfy customer demand. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku. Her first loan was for MT 10,000. Teresa earns around MT 10,000 a month and is able to set aside money each month in a savings account at the BIM bank.

Teresa studied through the ninth grade but was forced to stop due to pregnancy and the necessity to properly raise her child. She is married to a mechanic and is the mother of four children aged 18, 22, 24 and 26. She also supports two nieces and her mother, to whom she sends remittance payments.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Aleida Antonia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Aleida V. se dedica a laborar en la venta de electrodomésticos y de juguetes que ella misma posee en su establecimiento que es muy visitado por los clientes para adquirir sus productos.

Es de mucha importancia hacer el señalamiento que ella se ha destacado como excelente comerciante en su negocio logrando satisfacer a sus clientes y hoy en día acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los juguetes y los electrodomésticos para así continuar adquiriendo ganancias en el negocio.
texts.en:
Aleida V. sells household appliances and toys in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She carries these products in her establishment, which is well frequented by customers buying these products. It is very important to note that she has excelled as a business woman. She has achieved customer satisfaction. She now comes to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy toys and household appliances to continue to get earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household appliances and toys

loans.name: Iftikhor

texts.en:
N. Iftikhor is 22 years old. He is not married yet. Iftikhor has very large family. So that, to support his parents Iftikhor has been running his own business for 2 years. He is selling the perfumery like perfume for women and men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Today Iftikhor requests 7500 Somoni as he is planning to expand his business and increase the capital and after receiving of large income He would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in 12 months. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.Modesta, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, vive sola y es ella quien administra su negocio. También se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que los vende bien heladitas y al gusto del cliente.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará paquetes de gaseoas, en  diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Modesta, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Sra. Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Sueño” (My Dream), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 64 years old, married, and the mother of 4 adult children who have their own families.

She sells carbonated beverages, a business that keeps her very calm and happy. Modesta lives alone and manages the business by herself. She also rents out rooms, so she is capable and responsible in making her monthly loan payments to her Communal Bank. She continues with her business and tells us that she is doing well because cold drinks have good sales and customers like the taste.

With this loan of 1700 soles, she will buy packages of soft drinks in different flavor, sizes, and brands. She will also buy mineral water, carbonated and non-carbonated.

Modesta is very proud that she was able to start a business and can assure herself of a peaceful retirement. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and being an advocate for other women who want to succeed and provide for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es:
Sindy tiene 20 años, es una joven alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El puesto de artesanías de Sindy está ubicado en el Parque Bolognesi (parque importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es uno de los más llamativos debido a las artesanías tan bonitas que elabora y vende, además se puede encontrar de todo; desde llaveros, hasta prendas tejidas a mano. Lo que más le gusta a Sindy de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mayor comodidad.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Sindy con MFP y está muy feliz de la nueva oportunidad de crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más material para elaborar sus artesanías y así implementar mejor su stock.
texts.en:
Sindy is a lively and easygoing 20-year-old who lives at home with her parents. What she wants most is to excel in life. Sindy's crafts booth is located in Bolognesi Park (a major park in the city of Juliaca) and is one of the most eye-catching due to the beautiful crafts that she makes and sells. One can find a bit of everything at the booth, from keychains to garments woven by hand.

What Sindy likes the most about her job is talking with customers. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult thing to be having to stay all day in her sales booth. In the future Sindy hopes to have a bigger store where she can bring her customers greater comfort and convenience.

This is Sindy's third loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, a Kiva Field partner), and she is very happy to have this new opportunity for a loan. In her communal bank she is a very supportive member with the rest of her business partners. With the 1200 Peruvivan soles (US$425), she will buy more materials to make her crafts so she can increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials to make crafts

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks to earn income to satisfy the needs of her children and husband. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Aopheasang Village Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is the leader of a group with four members who all live in Aopheasang village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom use the motorbike with a cart to transport goods and passengers, while the other is a seller who helps with the mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old. Malou is single and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Malou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Malou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Malou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Malou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Malou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Malou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product range.

loans.name: Kassem
