texts.en: Kassem is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and five young children. In 1989, he started working in construction and tiling. Today, Kassem is hoping to further expand his business buy taking a US$ 1,000 loan to purchase scaffolding.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 39 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. Adenike is a hair dresser, and she has a salon where she styles hair and sells hair extensions and hair cream. For over 14 years now she has been running the business. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to improve her business and purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El señor Valentín M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Munaypata, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Valentín y su esposa trabajan en construcciones de viviendas particulares como albañil y ayudante respectivamente, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa (es una base de cemento y arena que una vez vaciada se convierte en un piso duro) para luego construir habitaciones en planta alta de su vivienda, ya que las habitaciones que tiene no brindan espacio suficiente para su familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Valentín M. lives in his own home in the Munaypata zone, an outlying district of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their four children. Mr. Valentín and his wife work in housing construction as a bricklayer and assistant, respectively. Their incomes support their family. The loan that he is soliciting is to build a “losa” (which is a cement and sand base that once set becomes a hard floor) in order to later build bedrooms on the top floor of their home. The bedrooms that they currently have do not provide sufficient space for their family. This is the eighth time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomical analysis qualifies them favorably and they are able to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of construction of a cement top floor in order to add on bedrooms to their home

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned and operated a coffee shop since 1999. He also offers narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop, like a billiard to attract younger customers and make his coffee shop a nice place to hang out and have a good time. This is his fourth loan cycle, and he has always paid on time.

Ahmad's previous loans helped him start a new business selling scrap metal. This second business is a way to improve his income. Ahmad is an active man who does his best to improve his family's financial situation, and he even said that if he had more time, he would consider starting a third job.

Ahmad is special in his work, because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop and enjoying a nice coffee or drink with their narguileh. His clients are his friends, neighbors, passersby, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the necessary merchandise for his shop. He decided on doing his business, because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans, groundnuts, millet, etc.

loans.name: Lizeth Nora

texts.es:
La señorita Lizeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, es socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior incompleto, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos.

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de labiales, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es terminar la carrera y graduarse, además que su negocio crezca. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Sra. Lizeth is a new member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ). She lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. Lizeth is 20 years old, single, and does not have any children. She did not finish her college education, so she earns her living buying and selling cosmetics.

This is her first loan. She is requesting 300 PEN to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products. Her dreams for the future are to finish her degree and graduate, as well as grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products

loans.name: Kasmiro

texts.en:
Kasmiro R. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to open up a food stall.  Kasmiro is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Maximina Z. se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria dando lugar a la crianza de ganado y actividades agricolas que ella misma lleva que es el fruto de sus manos.

Es necesario destacar que ella tiene 26 largos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y se ha convertido en una profesional trabajadora porque ha logrado llevar el sustento a su familia que habita en el municipio. El crédito será invertido para suplir sus necesidades y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones agropecuarias para beneficio propio y de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Z. A. has been working with CEPRODEL for three years as a co-debtor. On this occasion, she got a loan assuming the debt of Mr. Aler José Ramos. Z. lives in El Chote, in the El Sauce municipality. She works in agriculture and has her own farm and cattle. It is necessary to mention that she has 26 years of experience in this field.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversión en la actividad agropecuaria

loans.name: Daniel Humberto

texts.es: Daniel Humberto D. G. de 25 años de edad reside en el municipio de Osicala, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a ayudarle a Daniel en el negocio. Él posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, ropa interior y zapatos deportivos. La venta esta ubicada frente a al parque de Osicala, un lugar de mucho comercio ya que a sus alrededores se encuentra el mercado y el supermercado, así como también otras comerciales, esto es de mucho beneficio para Daniel ya que muchas personas transitan el lugar lo que lo hace más visible. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y calzado, de manera que sus ventas aumenten, ya que es esta la única forma en que se gana la vida. Tanto Daniel como su esposa son muy admirados en el lugar ya que ha pesar de su corta edad se esfuerzan en gran manera por obtener una vida estable.
texts.en:
Daniel Humberto D. G. is 25 and lives in the municipality of Osicala, in the province of Morazán. He lives with his wife, who assists him with his business. Daniel sells assorted clothing for men, women and children, including underwear and sports shoes. He sells from a location in front of the park in Osicala, where many people gather for shopping, as there is a market and supermarket nearby along with other stores, which helps Daniel and makes his business more visible to passerby. He seeks a loan in order to buy additional inventory of clothing and footwear so as to increase his sales, as this is his family's sole livelihood. Both Daniel and his wife are well-regarded in his town as they are hard-working young people who have attained a stable living through their own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara is 40 years old, married and has a child. She and her family live in Lagos. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for some years. She make clothes in different styles and has three apprentices with her at the shop. She also sells tailoring materials, sarongs and other accessories and has been in this business for over fifteen years. She makes sure customers demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.
Omolara is requesting for a loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She thank lenders for their good work.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Richel's Group

texts.en:
Richel E. is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Richel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests mango to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $455 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Richel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 26th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and products for their businesses.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su hija en el caserío Huaca Blanca del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra en la región del mismo nombre, a màs de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que viajar hasta el pueblo central para adquirirlos. Por ello su negocio es bastante frecuentado y ella, consciente de la necesidad de sus clientes, trata de brindarles productos de calidad.

Adicionalmente tiene un terreno donde ha sembrado limones, los cuales cosecha con bastante regularidad y los vende a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona. Con estos ingresos ella solventa sus gastos familiares, por lo que da lo mejor de si para mantener sus actividades de la mejor manera.

Gladis desea adquirir más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Epyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 49 year old mother who lives with her daughter in the village of Huaca Blanca in the district of Tambogrande, where the main business activity is fruit production. This district lies in the province and region of Piura and is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, Gladis has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store located in her home. From there she offers her neighbors all types of everyday products. Otherwise they would have to travel into town to buy them. Her business is very busy, so Gladis is aware of the needs of her customers and tries to provide them quality products.

In addition, Gladis has land where she produces limes that are harvested regularly and sold to local processing factories. With this income, she is able to cover her family’s expenses and provide them the best so that they can maintain their activities.

Gladis wants to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales and generate better earnings. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN to help meet her goal.

Gladis is a woman who is well-known and respected by her neighbors. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: In Lekh Muoy village in Kandal province, all four members have selected Mrs. Touch C. as the group leader of their group loan. Each member will use their portion of their loan in various ways. Mrs. Touch C. is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family, while her husband, Mr. Thy Noun, is a construction worker who earns some money to support his family. Now they have a problem because their house is broken and they do not have money to repair it. So Mrs. Touch C. is asking for a loan to repair her own house. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, two are studying in the local public school, and the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To repair her own house

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús C., tiene 38 años de edad vive en San Ignacio, acompañada de sus hijos y su esposo. Él señor labora como soldador tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que apoyan a los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos mensuales, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 22 años.xzx

Uno de los principales problemas que afectan al negocio es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a su zona, ellos esperan a futuro próximo comprar un tanque de agua con el fin de almacenar para los días en donde no les suministren el vital liquido y convivan sin problema, por ahora solicita un préstamo que les permita la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y abonos orgánicos que favorezcan a  la siembra y se produzca una mejor cosecha, esta inversión a futuro favorecerá la economía de la familia y les permitirá incursionar a nuevas fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresa de Jesús C., age 38, lives in San Ignacio with her children and husband. Her husband works as a welder. They have 4 grown children who help with the household costs with their monthly earnings. They have been farmers for over 22 years. One of the main problems that affect the business is shortages of potable water which is not supplied to her zone. They hope in the near future to purchase a tank of water to store up for the days when this vital liquid is not supplied. For now they are requesting a loan which will allow them to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertilizers which are better for planting and produce a better harvest. This investment in the future will improve their family's economic condition and permit them to explore new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertlizers which are better for planting

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Mrs. Dul D. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband works in the farm fields with her.

The coming rainfall season is the time when it is easy to plant crops. However, Dul D. doesn’t have any supplies to use on her field. She now requests a $200 loan to be used to purchase fertilizer and seed to plant.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed to plant

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Dban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Triunfo es integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, tienen varios años de conocerse y son personas humildes y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

doña Aura Leticia V. es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su  negocio el cual es la venta de golosinas  en la escuela de su comunidad, Aura es madre de 5 hijos, los mas grandes le ayudan a la venta de golosinas. 
Aura y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante su familia.
Aura se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar  las ricas golosinas y sus tiempos libres lo dedica la familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.

Virginia de jesus A. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de dulces en su casa de habitacion, tiene 15 años de realizar este tipo de actividad. Virginia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya son profesionales.  Virginia y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante el hogar.
doña Virginia vende sus dulces a los alumnos que pasan por su casa. su tiempo libre lo dedica para asistir a la iglesia.

don Jose M. es una persona trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañon desde hace 7
años en su comunidad.
don Jose y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, tienen 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela.
Jose se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para despulpar la semilla y asi venderla.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de marañon.
texts.en:
The “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) group is composed of two women and one man. They have known each other for several years and are humble folk with a strong wish to get ahead. Following are details on the different activities they carry out: Aura Leticia V. is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her business of selling snacks in her local school. She has five children. The oldest ones help out in the snack shop. Aura and her husband work hard to help the family succeed. Aura rises at 5am to prepare the delicious snacks and she spends her free time with her family. The loan will be used to buy ingredients to make the snacks. Virginia de Jesús A. is an enterprising woman who sells candy in her home. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has two children who are now professionals. She and her husband work hard for their home’s success. Virginia sells candy to students that pass by her house. In her free time she goes to church. José Martínez is a hard working person who has sold cashews for the last 7 years in his community. He and his wife work hard together to have their family succeed. They have 4 children who are in school. José rises daily at 6am to dehusk the seeds for sale. He will use the loan to buy cashew nuts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortillas, lard, cooking oil, salt, condiments, beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, cheese, sugar, artificial flavorings and cashews.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun Some, 55, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1978 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; one is a tailor; another one weaves silk at home, and another attends school.

Mrs. Khon S. has been a silk weaver for 20 years, selling her finished products to a middleman who then resells them in Phnom Penh market. Her husband drives for a company in Phnom Penh. Khon is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge  qui  tourne autour de 39 ans, elles ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali).
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire avec l’institution et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente de condiments et produits alimentaires. 
Fanta S., la présidente du groupe détient un kiosque au bord du goudron uniquement pour la vente de pâte d’arachide. 
Elle s’approvisionne en gros auprès des sœurs catholiques pour revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 13500FCFA par mois qui la permettra de rembourser le prêt, venir en aide à son époux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise. 
Dans l’avenir Fanta S. compte venir au prêt individuel  pour être elle-même productrice de pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
The four women in the Benkadi group are all married and are on average 39 years old. They all have about 8 children and live in large traditional families in the town of San (in the Ségou region, republic of Mali).
This is  their first solidarity loan with the organisation and they became acquainted through family ties and living in the same neighbourhood.
They all practice almost the same activity of buying and selling condiments and foodstuffs.
Fanta S., the president of the group owns a stall on the side of the road solely for the sale of peanut paste.
She buys her supplies wholesale from some catholic nuns, to sell retail for cash or on credit to a clientele that is essentially made up of women.
She is counting on a monthly profit of 13500FCFA  which will enable her to repay the loan, help her husband, and reinvest in the business.
In the future Fanta S. plans to request an individual loan in order to become a producer of peanut paste herself.

loans.use: Purchase of peanut paste

loans.name: Nelly Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy contenta por eso ya que gracias a los créditos que recibe de la Fundación ha podido mejorar su situación a través de su negocio. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, solo su hija menor vive con ella en su casa. Su marido trabaja en un taxi que es de su propiedad en Manta.

Es un ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares decidió hace ya 5 años dedicarse a la venta de sabanas y edredones. Trabaja tres días a la semana  recorriendo con su mercadería, la misma que ofrece a sus conocidos o clientes nuevos que tengan referencia de los clientes que ya tiene, hace esto porque ella  deja a crédito y no quiere inconvenientes con los cobros, los mismos que realiza cada quince días. La mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que la que tiene es muy poca y necesita para los pedidos que tiene. Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Nelly has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and she is very happy because of that for it's thanks to the loans she gets from the Foundation that she’s been able to improve her situation through her business.  She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children who are all now adults. Only her youngest daughter still lives with her in her house.  Her husband drives a taxi that he owns in Manta.

She is a housewife who decided five years ago, in order to have her own source of income and help with family expenses, to start selling bed sheets and comforters.  She works three days a week taking her merchandise to her acquaintances or new customers that are recommended by current customers.  She does this because she sells on credit and she doesn’t want to have any problems at collection time which occur every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza.

This loan is to buy more merchandise because she has very little left and needs it for the pending orders she has.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is 39 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Purok Pasayan, Brgy. Tomongtong, EB. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF, and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. Bella is currently borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can purchase a new engine and crab nets. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase new engine and crab net

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir B. is a 56-year-old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in the small village of Sabirabad. He has raised crops since 2005 and all the members of his large family help him. Tahir has three children. 

Tahir usually sells crops in the central bazaar or to local traders. He would like to produce a new type of apple for next season and he needs good seeds and fertilizer. That is what he is going to buy with his loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. and her husband, Mr. Samnang Pouk, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2007 and have one son. Ny is a weaver, a skill she learned after her marriage and Samnang is a farmer. Ny is asking for a loan of $250 to provide capital for her husband’s farm and for her weaving business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband’s farm.

loans.name: Felizaida

texts.en:
Felizaida R. is from the town of Banga. She is 52 years old. Felizaida is married and has 10 children. To make a living, Felizaida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Felizaida does everything to be a good mother to her children and a good wife to her husband. 

Felizaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felizaida has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Felizaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP (Philippine pesos) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Davaamunh

texts.en:
Davaamunh is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his parents' enclosure. His wife works as a salesperson in the Merkuri market in the city.

Davaamunh started his business in 2007 with the help of his friend. He makes a variety of wooden items and furniture according to his customers' orders to support his family. Since 2010, he has operated this business on his own. After years of hard work, he was able to build a workplace in his enclosure. For the future, he plans to decorate his own workplace. Davaamunh is a modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to make repairs and decoration in his workplace.

loans.use: to make repairs and decoration in his workplace

loans.name: Samila

texts.fr: Samila M. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et son niveau d’éducation est A2.  Elle a 4 enfants entre 4 et 13 ans, et 3 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 basins, 20 pantalons et 2 couvre-lits.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’accroitre son capital a fin d’avoir plus de rentabilité.  Elle voudrait être grossiste, éduquer ses enfants et avoir le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samila M. is a merchant and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda, and has an A2 level of education.  She has four children, ages 4 to 13, and three of them go to school.  

Samila is going to use her loan to buy 15 basins, 20 pairs of pants, and 2 bed covers.  Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital in order to be more profitable.  She would like to be a wholesale merchant, to educate her children, and to have a happy and healthy family.

loans.use: Buying clothing, basins, pants, and bed covers

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el sector Baldera, una zona rural agrícola y ganadera del distrito de San José, el cual se encuentra ubicado a más de 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de veinte años a la ganadería, él  cría su ganado en el Sector Gallito ubicado en el distrito de  San José asimismo cuenta con algunas vacas de las cuales comercializa a diario la leche que producen entre los vecinos de la zona, y el resto de ganado vacuno lo alimenta para que alcancen un buen nivel desarrollo y comercializarlo entre los negociantes de la zona. Con estos negocios él se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Federico desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado y mantenimiento de alfalfa que servirá en un futuro de alimento de ganado. Con una buena alimentación sus animales podrá rendir más leche y esto le permitirá percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es su establo propio.
texts.en:
Federico is a 57 year-old father who lives together with his wife and son in Baldera, a rural, agricultural and livestock-raising area of San José district, more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Federico has been raising livestock for more than twenty years.  He raises his livestock in Gallito, in San José district.  He has some cows whose milk he sells every day to his neighbors.  He feeds the rest of his cattle until they reach a good level of development and then sells them to traders in the area.  Through these businesses, Federico gets his family ahead in life and covers his daily expenses.

Federico would like to acquire balanced animal feed for his cattle and maintain his alfalfa crop that will serve as future feed for his cattle.  With good feed, his animals will be able to produce more milk and this will allow him to make more profit.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Federico is a father who is always looking out for his family's well-being and development.  His biggest wish is to own his own cow shed.

loans.use: To acquire balanced animal feed for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have his car refitted

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
S. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children.  Both of his children are currently in school.  Wilberforce has a business selling spare parts, which he has had for eight years.         

To help expand his business, Wilberforce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wilberforce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Wilberforce hopes to build a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en: Chourb R. is married and resides with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Chourb is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. His wife is employed at the facotry, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Chourb is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice to stock for sale. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en:
Chynar S., 40, leads this group. She resides in Tokmok and works as a cook, while her husband is an assistant machine operator in a local plant. After work, Chynar finds the time and enthusiasm to cope with the household chores, including taking care of livestock that the family has owned for three years. Since then, the livestock number has grown rapidly and Chynar plans to add more by using the loan from Kiva. The monthly income of 2000 soms and future profits will help her repay the loan in a timely fashion.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
El señor Evaristo N. vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que dependen de el, viven en el barrio Mongollano de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Evaristo tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas, tambien propietario de un negocio de venta de golosinas que es atendido por su esposa.
En dicho negocio tiene un taller en donde tambien repara las bicicletas a las personas que necesitan de dicho servicio, tiene un empleado que repara y Evaristo se encarga de atender la venta de los repuestos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para surtir su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es que su taller sea el mejor de la zona y llegar a vender bicicletas de buena calidad.
texts.en: Mr. Evaristo N. lives with his partner and their three dependent sons.  They live in the Mongollano neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo.  Evaristo has a business selling bicycle parts and accessories.  He also owns a business selling sweets that is run by his wife.  In his business he has a repair shop for bicycles.  He has an employee who repairs bicycles and he works selling the parts.  He will use the loan to buy parts to stock his business.   His greatest dream is that his shop be the best in the area and that he will start selling high-quality bicycles.

loans.use: buy bicycle parts, tires, pumps, rims, brakes, brake cables, seats, handle bars, patches, glue, pedals, clamps

loans.name: Leh We Pray Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Leh We Pray” group. They are small scale businesswomen, based in Makeni city. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, to enable them to further improve upon the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured, on the right, is Zainab K.. She is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Makeni. She is married to a carpenter and the couple has 3 children – 2 in secondary school and the other is not yet of school going age.

Zainab sells rice, oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for 18 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities, to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She’s a school dropout, of only grade 6. She has 2 children, one of whom attends school.


Musu has been selling used clothes for the past 4 years and she enjoys it a lot. She’s requesting a loan to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business. She plans and hopes to be a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yermandé Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé  le 31 mai 2010.IL est composé de 25 femmes membres issus du même quartier.
Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adia Christine est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 35 ans et s'occupe de ses trois enfants.
Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de tissus et des effets de toilettes.En plus elle travaille comme femme de ménage pour accroitre ses revenus.

La couture constituait son activité antérieure,domaine dans lequel elle possédait une courte expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des articles de toilettes en quantité suffisante pour majorer son chiffre d'affaire.

Son objectif est d'acquérir une maison et soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
The Yermandé solidarity group was created 31 May 2010. It consists of 25 members from the same neighborhood.
Their main activity is small retail business.

Mrs. Christine A... is responsible for the group. She is 35 years old and takes cares of her three children.
Her main activity is small trade of clothing fabrics and toiletries, in addition to which she works as a housekeeper to increase her income.

Sewing was her previous activity, an area where she gained some experience.

Her loan will allow her to buy fabrics and toiletries in sufficient quantities to increase her turnover.

Her objective is to acquire a home and to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy toiletries

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. For the past five years, Richard has owned a meat shop where he sells pork and beef. 

Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy pigs to butcher and sell. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a 27-year-old single man, has operated a motorbike transport business for the past three years to earn a living. He also farms to supplement his income. Daniel's dream is to own a van for his transport business in the future.

Grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially, he is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Andrea Priscila

texts.es:
La Señorita. Andrea es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica.
 
La Señorita Andrea tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al comercio.

Nuestra socia siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres también es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, labora en esto 2 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa de niños para surtir más su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Srta. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Divino Niño Jesús”. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its cold climate and the warm hearts of its people. Cuenca was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of its architectural beauty.

Srta. Andrea is 22 years old. She lives with her parents who are merchants. Andrea followed in the example of her parents and also works as a merchant. She has been selling all types of clothes for two years. Andrea works Sunday through Sunday, but not on an established schedule.

She is taking out her fourth loan with the Communal Bank. Andrea will invest in the purchase of trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing so that she can restock her business with more merchandise. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es:
Brenda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio en el que vende cinchos, lámparas, bolsas plásticas, calzado entre otra mercadería, este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años y su madre fue quien le enseño el comercio, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, para surtir el negocio, comprara calzado, cinchos, controles de televisores, lámparas de mano y más artículos que le hacen falta, esta compra contribuirá para que su negocio cuente con todo lo necesario para atender  a la clientela.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es surtir el negocio, esperando ganar mejores ingresos por sus ventas, además de estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda lives with her husband and 2 children, aged 8 and 6 respectively. She has a business selling belts, lamps, plastic bags, and shoes, among other merchandise. She initiated the business many years ago after her mother taught her commerce. Her daily hours of sale are from 7:00 am until 3:00 pm.

Brenda is soliciting a loan to buy merchandise to resupply her business. She will buy shoes, belts, TV controls, flashlights, and other articles she currently lacks. This purchase will help provide her business with everything she needs to attend to her customers.

Brenda's objectives are to restock her business, hoping to earn better income from sales, in addition to being with her family more.

loans.use: to buy shoes, belts, TV controls, flashlights, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi D. treinta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos, en una zona D. mucho trafico D. personas. Ella tiene una venta D. comida rápida, tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, emparedados, entre otros. Todos con un sabor inigualable, su comedor  es muy conocido en la zona pues es higiénico con comida D. calidad y a precios accesibles; Ana está llena D. ilusiones, para ella trabajar por sus sueños es lo que hace su vida más interesante, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, verduras, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Ana Daysi tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Ana Daysi is thirty four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children in a highly trafficked area. She sells fast food such as sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, cakes and more. All of them are unsurpassed and her restaurant is well known in the area for being clean and having accessible prices. Ana has a lot of dreams. For her, working for her dreams is what makes life interesting. She wants to see her business grow and that is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan. This will allow her to buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts, among others. Ana Daysi has faith that with hard work she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает мужскую одежду. Сама Зилола занимается посевом злаковых культур. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Zilola lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 34 years old, married.  Her husband is involved in sales at a market.  He primarily sells men's clothing.  Zilola is involved in sowing cereal crops.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Joyce is the facilitator for Furaha Group in Chwele. Joyce lives with her husband Mourice and four children. Joyce joined One Acre Fund in 2010 in order to make more profits from her maize harvests.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2011, Joyce harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land, a very good harvest by her measure.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.

With the proceeds from her maize harvest, Joyce will pay for school fees, home improvements, save for the future, invest in livestock, and possibly invest in other business ventures.

In 2012, Furaha Group will plant 8.5 acres of land, with each farmer planting between .5 and 1.5 acres.

In the picture above, Joyce and her co-group members are holding young livestock (goats and one rabbit), while also showing off cobs from the recent harvest. The Furaha field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 28 years old and lives in the Kakata town. She is single and has three children aged 1 to12, all of whom live at home and are presently in school. 

For the past three years Cecelia has been involved in the sales of ladies clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses and skirts for her business. The problem she’s faced is the rainy season. 

She started this business by helping her mother to sell. She makes a lot of profit, and she has more customers every day. It makes her proud to have money in her home every day. Cecelia hopes to build her own shop,

loans.use: to purchase more blouses and skirts for her business.

loans.name: Senanmi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENANMI est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Senan Léa  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Senan Léa  est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Senan Léa est marié à  un conducteur du nom de Etienne. Le couple a un  enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Les différentes charges de la maison sont assurées par Senan Léa  et son mari. Senan Léa a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Senan Léa  a appris le métier de coiffure. Senan Léa  exerce cette activité passionnément depuis quatre ans environs. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Senan Léa  vend des produits cosmétiques et des mêches. Senan Léa s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques et en mêches dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Senan Léa sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENANMI, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group SENANMI is composed of three persons who lives in the same district in Benin. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their business. The group's representative, by the name of Senan Léa, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 24 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver by the name of Etienne. They have one child in school and in their care. The different household expenses are covered by Senan Léa and her husband. 

To provide for herself and her child, Senan Léa learned the trade of hairdressing. She has been operating her business with passion for about four years. Aside from this business, which enables her to support herself and her family, she sells cosmetics and hair extensions at a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Senan Léa and the other members of the group SENANMI are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
El grupo París lo conformaran tres personas trabajadoras  y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María José de 22 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella está casada, su esposo tiene una pequeña panadería familiar y tiene un niño de 3 años y espera su segundo hijo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en ropa.
Las otras integrantes son Vilgensa de 37 años quien tiene una comideria e Ileana Patricia tiene una pulpería hace un año.
texts.en:
The "Paris" group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is María José, who is 22, and has been selling clothing for four years. She is married, has a three year-old son, and is expecting her second child. Her husband has a small family bakery. She will use the loan to buy clothing. 

The other members are Vilgensa who is 37, and has an eatery, and Ileana Patricia who has had a small general store for a year.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for merchandise

loans.name: Duo Guiados Por Dios Group

texts.es: Duo Guiado por Dio. Este duo esta integrado por doña Brenda de 20 años,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa variada para dama,caballero y niño.desde hace 1 años ella nos cuenta que en tan poco tiempo ella a visto un crecimiento en su negocio, y se siente muy contenta, y por eso se dirije a fape y Kiva solicitando apoyo para compra de ropa nueva variada, y nuevos diceños, al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de concumo diariom,y por la misma razon esta solicitando este credito,el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y tener variedades como estilo en ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
One member of Duo Guiado por Dio is Brenda, 20, who sells clothing for men, women and children. She has been doing this for one year and tells us that in such a short time she has seen growth in her business and is very happy. For that reason she came to Kiva asking for support to buy new assorted clothing and new designs. 

Her loan partner sells basic goods and is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise. Their dreams are to have a larger store and to have greater varieties of clothing styles to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has five children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education except the eldest one who is 15 years old.

Her husband is a driver by profession and is the only breadwinner in family. He also runs a business of selling animals. He buys goats and sheep in their early age, raises them and sells to butchers for profit.

Bushra is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She also provides full support to her husband in operating his animal selling business. In his absence she takes care of the animals and gives them food.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal selling business. With the loan investment he will purchase goats and sheep to sell for profits after raising them.

He has been operating his business for the past two years and Bushra is very confident that an investment will be productive for him and will increase his income.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to raise.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Mujeres Unidas forma parte D. la fundación desD. el año 2007, está integrado por  20  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación. Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan. 
Una D. las señoras es Olga, quien se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, negocio gracias al cual pueD. sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar en los gastos D. la casa. Ella comenta que tiene buena venta, en especial los fines D. semana, que es cuando la mayoría D. las personas no trabaja y está libre. 
Debido a que le va muy bien, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en du negocio, y es por eso que piD. el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, licores y demás bebidas con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes, además ya se acercan las fiestas D. fin D. año y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The committee of women, called Mujeres Unidas, or “United Women” has been part of the foundation since 2007. The committee is composed of 20 women who are working very happily. They are already in their 6th loan cycle. They work together and in solidarity within the foundation’s program for women entrepreneurs. The group stands out for working together and cooperatively. 
 
One of the women is Olga, who sells drinks. Her business allows her to help her family get ahead and contribute to the household expenses. She says that she has good sales, especially on the weekends, which is when most people don’t work and are free. 

Since it’s going really well, she wants to continue investing in the business, which is why she is requesting the loan to purchase beers, wines, liquors, and other drinks, which she will use to meet the demands of her customers. Additionally, the end of the year parties are coming up and she wants to be ready.

loans.use: purchase beer, wine, liquor, and other drinks

loans.name: Mankanay

texts.ru: Манканай 54 года, замужем, воспитала двоих детей.  Манканай  во время Союза работала дояркой в колхозе,  а ее муж – комбайнером. После развала советской системы колхозов, Манканай с мужем решили заняться откормом и перепродажей скота.  Начатое еще в 1995 году с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Также, на собственной земельной доле Манканай выращивает кормовые сельхозкультуры для животных, что позволяет ей экономить на  закупе корма для скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Манканай обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Манканай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mankanay is 54 years old, married, and has raised two children. During the Soviet times, Mankanay milked cows at a collective farm, while her husband operated a combine harvester. After collective farms ceased to exist, Mankanay and her husband decided to start their own farm, raising and selling animals. They started out in 1995, with 20,000 KGS, and today their farm brings in 10,000 KGS per month from sales of dairy and meat. Also, Mankanay grows various crops for the animals on her own land, allowing her to save money on feed. With the goal of increasing the number of heads of cattle on her farm, Mankanay has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 125,000 KGS, to purchase additional animals. Income from the loan will be used to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is a man with patience for and dedication to his work. He is 43 years old and is married with four industrious children. He is engaged in a farming business, where he plants rice as a source of income. He earned 10,000 pesos last crop and wishes to gain higher-than-usual income.

With the intent of improving his income, Leon is asking for a loan of 18,000 pesos to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can produce an abundant harvest to provide for the needs of his family, and in the future he could see all his children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: Renato, de 26 años es un hijo ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hermanos, quienes estudian. Ellos viven en casa de su padre ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Gracias a su esfuerzo, pudo comprar su propio motocarro, con lo que realiza trasporte público a diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Desde hace 20 años viene trabajando en la empresa de trasportes “turismo Tayacaja”. Cuenta que en obtiene de ganancias mínimas semanales un promedio de 200 nuevos soles, a la semana. Pero días festivos y de celebraciones del pueblo, obtiene mejores ganancias. Asimismo los fines de semana, viaja a su pueblo a cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz y papa, los cuales siembra en terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. En época de cosecha, viaja ala ciudad de Huancayo a comercializar sus alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “santa rosa del estanque” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Renato, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y guano de islas; para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en: Renato, 26 is an exemplary son. He lives with his 3 brothers, who are studying. They live in their father's house located in the town of Pampas. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to buy his own trickshaw with which he transports people to different parts of the city. For the last 20 years he has been working for the transport company "Turismo Tayacaja". He says that he makes a small weekly profit of about 200 nuevos soles (PEN). However, on public holidays and when there is a festival in town he makes more profit. Similarly, at the weekends. he goes back to his town to take care of his corn and potato crop, which he plants on land his parents left him. During harvest time, he goes to the city of Huancayo to sell his products to get a better return. He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosa del Estanque" and this is his 3rd loan with MFP and he hopes that with your help he will be able to reach his goals. On the other hand he promises to make his repayments as with his previous loan. In addition, he likes being a part of his communal bank as all the members are responsible people and very supportive. Renato, on receiving your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers and guano from the islands to spread among his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer propietario El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues es la única actividad  de la cual obtienen ingresos  para mantener a su familia.  Betty vive en anticretico en la zona  Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty has a son and lives with her husband.  He works as a driver, and he has his own vehicle.

She needs the loan for maintenance of the vehicle.  It is the only business activity they have to get income to support their family.

Betty lives in “anticredtico” (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the Obispo Bosque zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the 12th time she has worked with IMPRO, and the fifth time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the vehicle her husband drives in order to get more income to support the family.

loans.name: Humberto Gabriel

texts.en:
Humberto is 36 years old and has a shoes repair business, in this business he repair all kind of shoes from his clients and additionally has video games machines in his work place. He learned this activity from his father and he get this business approximately 10 years. Humberto needs a loan of US$ 925 to purchase raw materials that he uses in his place and also purchase an additional video game machine because a lot of child came to his place to play. He offer to pay in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Humberto es un hombre de 36 años de edad que tiene un negocio de renovación de zapatos, es decir, ahí se hacen composturas a los zapatos de sus clientes, y adicionalmente tiene maquinas de videojuegos en su local. Él aprendió el oficio de su padre que también era zapatero y tiene con su negocio ya independiente cerca de 10 años. Humberto necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para comprar materiales que usa en su taller y adquirir una maquina adicional de videojuegos, dado que ha tenido mucha aceptación en esa zona. El plazo para pagar que solicita es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a video game machine to his business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua joined the family of Kaban Support Foundation (KSF) 3 years ago and has benefited from many of its programs, including learning how best to operate her business. She sells "wakye", a special rice and beans dish that is a favorite meal for locals. A loan of $750.00 will enable her to make and sell more food and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by renting a more spacious premise to accommodate all her clients and to purchase inventory

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.en:
Rita is 42 years old and is married. She has 5 sons; three of them are studying and two are married. Her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant. She started her business 5 years ago because she wants to help to her husband with the family expenses. Also her husband got sick and he did not have medical insurance so his medical costs were expensive and they did not have enough money to cover it. Rita does not have any employees at her business and her sons help her in their free time. She wants to see her sons with professional studies and for this reason she works very hard.

Rita is requesting a loan of US $ 250 to purchase merchandise for her business and offers to repay this loan in 3 months. She thanks you a lot for your support to continue her business growth.

This description was translated by Admic volunteer Joanna Lindoro

Rita tiene 42 años, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposos trabaja como mesero en un restaurante y 3 de sus hijos estudian y los otros 2 están casados. Ella inicio en el negocio desde hace 5 años con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo con el pago de las colegiaturas, y las cuentas del hogar, aparte de que su esposo no tenia seguro y los gastos médicos eran muchos ya que el se enfermo en ese tiempo. Rita no tiene empleados en su negocio y sus hijos le ayudan en sus ratos libres. Ella espera algún día ver a todos sus hijos profesionales y es por ello que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante.

Rita está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para invertir en mercadería para su negocio y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
T. Jennifer is 47 years of age, married with four children. Two of her children have completed University, one is in her second year and the last born is in senior three. She has been engaged in business for over ten years. Her first loan was USD 100 which she paid very well in four months. Her second loan was USD 225; she worked very hard and paid it in time.

She sells cosmetics in her shop and rears chicken which she sells to Makerere University and Hotel Equatoria. Jennifer’s shop is located in the heart of Kamwokya, a low-cost housing settlement area. She has a ready market for her products and this has helped her to repay her loans on time. On average, her cosmetics sales range between USD 30-40 per week. Meanwhile, she has ordered 2000 chicks from Ugachick breeders. Through her small businesses, she has managed to educate her children and looks forward to big savings after the two children finish school.

loans.use: Buy one carton of hair treatment oils, body lotions and 15 sacks of chicken feed.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Candri

texts.id:
Buy & sell cocoa seeds around is Ni Wayan Candri main profession, besides a mother of 3 children. After preparing household duties, especially needs of her 2 children to go to school, Ni Wayan Candri hurrily use her bicycle to buy chocolate seeds from citizens homes. With help and loan from Dinari, Wayan Candri could expand her business. Every day Wayan Candri could buy about 100 kg of cocoa, at a price of Rp11,500 (about US$13)/kg. After enough collected, Ni Wayan Candri would sell to a distributor at Rp12,000-13,000 (about US$13.20-14.50) depending on dryness level. daily nett profit could reach Rp50,000 (about $5.50). Ni Wayan Candri's hope is that her business could expand, so that she could fulfill family needs, and replace her bicycle to a motor cycle, since distances dhe has to cover is now farther away.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Membeli dan menjual biji Coklat ( cacao ) keliling bagi Ni Wayan Candri adalah pekerjaan utama selain sebagai ibu rumah tangga dengan 3 orang anak. Setelah selesai mempersiapkan keperluan rumah tangga terutama keperluan kedua anaknya untuk berangkat sekolah, Ni Wayan Candri bergegas mengambil sepeda gayung untuk berangkat mencari dagangan yaitu biji coklat di rumah para penduduk. Dengan pembinaan dan bantuan dana dari Yayaan DINARI Wayan Candri dapat mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi. Dalam satu hari Wayan Candri dapat membeli coklat sekitar 100 kilogram dengan harga Rp.11.500,- per kilogramnya. Setelah terkumpul cukup banyak, Ni Wayan Candri akan menjualnya kembali ke pengepul dengan harga Rp.12.000,- s/d Rp. 13.000.- tergantung dari tingkat kekeringannya. Keuntungan bersih setiap harinya dapat mencapai Rp.50.000,-. Dengan pekerjaan yang ditekuni saat ini harapan Ni Wayan Candri usaha dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memenuhi kehidupan keluarganya dan dapat menganti sepeda gayungnya menjadi sepeda motor karena jarak yang ditempuhnya kini semakin jauh.

loans.use:
To increase capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is married and has two children. For more than two years, she has sold women's clothes from her shop in Spitamen's main market. Her husband has a car and helps her by bringing goods from their home to the shop. He also acquires new inventory from nearby wholesale markets. Matluba has done very well as a businesswoman, with quick turnover of her inventory and many regular customers. She has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase winter clothes, which she knows will be very popular and sell very quickly during the busy holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes to sell in busy holiday season

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my husband Muhammad Aslam Raza and five sons and one daughter. My son runs his own tyre shop where he fixes punctures and rents out motorcycles and bicycles. With a loan he will purchase some equipment for his store. With profits, he can purchase a bigger shop later.”

loans.use: Purchase equipment for our son's tyre shop

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Putu Merta

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha and her husband, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan has been married for almost 25 years, but they don't have any children until now. To spend her spare time, Gusti Ayu started her business in pig farming. All the capital of Rp 3,000,000 that she got from Dinari is used to purchase 1 female pig that cost Rp 1,000,000 and the rest is used for purchasing the pig food and raising the piglets. Now Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha has 9 piglets. She spends Rp 10,000 daily for the pig food. The pig food mixtures consist of rice and wheat chaff. When the piglets reach the age of 2 months, they can be sold for about Rp 200,000 each as the pigs that she raises are local pigs that are cheaper than the superior type of pigs. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha really enjoys running this business because it has become her hobby and also she can earn additional income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha dan suaminya, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan, sudah berkeluarga hampir 25 tahun. Tetapi sampai saat ini belum juga dikaruniai anak. Untuk mengisi waktu yang terluang Gusti Ayu menyibukkan diri dengan usahanya yaitu beternak induk babi. Semua modal yang dipakai didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,-. Modal ini dipakai untuk membeli 1 induk babi yang harganya Rp. 1.000.000,- sisanya untuk pakan dan pemeliharaan anaknya. Saat ini induk Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha memiliki anak 9 ekor. Untuk biaya pakan setiap hari menghabiskan modal Rp.10.000.- Adapun campuran pakannya yaitu dedak padi dan dedak gandum. Setelah berumur kurang lebih 2 bulan, 9 ekor anak babi ini baru bisa dijual dengan perkiraan harga perekor mencapai Rp. 200.000.- karena babi yang dipelihara adalah jenis lokal jadi harganya lebih murah dari babi jenis unggul. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha sangat senang selain sebagai saluran hobinya, juga bisa menghasilkan pendapatan bagi keluarganya.

loans.use: To purchase female pig and pig food

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Farrukh is married and has one child. There is a lack of job opportunities where he lives. His father used to raise cattle, and now Farrukh raises cattle as well. This year, the winter was very harsh and it was difficult to take care of animals in such freezing weather. Farrukh's classmate recommended to go to MicroInvest for credit, and Farrukh bought several calves. He buys calves, takes care of them for a few months and then sells grown animals for a larger price. With his profit, Farrukh then buys more calves and the cycle is repeated. A MicroInvest loan would be very helpful to Farrukh.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Фаррух женат имеет одного ребенка. В его местности недостаточно рабочих мест. Его отец разводил скот, сейчас он занялся разведение скота. В этом году зима была очень суровая и для скотоводов в морзных условиях было очень трудно ухаживать за скотом. По совету одноклассников он обратился в Микроинвест, приобрел несколько голов скота. Он приобретает скот ухаживает за ним пару месяцев и продает по дороже, от имевшего дохода опять приобретает скот и этот цикл повторяется. Для этой поддержки ему помогла определенная сумма от Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
While dreaming of seeing her house finally completed, Marisol works every day in her cosmetics store as well as in her telephone call centre. She began work as a representative selling one brand of cosmetics, but then gradually bought stock so that she always had items available. At that point she decided to move from the small general store she ran to a shop specializing in cosmetics. She worked in the general store for one year but it wasn’t profitable, and it was also a worry to have her two small children so far away from her place of work. This was the reason she changed her business. Also, six months ago, she set up a telephone centre in her shop. She plans to invest some of her earnings, and the rest she will save for any emergencies that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Con el sueño de ver su casa construida en su totalidad Marisol trabaja a diario en su tienda de cosméticos y también en su locutorio. Ella empezó primero como consultora de una sola marca de cosméticos, poco a poco fue comprando cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, hasta que decidió cambiar la bodega que tenia por una tienda de cosméticos. Estuvo trabajando en su bodega durante un año pero no le era rentable, pues le costaba tener a sus dos hijos pequeños alejados de la mercadería. Así fue como se animó a cambiar de negocio. Por otro lado, hace medio año que implementó su tienda con el servicio de locutorio. Una parte de sus ganancias la vuelve a invertir y la otra las ahorra para cualquier emergencia que pueda surgir.

loans.use: Finish building her house and improve her store

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola is a decisive and diligent woman who with a great deal of effort has been able to implement her small but well-stocked grocery store. Thanks to her excellent service, her varied and well-priced products manage to capture more patrons each day. Yola’s wish is to make improvements to her store, with the aim of providing more comfort for her customers and better safeguarding her merchandise since she is located in a busy commercial sector in the city of Juliaca. With this project in mind, she comes seeking your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.
