Yola, es una mujer muy decidida y diligente, con mucho empeño ha logrado implementar su pequeña pero surtida tiendita de abarrotes, que gracias a su excelente servicio, variados y económicos productos logra captar a diario un número muy grande de compradores.El deseo de Yola es ampliar su local, con el fin de brindarles comodidad a sus clientes y seguridad a sus productos, debido a que su tiendita está ubicada en un lugar de mucho movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese proyecto en mente recurre en búsqueda de vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

loans.name: Gulbon

texts.ru:
Gulbon O. is a private businesswoman. She works at a local market in Tursun-Zoda selling women's shoes. She has been doing these types of things for 3 years. She plans on increasing her cash flow by investing more money. That is the reason she came to us for a loan. This will increase her combined family income, and at the same time, increase the range of items she sells at the market. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months. Gulbon lives with her husband and 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Орипова Гулбон частный предприниматель. Работает на рынке города Турсун-Заде. Торгует женской обувью.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Планирует увеличить товарооборот путем вливания новых средств. А деньги хочет получить в кредит , поэтому обратилась к нам. Это поможет улучшить семейный бюджет, а так же поможет увеличить выбор в ассортименте товара для населения. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Гулбон живет со свое семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей

loans.use: Increase cash-flow

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria O. lives in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She works very hard to be able to make improvements to her home, which has been in disrepair for a long time.

She is the mother of two children and she wishes to provide appropriate living conditions for their development. This is the reason she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan. She will use it to purchase construction materials to continue remodeling her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Maria O. se dedica a trabajar fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo se ha encontrado en mal estado en su localidad.

Ella es madre de dos hijos y con la necesidad de brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Por ello se apoya de Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con la remodelación de su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena A. is from Santani and is married with children. She works selling pork. She comments that she has worked in this field for 20 years. She has a small truck in which she does her buying and selling. She is very responsible with her clients. Her current desire is to fit out a store in part of her home and tend to it with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elena A. es de Santani, tiene 69 años, es casada con hijos. Se dedica a la venta de carnes de cerdos. Comenta que desde hace 20 años trabaja en esta actividad, tiene una camioneta en que realiza su trabajo de compra y venta. Es una señora muy responsable con sus clientes, su anhelo es habilitar una despesa en su domicilio y atender ella con sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (pigs)

loans.name: Theddy

texts.en: Theddy P. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur woman She is a married with five children. She has run a shop for five years now at the airport area in Dar-es Salaam. She sells a variety of items, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. Income from the business is used to feed the family and for paying school fees for her children. She requests a loan of $750 to help the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam J. is 27 years old. She is a widow with two children, aged 7 and 4. She has been selling clothes and shoes since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale in order to improve her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown daughters. She lives in Melitopol and owns a small business in the central city market. A skilled entrepreneur and married mother, Tatyana is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past six years, she has sold sportswear and footwear in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. The blend of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Tatyana's vending kiosk a point of attraction in the Melitopol market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped her to develop a strong client base. With a strong character and desire to see business growth, Tatyana has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine for the last 5 years. 

Currently, Tatyana has $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $800. Her monthly net profit is about $400. Today Tatyana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. With the additional income from profits, Tatyana hopes to continue improving her family's standard of living. Moreover, profit generated by her business will give Tatyana a chance to pay for her youngest daughter's education at one of the local colleges.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, para la construcción de una habitación, trabaja en el INSS como analista de prestaciones desde hace 14 años, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor de 9 años estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria y el menor de 2 añitos de edad; Xiomara es madre soltera y asume el rol de madre y padre para sus hijos, es una profesional muy responsable, honesta, con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral,  que ama su trabajo, ademas es muy trabajadora y lucha para que a sus hijos no le falte lo basico en el hogar.  Vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en la zona # 8, este barrio recientemente se poblo y cada día se va aumentando su población, el mayor sueño de Xiomara  es estudiar el proximo año una maestría,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita para así pasarse a vivir en su nueva casa,  se siente agradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is seeking refinancing of a 5th loan so she can invest in improvements to her home by adding a room. She has worked for INSS as a benefits analyst for 14 years. She has two children: the oldest is 9 and in the 2nd grade of elementary school; the youngest is 2-years-old. Xiomara is a single mother and assumes the role of mother and father to her children. She is a very responsible and honest professional, and has a strong desire for self-improvement, both personally and professionally. She loves her work, is very hard-working and strives to see that her children lack for none of the essentials in their home. She lives in the urban area of New Guinea, in Zone #8, a new neighborhood whose population grows daily. Xiomara’s greatest dream is to study next year for her master’s degree, have stability, health, a nice home, and to begin living in her new house. She feels very appreciative of AFODENIC, since with prior loans she has succeeded in building her home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of 1 home

loans.name: Nancy Adelaida

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Lima s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayetas y lana. Desde muy pequeña aprendió a bordar, lo cual le ayudó a tener un capital y así poder vender su artesanía en Puno. 

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2kg. de lana y 20 metros de bayeta.

Su sueño es tener más mercadería y un puesto seguro donde vender su artesanía.
texts.en:
Nancy is single and she is 27 years old. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and she lives in Lima, district of Juli, of the province of Chuchito, in the department Puno. She is a founder partner of Communal Bank " Mujeres al Progreso de Juli ". With the first loan of $100, she bought baize and wool. She learned to embroider from a very early age, which helped her to have a small capital and be able to sell her crafts in Puno. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 2 kg of wool and 20 meters of baize. Her dream is to have more merchandise and a stable place where to sell her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 kg. of wool and 20 mts of baize.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Dame B. Yvette, est née le 13 Janvier 1977 à Cotonou. Originaire de Porto-Novo, capitle politique du BENIN. Elle fréquenta jusqu'en classe de de CM2 avant d'abandonner. Elle alla ensuite en apprentissage de couture pour 5 ans. Elle reçût son diplôme de fin de formation et exerce son métier jusqu'à ce jour. Parrallèlement, elle vend de divers articles: les conserves, farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal, galettes. Mariée à LOKOSSOU Janvier, elle a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvette B. was born January 13, 1977, in Cotonou. She is originally from Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She went to school until the 5th grade, when she left school. She then went to train in dressmaking for 5 years. She received her certificate of completion and has been practicing this occupation until now. At the same time, she sells miscellaneous items: canned foods, cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks. She seeks this third loan to grow her business. She plans to stock up on cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, cakes. She is married to Janvier Lokossou and has 4 children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, 100 cakes

loans.name: Mankaa Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married to Jonathan and they have six children. She is a very hard-working woman as far as maintaining and bringing up the family is concerned. She and her husband are committed in working together for the upkeep of the family. She has also proved her efforts in helping her husband pay the school fees for the children. She has also been able to toil and till the soil to feed the family though with some difficulties as invaders come in at times and destroy her farm produce which now makes her to work extra hard selling food and in her provision store.

Cecilia has taken loan from GHAPE four times already. This is the fifth time she wants a loan from GHAPE. She knows this business will succeed because it is a business she has been doing for a long time and so she has a lot of customers. We do eat to survive and serving the community with cooked food more souls and lives will live to survive which will help the clan to grow from strength to strength.

The profit from her loan will be used to further her children's education and also improve the living standards of her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying beans, corn, and transportation

loans.name: Esra

texts.en: Esra A., a widow, raised her eight children by herself,  with the help of her variety store and food vending business at school canteen. For her, it wasn't easy to survive without someone who will share her burden. Her husband died 8 years ago leaving her the great responsibility for raising the children. This served as a challenge for her to work harder. HSPFI loans greatly helped her finance and sustain her business. As of now, she needs an amount of PhP11,000 as additional capital for her variety store and her food vending business at the school canteen.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her variety store and  food vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nargis M. Latif Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 39-year-old married lady. She has been a citizen of a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past 11 years. Nargis baji is married to M. L., who has driven a local, 32-seat bus for the past six years. Nargis baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her children do not go to school. Nargis baji has a wish to admit her kids to a school so that they are able to secure their future.

Nargis baji is a very determined lady who is working hard to achieve her wish. She sells thread by going to different shops on foot and earns some income. She successfully repaid her two loans from Kiva's partner Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more thread to sell.

Nargis baji is the group leader of another four women from her neighborhood. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes. Hina baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Abida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Rubina kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy thread to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. is a 30-year-old mother of five. Her husband Jerry makes buko (coconut) juice which he sells in the nearby school. Mary Ann does laundry for her neighbors just to help her husband. When she heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) entering their village to provide loans to mothers with dreams of putting up a business, she did not think twice before joining the organization to get capital. 

Mary Ann wants to venture into selling rice, dried fish, kerosene, and chicken. She applied for this loan to purchase the mentioned items to increase their income. She hopes to establish a successful grocery store in future and to stop doing laundry in order to take care of her children and business at home. She is positive that with her initial capital accessed through ASHI and KIVA, her dreams of sending her children to a university will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, five kilos dried fish, 2 liters kerosene, and 2 pieces of chicken

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru: Шавкатчон, молодой человек 29 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. С раннего утра до поздней ночи пасет стадо на пастбище. Жена нигде не работает. Помогает по хозяйству своей свекрови. Шавкатчон пока живет с родителями. В этом году его младший брат женится, и потом Шавкатчон отделит свое домохозяйство от отца. Но уже Шавкатчон старается прикупить для себя скот, чтоб когда его отделит отец у него было на что жить.
texts.en:
Shavkatjon, 29, is married and has 3 children. Shavkatjon is a cattle farmer. From dawn till dusk, Shavkatjon is herding cattle. His wife is a house maker. She helps he mother-in-law with household chores, as Shavkatjon and his family lives with his parents. This year, Shavkatjon's younger brother will get married. Then, Shavkatjon will separate his household from that of his father. To prepare for the separation, Shavkatjon is looking to purchase cattle for himself.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu has been a clothes and shoe seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Kumekucha loan group (group code 2012). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Each day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Wanu is 36 years old, married, and cares for one dependent.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Miss Nelly Vázquez was born in the city of Valenzuela.  She has four older brothers and sisters, one brother who is in the military and three sisters who are nurses.  She now lives in the city of Capiatá with her older sister, Raquel.  She is a businesswoman, and two years ago started a business selling clothes and accessories for women.  She does business out of her house, but also makes her sales in the interior of the country, where she has a large number of clients.  Thanks to the loan given through the Foundation, Nelly hopes to grow her business and consequently her family income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, accessories, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en: Bulgantamir B. is a single father who lives with his four children whose ages range from 9 to 18. He currently resides in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter is a college student and the other three children are all in high school. He drives a cab in the town. He has been doing the taxi business since 2003. His daily income has increased from 3,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 8,000 MNT. He says that he is working very hard to be financially able to support all his children's education. Since all his four children go to school, the expenses for their education can be very high. Bulgantamir requests a loan to purchase new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Leobardo C. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que se requiere, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar tener su casa terminada.
Don Leobardo es empleado de una maquiladora en el departamento de técnico en mantenimiento, está es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte se para pagar el crédito.
Cuando se realizo la visita al domicilio del señor Leobardo el estaba en horario de trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa el señora Rosa Elva Quiroga quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Leobardo C.' house is missing the exterior finishing, but right now he doesn't have the money necessary to buy the material needed. This is the reason he seeks a loan, with which he will be able to have a finished home.

Leobardo is an employee at a "maquiladora" (an assembly plant) in the technical maintenance department. This is the source of income that he has for his family and with which he will be able to pay back the loan.

When we made this visit to the home of Leobardo, it was during the work day, so his wife, Rosa Elva Quiroga, let us in. She is the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the exterior of his home

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., 25, has been raising pigs for sale in her village in Siem Reap Province since 2003. She earns a typical income of $3 USD per day. P. is married and lives with her husband, who also raises pigs. With his other jobs, he is able to generate $5 USD per day typically. They are blessed with two young children who do not yet attend school.

Traditional Cambodian agricultural methods require hard work and a long time investment to produce the best output and a competitive price at market. P. wants to take a loan of $200 USD for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. She wants to save her income for her children’s education and expanding her current business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Maria Clariza

texts.es:
La socia se llama Clariza, ella es natural de Cusco y vive actualmente en la av. Ucchullo grande Q-18, a 15 minutos de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos ella no es casada pero convive con su pareja actual, la socia es docente en la comunidad de Pucyura en el distrito de Anta.  Nuestra socia desea invertir su dinerito en la compra de algunos electrodomésticos en su hogar, ella cubrirá su s cuotas con el pago mensual de su trabajo como docente.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Clariza is a native of Cusco, and currently lives 15 minutes outside of that city. Clariza is 38 years old and has 2 children. She is not married but lives with her current partner. She is a teacher in the Pucyura community in the Anta district. She wishes to invest her small loan in the purchase of appliances for her home.She will make her loan payments with the monthly salary she earns in her work as a teacher. Clariza appreciates and values the loan made to her and she commits to make her repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in small home appliances

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en:
B. Salohidin lives in the town of Panj with his wife and 5 children. He has worked in agriculture for 11 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Salohidin’s wife is a vendor and helps support the family. Salohidin would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 54 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos; los 3 mayores ya trabajan y sólo tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hija menor de 10 años. Todos habitan juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y chupetes de fruta en su domicilio. Las frutas que generalmente ofrece son: sandias, naranjas y plátanos, además vende cerca de 250 chupetes de fruta y hielo diarios. Anteriormente, Graciela vendía estos productos en un mercado, pero a causa de una enfermedad tuvo que dejar su puesto, pero una vez repuesta inició su negocio en su casa, de lo que no se arrepiente, pues también obtiene buenas ganancias, debido a que su casa se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada de su ciudad y cuando le sobran algunos productos los acomoda en una bandeja y los vende de forma ambulante. Graciela quiere para el futuro tener una tienda de comestibles donde pueda vender más cómodamente.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, a ella le agrada mucho su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son personas buenas y trabajan en unión para el progreso de todo el grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas y también materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando la estructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Graciela is 54 and single. She has four children. The three oldest now work. Her ten year old daughter is the only one she is still responsible for. They all live together in their own house. For 23 years she has been selling fruits and fruit popsicles in her house. The fruits that she generally sells are watermelon, oranges, and bananas. Also, she sells close to 250 fruit popsicles a day. Previously, Graciela sold these products in a market. Due to an illness, she had to leave her stall. Once she was better, she started her business in her house. She does not regret it. She gets good earnings due to the fact that her house is located in a very busy part of the city. When there are left over products, she puts them on a tray and sells them on the street. In the future Graciela would like to have a grocery store where she could sell more comfortably. This is her second loan with MFP. She really likes her communal bank because her colleagues are good people, and they work together for progress for the whole group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit. She will also buy construction materials to keep improving the structure of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia M. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Inocencia has run her business for almost two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Inocencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product range. Inocencia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to expand her range further. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Inocencia from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product range

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Koy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who are all living in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Srey Mom K. is a village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes. Srey is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mom Thearen, is an electrician. Mrs. Srey Mom K. is requesting this loan to buy 150 chickens and chicken feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living with this loan. She is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is still too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy 150 chickens and chicken food for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Roth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn R. is the group leader of four members who all live in Niel village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding.

Mrs. Khorn R. is 56 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, another is a car repairer, and the remaining one is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Siem Nim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor C. lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. His wife, Suth Phun, is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Nhor C. decided to ask for a loan to buy 1,500 ducklings for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living with this loan. He is 38 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending to local school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans, elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de thé, de sucre, d'huile, etc. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son activé et générer des ressources qui lui permettront de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Nialing B., aged 38, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of a village bank for eight years and is very experienced in the credit process. She runs a small business selling tea, sugar, oil, etc. This loan will enable her to bolster her activity and generate a profit which she will use to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
L. Hoàng Thị B. (10110040037) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lộc Hà (4).


L. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. operates a family member's business venture running a general store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.436.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.962.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Hoàng Thị B.  (10110040037) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Lộc Hà (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.436.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. quần áo.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.962.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. sản xuất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Etamislada Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Etamislada se destaca por elaborar unos deliciosos nacatamales que son una de las comidas típicas de Nicaragua y son realizados por ella misma y vendidos en su establecimiento siendo visitada por muchos clientes los que compran sus nacatamales.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito con el fin de comprar la materia prima como lo es la compra de maíz, hojas de chagüite, arroz, cebollas, chiltomas, tomates, carne, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado sin problemas y así proceder a su venta.
texts.en:
At the Mercado Mayoreo [Wholesale Market], Etamislada is known for making delicious nacatamales, a traditional Nicaraguan dish. She makes them herself and sells them at her market stall, where many customers stop by to buy her nacatamales. Etamislada is seeking a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn, banana leaves, rice, onions, peppers, tomatoes, meat, and others. She hopes her loan will be granted without problems so she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for nacatamales

loans.name: Kisowera Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady with a butcher shop in Kisowera. Christine sells raw pork meat by the kilogram, as well as roasted pork, to her customers especially in the afternoons and evenings. She is able to make 100,000/ UGX per week. 

For five years, her business has been running smoothly but lacked enough capital, and loans have helped this. Christine now needs a loan to buy two pigs that will be sold for meat at her shop.

loans.use: Buying two pigs for meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi L. is 34 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Naomi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Naomi needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Naomi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Naomi L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Margarida Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Margarida Gonçalves D. V. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 25 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 10, 7 e 1 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou deviD. a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane com os pais ainda muito nova, mais tarde depois de se juntar com o mariD. decidiram ter sua própria residência. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 2 anos em Boane, não possui nenhum empregaD. tem ajuda D. seu esposo que também é electrecista-auto nas bombas de combustível da Petromoc. Mensalmente consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt e com ajuda D. mariD. nas despesas de casa ela consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancária D. Millinium Bim.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua mãe que também desenvolve a mesma actividade e é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 9.250.00mt foi para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo afim de poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para continuar a aplicar na construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Margarida Gonçalves D. V. was born in the district of Namaacha, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are 10, 7, and 1 years old. The two oldest go to school. She only finished the 8th grade; she was not able to continue on due to an early pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anybody else. She left Namaacha for Boane with her parents when she was very young. Later on, she married her husband and they decided to get their own place. She has had her own business in Boane for more than 2 years. She doesn't have any employees but her husband, who is an automotive electrician at a Petromoc service station, helps her out. She earns about 4,000 MZN monthly, and with her husband's help with household expenses, is able to save some in her Millennium Bim bank account. She has not had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through her mother, who works in the same area and is also a client of the institution. This is Margarida's second loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy construction materials (cement, support beams, sand, zinc plates, etc.) in order to continue building her house. The previous loan was for 9,250 MZN, for the same purpose. She promises to pay back the loan in a timely manner in order to be able to have access to others. In the future, she would like to request more loans in order to continue with the construction of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (support beams, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanuts and other products

loans.name: Fight For Poor Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are petty businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group “Fight For Poor Group”. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, attract many more customers, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawa K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hawa is a 45-year-old. She is married and has four children. One of her children is in secondary school and the others are married and living on their own. For five years now, Hawa has been selling foofoo (food made out of cassava roots), biscuits, mints, etc. Hawa will use her share of the loan to buy foofoo, biscuits, mints, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: Buy foofoo, biscuits, mints, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mr. Meas P., age 28, is a fisherman who lives in the village of Peam Ta Aek in Kandal province. His wife is a grocery seller. Between the two of their businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. 

Since the grocery business is going well, Mr. Meas P. wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand his wife's business. 

The couple has four children: two are very small and two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Siguikafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguikafo de l’association Balemayaton est composé de 4 femmes mariées de la ville de  San région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Siguikafo vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelle et se sont connues à travers le voisinage. Elles ont en moyenne 40ans et au moins 6 enfants. 
Elles exercent le commerce depuis plusieurs années et ont intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a une année. Elles sont à leur 2è prêt solidaire. 
Elles font l’achat vente  des produits cosmétiques, de tissus wax à l’image de Djeneba D. et  des condiments alimentaires. 
Djeneba D. qui a un  kiosque au grand marché de San compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 balles de  tissus wax contenant chacune  50 pièces. 
Elle compte réaliser 15 000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qui sera utilisé pour rembourser, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Siguikafo of the association Balemayaton is composed of four married women of the city of San, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members, averaging 40 years of age and six children, live in large traditional families, and they know one another through community ties.  They have operated businesses for several years.  They joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program a year ago and are now on their second solidarity loan.  The group members buy and sell cosmetics, wax cloth (as does Djeneba D.), and also condiments.  Djeneba D., who has a stall at the big market of San, intends to use her loan to buy 20 bales of wax cloth each containing 50 lengths of cloth.  She plans on making 15,000 francs CFA in profit per month that will be used for repaying the loan, for meeting family needs, and for reinvesting in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en: Asylkan T. is the leader of this four-person group. She is 45 and her husband is a cook. She has four children: the youngest is still in school, two of them moved to Russia to work, and the other one moved to Kazakhstan. Years ago, Asylkan sold food in her homemade restaurant and her husband helped her with this business. She started the restaurant a while ago but for family reasons was obligated to close. Now she wants to reopen the business and for this purpose she needs loan. She wishes to reopen and improve her restaurant. Muhabat A. is the treasurer of the group; she is 39, and a widow. All of her three children are students and have been helping their mother with her business for six years. She grows and sells potatoes and makes 5,800 som (approximately 130 USD) per month. With the loan, she will buy fertilizer to improve her yield. Her goal is to build a house. For ten years Tolgon A. has been a construction worker – he learned this trade by doing an apprenticeship. He is now 32 and married; his wife does not work. He wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer so that he can grow healthy vegetables near his home. His wife will be able to help him with this task and, in this way, they can earn extra income. When they amass enough money, Tolgon wants to build a better home for his family. Masturahan A. cultivates potatoes and corn, which she then serves in her homemade restaurant. Her husband, a construction worker, helps her with the business. She also has two sons: one is a student and the other is still a toddler. She started her business twelve years ago by cultivating corn. Today, she makes 2,500 som (approximately 55 USD) per month and plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and a larger variety of seeds. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To reopen her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en un Asentamiento Urbano (zona urbano – marginal) del distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, situado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida dos veces por semana y conlos ingresos que le brinda su venta ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Candelaria desea adquirir mas ingredientes e insumos como harina de jora, azúcar y leña para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Candelaria es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a sus hijos y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Candelaria, age 32, lives with her husband and their children in an urban settlement (poor urban zone outlying the city) in the Cura Mori district in the Piura province. It is situated in the region with the same name, and it is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years she has been making and selling “chicha de jora” (a drink that is typical in the country, which has been prepared since long ago with the base being a special type of corn flour). She prepares this drink two times a week. She helps her husband with the family expenses with the income that the sales provide. The business is well received because this drink is consumed a lot in the area. It is especially consumed during the various celebrations and activities. Also, the workers in the area consume it before they start their activities. They do this because they believe that the drink gives them energy and vigor. Candelaria wishes to get more ingredients and supplies like corn flour, sugar, and firewood to continue making this drink and to increase her sales. That is why she has asked, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 PEN. That will allow her to achieve her goals. Candeleria is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to see her children progress and to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase "chicha de jora" production

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four members who are villagers in Lekh Buon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yoeun S., 49 years old, is the group leader. The other group members selected her as the leader. Each member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Lim Toeuy, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to raise their family. They are also laborers. Now they have an obstacle because they don't have enough money to grow their crops. So to improve production, Mrs. Yoeun S. is seeking a loan to do farming this current year to increase the yield. She is a mother of five children. Four of the children attend the local public school, and the other one is just five years old.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1972. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Moreover, she is also a Khmer cake seller.

Mrs. Mom N.’s difficulty is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and hire farm laborers to reap her rice field.

Mrs. Mom N. is a widow with two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn G. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Rinalyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rinalyn owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Rinalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rinalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rinalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rinalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn V. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Arlyn owns and operates a business providing motor transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Arlyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Brigida es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Brigida se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, los ofrece de casa en casa sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito.
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa.
Brigida sueña con terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows). She is in a common law marriage and has four children who are in school. Brigida buys and sells cheeses and travels house to house to offer her products. Most of her sales are made on credit.

Brigida needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy construction materials for her house. She dreams of finishing the construction of her house and seeing her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs Savoeun S. (pictured above at her loom) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr Sophal Hel, is 52 years old. They have been married for 25 years and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Both daughters weave silk at home, one of her sons is attending university and another one has full-time employment. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been a weaver since she before she was married, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a wooden-house constructor, alS. since before their marriage. Savoeun is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to pay school fees for her son and she will use part of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Potenciano

texts.en:
Potenciano R. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 51 years old. Potenciano is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Potenciano owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Potenciano has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Potenciano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Potenciano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Potenciano is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Potenciano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es:
Sonia  P. M. Inició un negocio hace seis años en el barrio Concord de Malambo, un municipio a 10 minutos de Barranquilla,donde vive y tiwen dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 24 años. Ella empezó vendiendo pintura para telas  e insumos para la  fabricación de muñecos y   enseñaba a fabricar estos productos, de ahí se deriva su permanente clientela y  el  logró de Sonia de haberlo convertido en  un punto de venta reconocido; como ella es una mujer sabia, que todo lo aprende y todo  lo enseña, se capacitó en artesanías en foamy y en fabricación de sandalias a través del Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”  y hace 4 años empezó a vender los insumos de estos mismos productos, aprovechando que muchas personas se capacitaron y  emprendieron microempresas de fabricación de estas artesanías, lo cual le ha asegurado un mercado permanente.  
Actualmente Sonia  vive con su hijo menor,  a quien le está pagando estudios de Psicología gracias su trabajo en la microempresa, donde vende lo que fabrica y también las materias primas, los materiales e insumos de muchas artesanías que ella también practica. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva para comprar forros para plantilla, galones de pegante, plataformas, hilos, botones, telas, foamy  y escarcha, preparándose para en el mes de Diciembre fabricar calzado y adornos navideños, arte que también conoce perfectamente. Ella espera   incrementar sus ventas en un 30%   ya que en esta época del año se aumenta considerablemente clientes que piden estos artículos y por otro lado  la producción de calzado y de artículos navideños también se incrementa en las microempresas dedicadas a estas actividades, las cuales  finalmente compran donde Sonia los insumos para su producción.
Sonia está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 2 años y este es su segundo financiamiento y con el primero logró aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo y acceder a nuevos clientes. Su desafío mas grande ocurrió el año anterior cuando hubo disminución en sus ventas pero logró adicionar nuevas líneas de productos y así ha logrado sostener   su negocio. Entre sus logros está la compra reciente de su vivienda en este mismo barrio y sueña con adecuarla, teniendo en cuenta  definir un espacio locativo, para que su negocio funcione en su propia casa y poder trasladarse tan pronto como le sea posible.  Sonia tiene una meta, que es la que mas  estimula   su trabajo en la microempresa, y es la de   ver a su hijo siendo un profesional de la psicología muy exitoso.
texts.en: Sonia  P. M. started a business six years ago in the Concord of Malambo neighborhood, a municipality 10 minutes from Barranquilla, where she lives with her two children, ages 19 and 24 years.  She began selling fabric paints and supplies for the production of dummies and she taught people how to manufacture these products.  From there her permanent clientele grew and Sonia achieved the goal of becoming a recognized point of sale.  She is a wise woman   who learns and teaches everything she can.  She is qualified in foam crafts and in the production of sandals through the National Learning Service "SEINE".  Four years ago she began to sell the supplies for these same products, taking advantage of the fact that many people who were qualified in the skills undertook micro-businesses producing these crafts.  This has assured her a permanent market.  At present Sonia lives with her youngest son.  She is paying for his studies in Psychology thanks to her work in the micro-business, where she sells what she manufactures and also the commodities, materials and supplies of many crafts that she also practices.  Currently she is requesting a loan to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam and glitter, in order to be prepared for the month of December to make footwear and Christmas decorations, an art that she also knows perfectly.  She expects to increase her sales by 30% since at this time of year the number of clients asking for these articles grows considerably.  On the other hand the production of footwear and of Christmas articles by other micro-businesses dedicated to these activities also increases, and they buy the supplies for their production from Sonia.  Sonia joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation 2 years ago and this is her second loan.  With the first one she managed to enlarge her working capital a little and to add new clients.  Her greatest challenge the previous year occurred when there was a decrease in her sales but she managed to add new product lines and thus has managed to maintain her business.  Among her achievements is the recent purchase of her dwelling in this same neighborhood.  She dreams of adapting it, keeping in mind to define a working space, so that her business can function in her own house and she will be able to get to work as quickly as possible.  Sonia has a goal, which is the thing that most drives her work in the micro-business, and it is that of seeing her son become a very successful psychology professional.

loans.use: to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam padding and glitter.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao C. (in the photo), 56, is a widow. She lives with her grandson and granddaughter in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mao has been running a grocery store in her village for five years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to expand her grocery store and provide capital for her sister’s farming business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and provide capital for her sister’s farming business

loans.name: Jyanbere Group

texts.fr: Jean K. et agriculteur du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Jyanbere.  Il a 32 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Il voudrait améliorer l’activité de l’agriculture du riz, et il voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean K. is a rice farmer and a member of the Jyanbere group. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children between 1 and 8 years old. One of his children attends school.

He will use his loan to purchase urea and NPK (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium) fertilizers, and also to pay for labor. He would like to improve his rice-farming business and also pay his family's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Snave

texts.fr: Snave K. G. a 30 ans, il est célibataire, et il est fini 2 ans de l’université.  Il est né à Goma, dans le DRC, mais maintenant il habite à Kigali.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’aide familiale.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour devenir indépendant financièrement, et minimiser sa consommation pour élever son épargne.  Il voudrait avoir un nouvel emploi, et bien rémunérer après avoir terminé ses études.  Pour la vie, il voudrait terminer ses études, et se marier.
texts.en:
Snave K. G. is 30 years old and single. He has been in university for two years. He was born in Goma, in the DRC, but now lives in Kigali. 

He will use his loan to support himself as a home-health aide. His growth strategy is to accumulate savings that will allow him to become financially independent, and to reduce his expenses to increase his savings. 

Once he has completed his studies, he wants to find new employment that pays well. For the future, his plans are to finish school and get married.

loans.use: Home-health aide

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Maricel B. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Maricel, 36, attended college and now is married to Salvador, who works as a branch manager of a pizza chain in town.  Maricel works hard to help her husband earn for their daily needs and prepare financially for the future of their elementary grade child. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Maricel currently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap to candies and energy drinks to rice. Having been at least seven years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 10000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20000 PHP loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more needed now that the Christmas season is here. Maricel plans to take this opportunity to drive her business toward more profitability.

Maricel is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stock in her store

loans.name: Donna May

texts.en:
Donna May is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business selling cosmetics. Her husband Joel D. J., who is 40 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Donna May joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Donna May has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her cosmetics business to continue to save up for the future education of her children. Donna May is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hadiatu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Hadiatu B.. Hadiatu is a widow and has an 18-year-old child. In 1998, Hadiatu established her drinks business because she wanted to improve her well-being. Working six days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to rent a more spacious shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and rent a more spacious shop

loans.name: Beline

texts.en:
Beline, 43, is married with two children, aged 15 and 25. Her husband is a driver. For that reason, Beline works hard to provide everything necessary for her family. Beline owns a small business selling various handicrafts and clothes for weddings.

From her ten years of experience, Beline is is seasoned in her business and keeps it well-organized. She employs two people from her community. Her shop is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Beline has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more handicrafts and clothes for weddings. She hopes to earn more profit, which will allow her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Fanny es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido financiar un poco su negocio. Tiene 46 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene dos  hijos de 19 y 15 de edad que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y Universidad.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de gas de uso domestico, nos cuenta que es la primera que empezó con este negocio en Charapoto  hace 16 años y que por esto tiene la franquicia del ministerio, ella entrega el gas al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona y también vende por unidades. También vende productos naturales de la marca Winalite. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00  hasta las 20h00 esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar más gas de uso domestico.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Fanny is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she has been able to fund her business a bit with the loans. She is 46 years old and is currently single, but she had two children from a former relationship that are 19 and 15 years old and still live with her and are students in college and high school, respectively.

She works selling gasoline for domestic use. She tells us that she is the first to begin with this business in Charapoto in the past 16 years and as a result, she has the authorization of the ministry. She delivers the gas at wholesale to the area merchants and also sells by unit. In addition, she sells natural products from Winalite. She works every day from 7am to 8pm and her children help her.

This loan is to purchase more gasoline for domestic use. Her dream is to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: To buy tanks of gasoline for domestic use

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a farmer from Vodyanoye, where he lives with his wife, 11-year-old daughter and son. Yuryi grows different vegetables in his 6 greenhouses. Moreover, he has a separate greenhouse for seedlings. Every year Yuryi plants 10,000 tomatoes. He has invested about 180,000 UAH in his venture, which he has been operating for 10 years. 

Yuryi is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to install a heating system for 3 greenhouses. He is hoping to buy a gas boiler and hose pipes for this purpose. More consistent temperatures will help him grow timely harvests and receive a steady income. This business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to install a heating system for three greenhouses

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy T., 32, is a married woman blessed with four single children. All of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Nhoern. He is 37, and he is a firewood seller in and around his village in Kompong Tom province. 

Chy T. has built a pigpen behind her house, where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chy T. and her family, Chy T. has requested a loan in order to buy additional piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan Y. is a 52-year-old farmer and mother blessed with five children, four of whom are attending public school, and one of whom is married. Her husband, Ban Phan, 49, earns an income by playing Khmer music in and around Kompong Cham Province. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is in the process of being built, so Chan is requesting a loan to purchase needed housing materials.

loans.use: to purchase housing equipment in order to build her new house.

loans.name: Alver Rafael

texts.es: Alver tiene 21 años. Vive con su esposa y su niña de un año en el caserío Monterrey ubicado en el distrito de Paijan, en el norte de Perú. Vive en casa de un familiar, no cuenta con casa propia. Gana la vida trabajando como mototaxista en su vehículo propio. Esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, la herramienta de su trabajo. Con esta inversión, podrá brinda un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Éste es el segundo crédito que Alver ha solicitado de Edpyme. Canceló el primero de manera puntual. Alver tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que lo consideran como una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Alver is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and his one-year-old daughter in the Monterrey hamlet, located in the Paijan district, in the north of Peru.
