He lives in a family member’s house, as he does not have a house of his own. He earns a living working as a moto taxi* driver with his own vehicle. The new loan he is requesting will be used for the upkeep of his vehicle, which is his working tool. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to offer a better service to his customers. This is the second loan Alver has asked to Edpyme. The first has been regularly paid off. Alver has received good references by his neighbors and acquaintances, who consider him a responsible and hardworking man.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To pay for the upkeep of his vehicle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of attend school. Eva has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 3 months, and she works 6 days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Eva has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Eva include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start importing clothes herself. Eva  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama las Divinas se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por las señoras Valeria e Ignacia van a comprar con su préstamo dulces típicos para surtir su negocio, la señora Alfonsa va a comprar maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas, la señora Maribel va a comprar alimento para engordar sus cerdos y la señora Diana va a comprar blusas y ropa de dama para surtir su negocio. 
La señora Alfonsa tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Blanca tiene 13 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria, Yesenia tiene 11 años de edad estudia la primaria y Cristian tiene 19 años de edad ya trabaja, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como chiles, tomates, jitomates, cebollas, mangos, plátanos, naranjas  para iniciar su negocio vendiendo en la plaza de Amilcingo, su esposo le va a ayudar a atender a los clientes y a poner y levantar el puesto, ella inicio su negocio por necesidad para tener ingresos y así poder ayudar a la familia, ella tiene la esperanza de vivir mejor, llevar una vida mejor, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo, se siente orgullosa y feliz por el préstamo que va a recibir y espera que sus hijos tengan una vida mejor. Amilcingo es un pueblo bonito elaboran dulces palanqueta de cacahuate, alegrías, tamarindo, jamoncillo, etc. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias porque nos han apoyado en todo y nos tiene calma para todo”.
texts.en:
This community bank group called Las Divinas is found in the community of Amilcingo, Temoac, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It was started by Mrs. Valeria and Mrs. Ignacia. With the loan, they will buy local candies to stock their business. Mrs. Alfonsa is going to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. Mrs. Maribel will buy food for fattening her pigs, and Mrs. Diana is going to buy blouses and women's clothing to stock her business.

Mrs. Alfonsa is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Blanca is 13 years old and studies in secondary school. Yesenia is 11 years old and studies in primary school. Christian is 19 years old and works. She is asking for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like chiles, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, bananas, and oranges to start a business selling in the Amilcingo Plaza. Her husband is going to help her with the customers and set up the stand. She started her business out of a need to have more income and be able to help her family. She has the hope of a better life. She is very happy with this loan and feels proud and happy to receive it. She hopes for her children to have a better life.

Amilcingo is a pretty village where they make peanut, alegria seed, tamarind, and fudge candies. The members of this group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “thanks, because you have supported us through everything and have helped us feel more calm".

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants et âgée de 36ans, Mme Adjoavi a démarré son activité (vente de mais) en 2007. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages et fermes du Togo et revend au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle veut renforcer son activité et prendre soin de ses deux enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des stocks.
texts.en:
A mother of two and 36 years old, Mrs. Adjoavi started her business (corn retail) in 2007. She gets her supplies from villages and farms in Togo, and resells at the Akodessewa market.
She wants to strengthen her business and take care of her two children, which is why she is requesting this first loan to purchase stocks.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn).

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children, ages 28, 23, and 20. She is a farmer who works in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Evangeline grows rice crops. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Evangeline works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

In the future, Evangeline hopes to have a stable business. She also wishes for her children's success and for them to be God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Bilgeys

texts.ru: Bilgeys rodilas v 1958 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Bilgeys i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. Ona 8 let zanimayetsya vipechkoy xleba "Tandir", tak je ona v etoy pechke tandir delayet nacionalnuyu yedu iz kuricci i iz ribi "Lavangi". Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti dlya vipechki v tandire. Vipechki v tandire ona nauchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en: Bilgeys was born in 1958. She is married and has two children.  Bilgeys and her family live in the Absheron region. She has been baking tandir bread for the last eight years.  Additionally, she makes the traditional dish lavangi (stuffed chicken or fish) in her oven.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in the tandir.  She learned how to bake in a tandir from her mother.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in a tandir

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
La señora Romelia es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores D. edad (todos con sus respectivas familias).  Su primer préstamo fue D. trescientos nuevos soles.
Es una D. las fundadoras D. este banco comunal y como muchas D. ellas ya están acostumbradas a encontrarse en las reuniones y se ven como una gran familia.  Romelia se dedica a la venta D. comida D. forma ambulatoria en la vereda D. su casa, y lo hace en horas D. la noche cuando las personas buscan algo D. cenar como  Juanes, pollo asado, chorizo, cuero, pescado asado (comidas tìpicas D. la zona) y chicha morada .
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco D. carbón, 3 fuentes, 2 metros D. tela  para mantel, 4 sillas D. plástico.
Este trabajo lo realiza desD. hace mucho tiempo porque tiene que trabajar duro para poder educar sola a sus hijos,  Manuela Ramos le diò la oportunidad, como a muchas mujeres que quieren sacar adelante a su familia, en recompensa a tanto sacrificio recibe la ayuda económica D. uno D. sus hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Romelia is a member of the communal bank Sol Naciente in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 63 years old and a single mother of three adult children (who all have their respective families).  Her first loan was for 300 PEN.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank, and many, like her, are accustomed to greeting each other at the meetings and feel like their are one big family.  Romelia sells food off the porch of her house during the evening hours when people go out looking for something for dinner, such as grilled chicken, chorizo, grilled fish (typical in this area) and chicha morada (corn-based drink).

With the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN she will buy a sack of coal, 3 serving dishes, 2 meters of tablecloth fabric, and 4 plastic chairs.

She has been in business for a long time because she must work hard to give her children an education.  Manuela Ramos gave her the opportunity, as with many women who want to see their family get ahead.  Because of all her sacrifice she receives financial support from one of her oldest sons.

loans.use: To buy a sack of coal, 3 serving dishes, 2 meters of tablecloth fabric, 4 plastic chairs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 42 años, que vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años de edad y desde hace 1 año, impulsada con apoyar a su esposo en la gestión de su hogar y su necesidad personal de sentirse útil a su familia, decidió en compañía de su esposo vender queso en el barrio donde antes vivía, pues allí tenía muchos conocidos amigos y familiares que apoyarían su iniciativa, como hasta la presente ha ocurrido, pues ellos en la actualidad son su principal mercado y también ha agregado empleados de la empresa donde trabaja su esposo y muchos referidos, que ahora conocen la calidad de sus producto. Cuando construyó este mercado,  decidió darle rienda suelta a su creatividad e incursionó en la venta de deditos de queso, empacadas en pequeñas bandejas, aprovechando su materia prima que es el queso, producto que ella compra en mayor cantidad ,  y es otro negocio que le suministra ingresos simultáneos y con el que le ha ido muy bien. Como también con productos complementarios que prepara y vende como los bolis de frutas , productos congelados a base de frutas naturales de la región, como guanábana, mango, coco y hasta chocolate.  Su mayor anhelo es que su microempresa tenga una mejor infraestructura y que logre apoyar la sostenibilidad y el crecimiento personal y profesional de su familia. Mientras esto ocurre trabaja en su negocio con un margen de contribución del 61,29%  y con muchas ganas de incrementar su capital de trabajo para expandir sus productos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará implementos de cocina, como la mesa en lámina galvanizada, una vitrina calentadora, un horno para pizza, pues aprovecharía el conocimiento técnico que tiene su esposo en la preparación de este último productos, que planea impacte a la comunidad pues no hay mucha competencia en el barrio y en sus alrededores, para finalmente generar nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: Isabel is a 42-year old woman who lives with her partner and their 5-year old son. Last year she felt motivated to help her husband with the household finances and she had a personal need to feel useful for her family. So she decided to start selling cheese with her husband in a community where they used to live. They have many acquaintances, friends, and family there who supported their initiative and continue to do so to date. They are their primary market and they have also acquired as clients the employees of the company where he works and other referred clients who now know about the quality of their products. When built her business she decided to let her creativity run free and she began selling cheese fingers packaged in small bundles. She took advantage of the fact that the primary product is cheese and it is a product that she buys in larger quantities. This is another business that earns a second source of income and it has done very well. She also sells complimentary products that she prepares, such as frozen fruit snacks. She prepares them with natural fruits from the region, such as soursop, mango, coconut, and even chocolate. Her greatest dream is to give her business a better infrastructure and to be able to support the person and professional development of her family. As she works towards her goals she works with a contribution margin of 61.29%. She is very eager to increase her working capital to expand her products. This is exactly the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, a first time loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven. She will be able to profit from her husband's technical knowledge with respect to the preparation of these products. She plans to have an affect on the community especially because there is not much competition in their neighborhood and surrounding areas. Her goal is to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old business man. He sells mobile-phone accessories to earn a living. He also sells clothes for more income generation. He has been running his business for two years. Previously, he was operating a grocery shop.  

Daniel dreams of expanding his business in order to attract more customers. He has requested a loan for 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Akparchon

texts.ru:
Акпарчон женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он честный и добрый человек. Акпарчон мечтает устроить своих детей в лучшую школу и поэтому усердно работает. Акпарчон занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Он имеет свой магазин в центре города на населенном пункте. Он продает конфеты, печенье, соки, напитки и т.д. Акпарчон всегда старается, удовлетворят потребности своих клиентов. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и добавить новых ассортиментов продуктов питания. Акпарчон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов питания. Он заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу помощь и милосердие. 
     
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akparchon is married and is a loving father of two children.  He is an honest and kind person.  Akparchon dreams of placing his children into the best school and works diligently for that.  He is involved in buying and selling food products.  He owns a store in a well-populated location of the city center.  He sells candies, cookies, juices, drinks, etc.  Akparchon always tries to satisfy the demands of his customers.  He wants to expand his business and add a new assortment of food products.  Akparchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of products

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 50 years old and married and with five children. He has a van transport business to earn a living.  He has been operating his business for six years.  He also does dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide better education to his children. Francis hopes to buy more vans for his transport business in five years.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Lotis provides motorcycle or habal-habal transport. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

Lotis has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lotis hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: C13013 Dukorerehamwe Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline, a 41-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 10 and 17, is the president of a group called "Dukorerehamwe". This is her fifth successful year in the business of selling charcoal, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a loan to purchase more charcoal, vegetables, and fruit to sell. By using this loan, Jacqueline and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building a better future for their families.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, vegetables, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo sigue laborando en seguridad, sus dos hijos creciendo y cursando el año escolar, su esposa sigue trabajando y ambos siguen haciendo las mejoras a su casa.
Su casa hoy en dia toda de concreto, parte de estos logros fueron atraves del financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en varios creditos. Lo que para ellos ha sido de gran beneficios al mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. El no cuenta con inodoro y desea mejorar esta condicion por tal razon comprara inodoro,tubos para aguas negras, pegamento,cemento, arena, bloques y hacer esta obra. El cual sera para su familia de gran bienestar de salud, al realizar mas higiene.
texts.en:
Rodrigo still works as a security guard. His two children are growing and attending school. His wife is still working and they're both still making home improvements.
His house is currently made entirely of concrete. Part of this success came from the funding Afodemic has provided in various loans, which have helped them a lot as they improve the infrastructure of their home.
He doesn't have a toilet and wishes to improve this condition. For that reason he will purchase a toilet, sewage pipes, glue, cement, sand and cinder blocks, and get it built. It will mean a lot to his family in terms of well-being and health, because they will get better hygiene.

loans.use: to purchase a toilet, sewage pipes, glue, cement and cinder blocks, and to start building so that his family will get better hygiene.

loans.name: Diappo Moy Doole N° 1 Group

texts.fr: Diappo Moy Doolé N°1 est un groupe mixte composé de trois femmes et de deux hommes.Les membres du groupe pratiquent tous le commerce de produits ménagers.Les femmes vendent à domiccile alors que les deux hommes font  du "porte à porte" pour écouler leurs marchandises.Leurs activités générent des revenus assez important leur permettant de prendre en charge leurs besoins et de participer aux dépenses familiales.Le chef du groupe ( doigt pointé)est une femme mariée , mère de quatres enfants qui sont tous à l'école.Elle paie leurs frais de scolarité ainsi que leurs fournitures et s'occupe aussi de leurs habillement.Pour augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits ménagers.Leur ambition est d'ouvrir chacun sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Diappo Moy Doolé N°1 is a mixed group made up of three women and two men. All the members of the group sell household products. The women sell from home while the men go door to door to sell their goods. Their activity generates quite a good income allowing them to provide for their needs and to take part in the family expenses.

The leader of the group (with the pointed finger) is a married woman, mother of four children all attending school. She pays for their school fees as well as their school supplies and takes care of their clothing.

To increase their working capital, the members of the group are requesting a loan for 250,000 Francs to purchase household products. Their ambition is for each to open their own shop.

loans.use: buy household products.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou est un Marchand qui gère   un mini sélect à coté de la station de la municipalité de la localité de sa zone d'habitation.Il capitalise une expérience de plus  de 5 ans dans son activité de commerce.Il commercialise des produits alimentaires divers. Il est membre d'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans. il sollicite un crédit de 500 000, montant avec lequel il compte acheter de la boisson sucrée qui est très demandée en cette période d'approche  des fêtes.Son souhait est de renforcer son fond de roulement pour réaliser d'avantage de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou is a merchant. For the past five years, he has been running a small convenience store next to the City Hall station. 

He will use this second loan to stock up on merchandise such as soft drinks, a product in very high demand, which will be needed for the upcoming Tabaski celebration. His experience will help him to strengthen his working capital and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for his convenience store

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a joiner. He has a small workshop in the village of Ivandidi in the Imereti Region of West Georgia, where he lives with his big family: his wife Tsiala, their 34-year-old daughter, their son-in-law, and their two grandchildren, an eight-year-old boy and a one-year-old girl. Akaki studied joinery 20 years ago, and since then it has been the main source of income for him and his family. In his workshop, Akaki produces wooden doors and windows on order. His average monthly income is 800 laris. He loves his work and his workshop. Akaki’s son-in-law works as a night watchman for a local company. Tsiala and her daughter are housewives.
 
Akaki has requested a loan to purchase wooden raw materials. He will use the raw materials to complete orders from customers in Ivandidi and nearby villages. As usual, his profits will be used to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for his joiner's workshop.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan est une femme mariée de plus 41 ans et mère de quatre enfants , elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
 Sitan mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffage et poissons fumé il y a dix ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison froide, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce huitième prêt individuel pour acheter 15 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffage dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 20 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
   Ses marchandises (respectivement bois de chauffe et poissons fumés) sont vendues au domicile et au marché du quartier.  
   Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus cinq ans dont elle a bénéficié de quatre prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son huitième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
    Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan is a married woman, 41 years old and mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso.

Sitan has worked for ten years buying and selling firewood and smoked fish. She has a good reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially during the cold season, but she does not have sufficient resources to fulfill all her orders. Thus, she needs an eighth individual loan to buy 15 cartloads of firewood in the communities surrounding the city of Sikasso and 20 cases of smoked fish in Gao (the seventh administrative region of Mali) in order to meet the needs of her ever increasing clientele.

Her goods (firewood and smoked fish) are sold from her home and in the local  market.
She has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for more than five years and has benefited from four group loans with a group of the women in her neighborhood, and she is now on her eighth individual loan. All her previous loans have been properly reimbursed.

With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover her basic expenses, contribute to the family's expenses and pay the interest on the loan. She will invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and smoked fish.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and single. 

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as softdrinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, etc.

In the future Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Marcial, a security guard, and she is mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells direct-selling products for additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business.

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsa hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Marisa de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Comumpiari, donde tiene su techo propio. Hace 06 meses que Marisa empezó en la venta de bebidas como: gaseosas y refrescos; sus principales clientes son la gente de su localidad y la gente que llega a conocer el pueblo de Comumpiari. Gracias a este negocio puede solventar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que es padre y madre para sus queridos hijos. Ahora bien establecida en su negocio anhela ampliar su tienda introduciendo nuevos productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para que así los venda al por mayor y menor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente le da ánimos para que pueda seguir adelante y considera que lo mas difícil es cuando se le agotan las bebidas; por ello acude a los financistas para solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a trabajar tranquilamente y poder solventar a sus hijos.  Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, lo cual se siente agradecida con la institución, por la oportunidad que le brindan, por lo que se compromete en cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. Con el crédito solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad, con la finalidad de que surta su tienda.
texts.en:
Marisa, 28, is a single mother; she has three children in her care.  She lives in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle in the community of Comumpiari where she owns her house.  Six months ago Marisa started to sell beverages like soft-drinks and sodas.  Her main customers are people from her community and people who come to visit the town of Comumpiari.  Thanks to this business she can cover her children’s educational costs since she’s both mother and father to her beloved children.

She’s now well-established in her business and would like to expand the store introducing new products but in larger amounts so that she can sell at both wholesale and retail.  What she most likes about her work is that the people encourage her to continue forward and she considers the most difficult part of it running out of beverages.  This is why she calls on lenders to request a loan that will help her work with tranquility and to be able to support her children.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She  is grateful to the institution for the opportunity it provides her and she commits to meet her installments.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more staple items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock staple merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lisseth Giovanna

texts.es:
Lisseth es una joven de 29 años que vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual sufrió un terrible terremoto de 7.9 grados en las escala de Richter y trajo como consecuencia desastres y mucha tristeza en la mencionada ciudad. Es en este lugar donde se han creado nuevas oportunidad de negocio, Lisseth por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de pollos en un mercado de la ciudad.

Ella es estudiante de la carrera de Administración, está muy entusiasmada y encantadísima con estudiar, cuando ella inició sabía que sus padres no podrías costearle su sueño y es por esto que se dedico a realizar este tipo de venta y así generar los ingresos que son necesarios para pagar los gastos que debe asumir, ella sabe que será una buena profesional y por medio de este empleo está solventando su mayor sueño.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, esta estudiante de Administración podrá comprar una balanza electrónica, que es lo que le hace falta y algunos otros implementos para su negocio, ella sabe que con esta ayuda podrá lograr atender mejor y mucho más rápido a sus clientes, está muy feliz con esta nueva oportunidad debido a que sabe que si atiende mejor, ganará más y esto la llevará a ser la gran profesional y empresaria que anhela ser.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a young 29-year old woman who lives in the town of Pisco. The town suffered a terrible earthquake (7.9 on the Richter scale) not so long ago resulting in serious disasters and a great deal of sadness. New business opportunities have been created. Lisseth, for example, sells chickens in one of the town’s markets.

She is also studying Administration and is very enthusiastic about her studies. From the beginning she knew that her parents couldn’t afford to pay for her to fulfill this dream so she began her business to generate enough income to cover the cost of her education. She knows that one day she will get a good job; her current business is providing the money for her dream.

With help from Kiva donors, Lisseth will be able to buy some electronic scales, something that she lacks, and also other implements for the business. She knows that with these items she will be able to provide better and faster service to her customers. She is very happy to have this opportunity as if she provides better service, she will earn more and finally get to have the career that she longs for.

loans.use: to buy electronic scales and other implements

loans.name: Gelesomu

texts.en:
Coffee farming has been Gelesomu's occupation for the last decade. The 39-year-old father of three says that he finds this business very worthwhile because the earnings from his coffee sales have enabled him to send all of his kids to school. Furthermore, he says that he has been able to improve his family's standard of living. Because his wife has been at his beck and call, he has been able to make many in-roads in his business.

Gelesomu says that this business generates sales revenues to the tune of UGX 400,000 each month. He will use his loan to purchase more coffee seedlings to replant.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee seedlings to replant.

loans.name: Lesbia Marina

texts.en:
I have had my business for fours years and it has grown little by little. Now, I have a good customer base since many people do not have enough resources to buy expensive clothes in stores. Most of my sales are made on weekends when people from other communities visit Choluteca in order to shop for food and visit banks. It is for this reason that weekends are when I offer a variety of clothes for the entire family.

This loan will be used to buy bundles of used clothing

Tengo cuatro años de tener mi negocio el que ha crecido poco a poco, ahora tengo una buena clientela ya que muchas personas no tienen muchos recursos para comprar la ropa cara de tiendas. Mis ventas son mejores los fines de semana ya que hay personas de otras comunidades que viajan a Choluteca para hacer sus compras de alimentos y visitar bancos, es por esa razon que los fines de semana surto para ofrecer variedad de ropa para toda la familia.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa usada.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: F. lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana. She sells canned fish, tomato paste, dry fish, cooking oils, brooms, and other variety store goods. In order to increase her profits, she needs to have more goods to sell She requests a loan of $750.00 to enable her to buy the stock she needs to increase her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a small store out of her home where she sells hand-painted tablecloths, shoes, sandals and hand-knit handbags. She originally went to beauty school but left that profession to get married. When it became clear that her husband did not look after the household finances, she went back to work, this time opening a small hair salon, but later lost everything in a robbery. She learned to make the handbags and shoes she currently sells by watching a neighbor.

She started the business 5 years ago with only $20 of capital. Since then things have been going well, and she would like to expand her business. She took out a loan from Mifex that allowed her to increase her sandal making operation. Things have been going very well and she was able to invest in cleaning products as well. She is seeking another loan in order to increase the space for her business, invest in new products and buy supplies for her sandal making operation.

Maria’s husband emigrated to the United States two years ago, so she lives alone with her three children. She would like to stabilize their economic situation so that her husband can come home.

loans.use: Improve her store and invest in materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in new products and improve his store

loans.name: Aida Aly

texts.pt:
Aida is married and she is the mother of 4 children. All her children are in school. Aida's husband is a driver and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She joined the program this year. She wishes to apply the money on the purchase of more clothes and shoes to fill up her store. If business progresses successfully, she will eventually restore her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Aida e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Todos os filhos de Aida estao a estudar. O marido de Aida e motorista o salario dele e baixo, por isso Aida resolveu iniciar tambem um negocio para poder apoiar o marido nas despesas da casa.Ela entrou para o Programa este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mais roupa e calcado para rechear a sua banca.Se o negocio correr bem, ela pensa mais tarde reabilitar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Aida wants to use the money to purchase clothing in Maputa for her retail business.

loans.name: Haver

texts.en: Haver M. operates a woman’s clothing and accessories stand at the bazaar located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Haver is a widow and is currently living in Devechi with her four children. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $800 so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Ten years ago Minerva began to selling grocery items, buying small quantities of bread and milk to sell. She needed to start this business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover the education of their three children. The two oldest have now completed their university studies, and the youngest continues her studies and helps her mother with the business. During the last ten years, Minerva has expanded the range of products she offers.

However, lately her customers have been requesting items that she doesn't carry, so they've gone to the competition. Now Minerva can't generate enough income to cover the costs of her daughter's education, so she is requesting a loan, to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase additional merchandise such as office supplies (paper, pens and pencils, notebooks). By winning back her customers and growing her income, she will be able to achieve her dream that her daughter finishes university. With your help Minerva will be able to give her daughter a better future.

Hace 10 años que Minerva comenzó la venta de abarrotes comprando un poco de leche pan y latas. Minerva tubo que comenzar este negocio puesto que no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo para pagar los estudios de sus 3 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores lograron terminar la universidad satisfactoriamente y la más pequeña continua estudiando y por las tardes le ayuda a Minerva en el negocio. En estos 10 años Minerva a logrado aumentar la gama de productos en su tienda.

Sin embargo sus clientes le han pedido últimamente artículos que ella no posee esto hace que su clientela se vallan con la competencia y por lo tanto no puede adquirir tantos ingresos como ella desearía para poder pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija. Es por esto que Minerva esta solicitando un crédito de US $750, que esta dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Minerva podrá comprar mas mercancía como papelería (libretas, lápices, plumas, colores entre otras cosas) y asi poder cumplir su sueño, que su hija termine la Universidad. Con tu ayuda Minerva podrá sacar adelante a su hija.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL SHOP SO HER COMPETITION DOESN'T TAKE HER CUSTOMERS AWAY,  AND INCREASE HER INCOME SO THAT SHE CAN PAY FOR HER DAUGHTER TO FINISH UNIVERSITY.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., age, 29, works selling a variety of vegetables, making on average around $2.50 each day. Her husband is a construction worker making on average around $3 each day in revenue. Her children are too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.

loans.use: Sin would like to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.

loans.name: Fahmeeda's Group

texts.en: "I am a group leader, Fahmeeda B.. I am married and a mother of two sons. One of my sons has a tailoring business and the other is a rickshaw driver. He has been employed as a rickshaw driver by someone for almost a year. Now he feels a need to buy his own rickshaw.  Please lend [to] us for this purpose. I have another friend with me who is in a need of loan: Riffat B. needs this loan for the fixing of her husband’s rickshaw (sic)."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and support the other business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Every day for fifteen years, Carmen has entirely devoted herself to working at her soda fountain. She starts early to prepare everything for sale in the evening. It all started because she was unable to find work. She is trained as a social worker assistant and worked as such for fifteen years until the company she worked for went bankrupt. She tells us that before opening the soda fountain she spent some time looking for a job as a social worker’s assistant but since she did not find anything decided to work doing what she knows best, cooking. She now serves french fries and hot dogs, desserts, beverages, etc. What she most wants is to see her children grow up with a good education; thus together with her husband’s income as an electric technician almost all of their income is spent on their children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días, desde hace quince años, Carmen se dedica íntegramente a su fuente de soda. Desde temprano ella prepara todo lo necesario para sus ventas en la noche. Todo empezó para ella a raíz de que no encontraba trabajo. Ella es de profesión asistenta social y como tal, estuvo trabajando durante quince años hasta que la empresa que la empleaba quebró. Ella nos cuenta que antes de abrir su fuente de soda estuvo buscando trabajo como asistenta social por una temporada, pero como no la contrataban decidió trabajar haciendo lo que ella sabia, cocinar. Ahora atiende en su negocio vendiendo salchipapas, postres, bebidas etc. Lo que ella más desea es ver a sus hijos crecer con buena educación, es así que casi todos sus ingresos los invierte en ellos junto con su esposo quien trabaja como técnico electricista.

loans.use: Implement her soda fountain

loans.name: Plan De Lucha (Plan Of Attack) Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is a fun and vibrant woman, who, in spite of all of the hardships she has faced, continues to be optimistic and hardworking.  She lives with her eight children in a small and rural town in the interior section of the island The children range in ages from 4 to 19 years old, and she is raising them by herself!

Hilaria runs a small colmado, a kind of grocery store from her home. She also sells a small selection of used clothing.  She says she is planning to use this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, salt, jeans, blouses, and undergarments.  The loan will enable her to buy all of these items in bulk, and as a result she will be able to slightly increase her profit margin.  

She dreams that with the help of this loan, she will be able to give her children a good education, go back and finish school herself, expand her business into a big grocery store, and to one day own her own home and a motorcycle.  Before she never dreamed of achieving these things, but now she says she believes they are possible.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Hilaria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts and a better variety, of used and new clothing.

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin was born in 1964 in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has two children.

Six years ago, Seyfaddin started his business.He is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase a calf and balling presses to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and balling presses

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama H. is 41 years old, has four children and works as a janitor for a building in Saida in south Lebanon. He makes a living offering his services to residents and commercial tenants in the building. Oussama's house was destroyed during the war of July, 2006, and he needs a loan of $1,000 to renovate it and thereby assure a better life for his family. This is Oussama's first loan request from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia, a 40-year-old married woman with four children aged 20, 16, 13 and 9, owns a clothing shop which she started in 2006.  Working daily from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rukia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her shop

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en: Banovsha is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. She was born in 1956. She has been in the farming business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat Z. is 51 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and socks for teenagers. Rafoat says that lending services from IMON have helped her business grow over the past 3 years.

Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Rafoat needs a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) which she will use to buy clothing for teenagers for the autumn season to meet the demand of her customers and continue growing her business. She is committed to paying back this loan in 12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn clothing for teenagers for re-sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Z. D. is a single mother with two children, aged 22 and 23, living in Ayacucho, Peru. She is a member of the community bank, Alborada, which means “dawn” in Spanish. Rosa can be found selling children’s clothing in the market on Jr. 12 de abril in Ayacucho. She travels monthly to Lima to purchase inventory for her business.

Her loan of 1500 soles will be invested in her business by purchasing pants, button-up women’s sweaters, workout clothing and jackets to sell. Her goals are to continue improving her business and to ensure her children become professionals.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco S. T., guatemalteco, de 44 años de edad, casado, del Sector A-07 del paraje Chiambrocio, Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán,  él se dedica al comercio desde sus 32 años de edad, iniciando con un pequeño capital, ahora con la ayuda de su esposa María Graciela Velásquez Chuc han decidido agrandar el negocio para que así puedan mantener a la familia y también tener comodidades. Por tal motivo necesitan la ayuda de ASDIR para poder agrandar el negocio. Con el credito le permite compra materia prima, herramientas para producir mas y que le facilite el trabajo y ser competitivo, en el mercado y aprobechar las fiesta de fin de año y como la fiesta de la comunidad en el mes de Enero dos mil nueve  y como el inicio del nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco S. T. is 44 years old and lives in Guatemala. He lives in the A-07 sector of Chiambrocio, Chotacaj County, Totonicapán. He has worked in his business since he was 32 years old and began with a small amount of capital. Now with the help of his wife María Graciela Velásquez Chuc, they have decided to expand the business so they can support their family and also have material comforts. For this reason they need ASDIR’s help to be able to expand their business. With this loan, Juan will be able to buy raw materials and tools to produce more products, to make work easier, and to be competitive in the market. He will take advantage of the coming New Year festival, the community celebration during January 2009, and the beginning of the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua. 

Nancy is 35 years old and single with two children. She has a chicken restaurant, located on a very busy street, where she employs four staff to help her serve the public. Nancy is the head cook.

Nancy also sells a variety of clothing by special order. Nancy needs a loan of 2000 Soles to buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside her restaurant.  

Nancy’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open another location for her restaurant. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua. 
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un restaurante y polleria ubicado en una avenida muy transitada, el local es alquilado y tiene 4 personas que le ayudan en la atención al publico, Nancy se encarga de la cocina. Además Nancy vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz por sacos y un letrero publicitario para su negocio. 
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios profesionales e implementar otra sucursal.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside of restaurant

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.ru: Акрамова Мохчехра жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 28 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей.Семь лет занимается торговлей . Торгует одеждой на рынке города КУрган-тюбе. Для завоза сезонного товара и увеличения ассортимента планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев. Хочет привезти  зимний товар.
texts.en:
Mohchehra A. lives in the town of Kurgan-tube. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She has been in the retail business for seven years. She sells clothing on the market of Kurgan-tube. Mohchehra decided to apply for a loan for a term of 12 months to bring in seasonal clothing and increase inventory circulation. She want to buy winter merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Evonne Mahle

texts.en:
Evonne is married with three children and lives in Ngomgham, Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her "buyam sellam" raw food stuff and her piggery and poultry. More specifically, she will purchase Irish potatoes, beans, maize, three piglets, and 30 fowls. Evonne also plans to contribute 100,000 CFA ($200 USD) of her personal savings towards these purchases.  
 
This is Evonne's fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She has been working in her "buyam sellam" business for a number of years now and has since found the items she sells from suppliers; this ensures she gets the best prices on these items. Evonne now has many customers who come to her for all of their vegetables. She allows some people to create tabs with her for their purchases and pay her at the end of the month. Her contribution to her community provides them with these items in closer proximity to their community, cutting down on their travel costs and the time involved in searching for these items.
 
With the profits from this loan, Evonne plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider adding other food stuffs to her stall. Her profits will also provide her the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food stall

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor D. lives with her husband in the center of Uvurhangai, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Her husband works as a receptionist in an elementary school, and her son is a soldier.

Tserendolgor worked as a tailor in a sewing factory for many years, but in 2000, she quit that job and started sewing a variety of clothes at home to sell. People come to her to order specific clothes with a specific design. In addition, she began renting a clothing stall at the local market last year, and moved her sewing machine there. Then she started sewing and selling at the same stall at same time. The orders people are giving her have increased day-to-day, since she has no competitors who run the same business. She would like to expand her business, and therefore she requests a loan to buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret N. is the leader of Ivunamba group in Jinja. In the photo, she is with Robinah L.. 

Gorret has a business selling matooke, a stew of plantains, beef, and dried fish cooked in a beef and tomato stock. She gets some of the plantains for the matooke from her farm. She buys the rest from other farmers for increased profits. 

Robinah has a poultry business in which she raises local and exotic chickens for sale. Both ladies would like a loan to invest more in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy matooke and chicken feed

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita owns and manages a sari-sari store (community based variety store) in their village in Alinguigan 3rd. Her weekly income of PHP 1,500 was being budget for the needs of her family and as a rolling capital for her business. However, this was not enough to support all their needs. For this, Merlita wanted to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise that she can sell for a bigger income. Thus, she is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000. She is hoping that her request is granted so that she is able to pursue her business plan.

Merlita is married to Espedito and he is working as a jeepney (small bus) driver. They are blessed with five children who are all studying: Marjorene -19 years old, a B.S. Information Technology student; Joana Marie - 16 years old and Dianne - 15 years old, both high school students; Mark Anthony - 12 years old and Christine, 9 years are in the elementary level. Merlita is happy that they have unity in their family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en:
Olubisi O. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tường Thị M. Hạ was born in 1962 (no: 010114070017). She lives with her husband and two sons. She has a small confectionery at home (selling cold drinks, beer, Coca-Cola, tea, juice, cake, sweets, etc.). She raises chickens, too. Her husband is a builder. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $113). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong to buy goods to sell and buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: To increase store inventory and buy chicken feed

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
LILIAM NUÑEZ D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS GEMAS II” vive en Jr. Piura Nº 131, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 47 años D. edad, 03 hijos mayores , y su pareja se dedica al comercio D. bebidas.

Se inició en el negocio D. artículos para belleza y venta D. perfumes, lo hace a través D. catálogos.  El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrar sus productos, ella es técnica farmacéutica y su negocio ha ido creciendo.  Paralelamente está ingresando, D. algún modo, al negocio D. la botica (venta D. medicinas)  en conjunto con su familia.

A la fecha el negocio D. venta D. medicinas ha mejorado e incrementado las ventas, por lo que requiere D. un mayor capital.  Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y medicina.

“Manuela Ramos me dio muchas oportunidades entre ellas trabajar conjuntamente con mi familia donD. además D. tener un ingreso económico también estamos unidos para seguir adelante.” refirió.
texts.en:
Liliam Nunez D. S. lives in the city of Pucallpa and is a member of the communal bank called Las Gemas II. She is 47 years old and has three grown children. Her husband sells beverages for work. She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes through catalogs. With her first loan, she purchased a small display case to show her products. Liliam is a pharmacy technician and her business has been growing. In parallel to her investment in selling beauty products, she also works together with her family selling medicines.

To date, medicine sales have improved and have increased sales, and now she needs more capital to invest in cosmetics, perfumes as well as more medicine. She says that Manuel Ramos has given her many opportunities to work together with her family, not only providing a source of income, but uniting them in improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfumes and medicines for her business

loans.name: Kosiwa Nicole

texts.fr: Marié et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier d’adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Son mari est un chauffeur, le revenu de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, pour l’aider elle  s’est lancé dans le commerce de pagnes. le commerce de pagnes est très développé à Lomé, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de  bonnes recettes tous les jours. Sa clientèle s’agrandit elle veut par conséquent agrandir son stock de marchandises pour mieux vendre, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qui lui a permis de démarrer son commerce, elle sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 2 children, this woman lives with her husband and children in the Adidogomé neighborhood which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses. To help him, she began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth).

Selling "pagnes" is big business in Lomé, so she brings in a good income every day. Her clientele is growing so she would like to expand her inventory so as to sell more, having already obtained one loan from WAGES which allowed her to set herself up in business. She is requesting a second loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace medio año tiene su propia granja de cuyes, dedicándose a la limpieza y alimentación de sus animales. Todos los días por las mañanas sale a cortar alfalfa para alimentarlos y después de varias horas sacar el excremento, este método logra la salubridad de sus animales y de ella misma. Los fines de semana los lleva a las ferias ganaderas para su comercialización y también los ofrece a sus vecinos. Para un futuro cercano, Betty desea tener una granja grande e incursionar en la crianza de pollos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal y está disfrutando mucho de participar en cada reunión de coordinación de su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará cuyes sementales para reproducir la cantidad de sus animales con una raza mejorada, también comprará conejos.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old and lives in her parents' home. She has had her own guinea pig farm business for the last six months. She takes care of the farm, cleaning and feeding the animals. Every day in the morning she cuts alfalfa leaves to feed them and then cleans after the stool to achieve the safety of her animals and herself. She takes the animals on the weekends to the livestock fairs to sell them, and also offers them to her neighbors.

For the near future, Betty wants to have a large farm and go into raising chickens. This is the first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of the community bank and is enjoying a lot her participation at each meeting of the coordinating group. The money from the loan will be invested in buying guinea pigs to improve the race and rabbits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and rabbits

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 30 years old and she is married with a child. She sells second-hand clothes and poultry. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and poultry to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes and poultry to sell

loans.name: Nube Maricela

texts.es:
Nube es nativa de Azogues, ella vive por el parque central y nos cuenta que la mayoría de la gente en el sector  rural se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, y que los  hombres emigran al extranjero.

Ella tiene  24 años y divorciada desde hace 2 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años por el que tiene que responder sola, actualmente vive con sus padres.

 Es egresada en Economía y Finanzas en la Universidad Católica de Azogues  y esta realizando el seminario de graduación.

Nube tiene dos boutiques de ropa,  en la una tiene ropa variada para damas caballers y niños  y la otra exclusivamente de mujer;  trabaja con una prima de 9 AM a 9 PM, no cierra al medio día porque el trabajo  es rentable, sobre todo los fines de semana se vende mas, dice. 

Trabaja con ropa americana, panameña y nacional, tiene algunos  distribuidores y sus utilidades es más o menos de 400 a 500 dólares mensuales. Por  ejemplo en cada prenda tiene un utilidad de 5 dólares.

Le gusta la sociedad de crédito y el préstamo lo hará para adquirir más mercadería y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es obtener el titulo profesional y luego comprarse una casa para así independizarse con su hijo.
texts.en:
Nube is a native of Azogues. She lives near the central park. She tells us that the majority of the people in the rural area work in agriculture and commerce, and that the men emigrate to other countries. She is 24 years old and has been divorced for 2 years. She has a 2 year old son for whom she alone is responsible. They currently live with Nube's parents. She has completed her studies in Economy and Finance at the Catholic University of Azogues and is currently completing the final "seminario de graduación", similar to a senior thesis on a particular topic, required before graduation. Nube has 2 clothing boutiques. In one she sells a variety of clothing for women, men and children, and in the other she exclusively sells women's clothing. She works with her cousin from 9 AM to 9 PM. She does not close at midday because the work is profitable, particularly on weekends, which is when she sells the most, she says. She works with american clothing, clothing made in Panama and clothing manufactured domestically, in Ecuador. She has some distributors and her profits are more or less 400 to 500 dollars per month. For example, she earns a profit of 5 dollars on each piece of clothing. She likes the local lending association and will use this loan to buy more merchandise and expand her business. Her dream is to earn her professional college degree and later buy herself a house so she can live independently with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2008 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, une partie de son stock a baissé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 bidons de 25 litres d’huile, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 3 sacs de riz et divers produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. started raising hogs more than a decade ago, to help with the family finances and send her children to school. Being a mother of three children, she had to work hard to grow her business to provide for her family's needs and help pay the school fees. 
With her membership in CEVI last year, she was able to purchase hog supplements to continue raising hogs. She hopes to receive a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy supplements for her hogs. Erlinda says that the income she makes helps her family in many ways, especially with her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 33 married with four children aged between 4 and 10 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Juliet resides and rents a three roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Mengo Mackay Kosovo zone. Juliet works seven days a week. She buys her chicken feeds from Owino Market and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent as she works from her home.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Juliet has been in this business for 18 years and with MCDT for seven, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feeds and chicks l. Juliet is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning 800 chicken .

loans.use: to buy more chicken feeds and chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita M. married at the early age of 19. Now she is 27 years old and has four children whose ages range from one to six. Her 32-year-old husband is a driver and a sweet lover. Her disappointments about life being poor are oftentimes overtaken by excitement to face more challenge because of the inspiration brought about by her husband and children.

In 2008, Angelita joined ASHI and requested a loan which she used to start up a buy and sell business. Now, she is requesting a much larger loan, wanting to grow her business, and profits as well, to be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.

Angelita’s husband supports her decision in this because he saw from her previous loan that she is happy having her business and spending her profits on the needs of their children, especially for their education. He knows that she has been dreaming of nothing else but for their children to enjoy life and graduate from college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and piglets for her livestock-raising business and also to finance her junk buy and sell business

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch L., 54, is married with three children and resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband. To make a living, she sells food and rents parts of her house, earning an income of US $11 per day as a primary source of income for the family to help cover the household expenses. Also, her husband helps his wife with the current business. The family is partly assisted by one of her children who is an accountant for a private company. L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $500 to expand the current business by selling more types of food to her new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To expand the food selling business

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 3, 4, & 5 Group

texts.en:
Paul, 36, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Amigos Unidos (Friends United), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Paul and his wife have four children, ages 1 month to 11 years. Together with the rest of the Amigos Unidos group, they live in Batey Los Gunoco. Bateyes are small rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. People who live in bateyes generally have no running water, little to no electricity, and poor medical attention. Despite these difficulties, Paul has found success in his business selling clothing to friends and neighbors. With this loan, he hopes to buy more used and new clothing, including shoes, blouses, and pants.

Paul has big dreams for the future, and with your support he can get there. Paul dreams of owning his own disco one day, providing a fun place for the people in his community to spend their time. With the profits from his business through past loans, Paul has already begun building his own H. for his family. He hopes to finish the house soon with additional profits. Paul also hopes to send his children to college so they can become lawyers, doctors, architects, or anything they want to be. Paul’s dreams for himself, his business, and his family are lofty, but Esperanza believes in his vision and in the vision of the Amigos Unidos group. Thank you for lending!

loans.use: New and used clothing

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"T. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107010029) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  T. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lực Canh 3 (6).

T. is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, T. makes and sells a variety of food products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately $165 a month from this activity.

In 2006, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.578.000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 5th loan from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị T. H. (10107010073) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Đinh Thị H. (10107010070) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5.450.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Diêm Thị T. (10107010044) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.450.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107010029) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Lực Canh 3 (6).


Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị T. H. (10107010073) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Đinh Thị H. (10107010070) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Diêm Thị T. (10107010044) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danilo Cruz

texts.es: Danilo tiene más de 10 años de trabajar con créditos individuales en  la Institución, mostrando un buen record crediticio, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de huevos y una pequeña pulpería donde oferta productos varios de primera necesidad. El habita en una vivienda que tiene todos los servicios básicos, agua potable, aguas servidas, energía y convive con su esposa .su meta ha sido siempre el mantener el negocio estable para ayudar al bienestar de la familia. el financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de mas productos para su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Danilo has taken out individual loans for over 10 years with the organization, demonstrating a good credit record. His business is the purchase and sale of eggs and a small shop where he offers essential household items. He lives with his wife in a house that has all basic services- potable water, a sewage connection, and electricity.

His goal has always been to maintain a stable business in order to see to the welfare of his family. He is requesting financing to purchase more products for his business.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz H. is 44 years old. He is married and has six children! He is a hard-working man who has fought to educate his children and provide for his family.

Eyvaz has much experience in raising calves because he observed it from a young age. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in the form of investment in his business to allow him to buy more cattle. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow.

Eyvaz applied for a loan to buy calves. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you will provide them by helping him continue his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna F. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de SAINTE ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle achète des porcs sur pieds, les abat pour vendre la viande au kilogramme. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'autofinancement.
texts.en:
Anna F. is 39 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the "banc villageois" of SAINTE ANNE for the past 5 years and has received 10 loans that she has always managed well and paid back on time. She buys live pigs and slaughters them in order to sell the meat by weight. Her objective is to increase her savings and become more financially autonomous.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her lucrative activity

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth
