texts.es: La señora MAGDA ELIZABETH B. Q. labora para CEPRODEL , es soltera , pero tiene dos niños a su cargo que son sobrinos de ella y ella les ayuda económicamente , los créditos anteriores lo ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , este ultimo crédito lo va a utilizar para matricula y compra de material didáctico para sus sobrinos ya que estamos en época de apertura de año escolar. Agradece a CEPRODEL `por la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de  vida y ayudar a sus sobrinos a superarse.
texts.en:
Magda Elizabeth B. Q. works for Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She is single but is the primary caregiver and financial supporter for two children, who are her nephews. Her previous loans were used for home improvements. The loan currently being requested will be applied toward tuition and school supplies for her nephews, who are approaching the start of a new school year. She thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity to improve their collective quality of life and to help her nephews to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Marilia Ivone

texts.pt:
Marilia Ivone S. M. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 52 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 15 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os filhos e ainda sustenta dois netos vivem com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Xai-xai ainda muito nova quando foi transferido o seu pai pela empresa onde trabalhava. No ano 2000 sai de Xai-xai para Boane onde fixou sua residência. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 12 anos, em media faz cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia e não possui nenhum empregado. Vende mais extenções para cabelo onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atraves do Xitique mensal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimo na Associação de Credito GUEGUE mais tarde não continuou devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada, produtos para cabelo, sapatos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 9.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar ainda mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Marilia Ivone S. M. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique. She is 52 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children who are 17 and 15 years old. Both of them go to school. She only completed the 8th grade and did not continue because of a lack of financial means. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her. She left Manjacaze for Xai-Xai when she was very young because of her father's job transfer. In 2000, she left Xai-Xai for Boane where she established her home. She has had her own business for more than 12 years. She works around 12 hours each day and doesn't have any employees. She sells hair extensions and earns about 6,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She even saves some monthly through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She had a previous loan with the GUEGUE Credit Association, but did not continue with them for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is also a client of the institution. She is her 4th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy supplies (bundles of used clothing, hair products, shoes, etc.) in order to increase her stock. The previous loans were for 9,000 MZN, 13,000 MZN, and 13,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. She promises to pay back the loan in a timely manner so she can have access to others. In the future, she would like to request more loans to use for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beauty products (hair extension products)

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa Del Carmen tiene 42 años de edad. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería además posee otro negocio como la elaboración y venta de tortillas ella es muy responsable con su cuotas de pago por lo que siempre esta activa con ambos negocios, aunque es muy difícil ya que el cansancio de todo el día al realizar estas tareas le perjudica mucho en su salud, pero no se rinde pues ambos negocios le proporcionan el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto pude comprar productos como frutas, golosinas, y productos de consumo diario. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio con mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
Josefa Del Carmen is 42 years of age. Doña Josefa has 4 children. Her business is a small convenience store. In addition she has another business making and selling tortillas.

She is very responsible about making her payments. This is why she is always busy with both businesses. It is very tiring to carry out all her tasks every day, and this has harmed her health a lot. She doesn’t give up, however, since both businesses provide her with her daily bread.

The loan is for working capital. With it she will be able to purchase products such as fruits, sweets, and other products that are consumed daily. Her wish is to enlarge her business with a bigger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: In a big city like New York it can be very difficult to find a babysitter; people generally rely on word of mouth. With her entrepreneurial spirit, Melody saw an unfilled need and decided to launch a babysitting placement service in April, 2008. Melody's business has brought independence to her life. The flexibility of being her own boss allows her to still continue her career as a singer and performer in New York City and spend more time with her son. Melody found traditional bank loans too costly and difficult to acquire. She was recommended to ACCION USA for an affordable, small business loan. Melody will use her ACCION USA loan to purchase another computer for her growing staff, to provide age-appropriate toys for babysitters, and to ramp up her promotional efforts. Her vision is to expand her babysitting service; therefore, creating more jobs and at the same time raising awareness on the importance of child development. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase a new computor and toys and for marketing

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita F. is a 70-year-old widowed woman who lives with her two children named Mosies and F.. The two children are 24 and 32 years of age and are very supportive and loving children to their mother. Mosies works sporadically as a hired laborer who earns a small amount of money. F. is a fisherman who goes to fish with other fishermen in their village, for he doesn’t have his own fishing boat to use for fishing anytime he wants to earn money for supporting their daily needs. 

Despite the economic status of her family, Enriquita feels fortunate to have children as responsible as her children. For her, being old is not a reason to not be productive, especially to help her loved ones. As a matter of fact, she joined ASHI in 2008 wanting to partner with her fisherman son to grow his business. The loans she has been requesting and is requesting now is her source of capital to achieve the desire of her heart. 

Despite her old age, Enriquita is still capable of selling the fish caught by her son to people around their village. The profits she earns provide her family with simple things they really enjoy; though for Enriquita, those things they have may not be enough. Her sons still have some desires for their lives kept in their hearts, yet she has never heard them complain about the kind of life they have. Through ASHI, Enriquita hopes that one day her business will flourish and bring improvements in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is a small-business owner and a married woman. She runs a business selling food, both cooked and fried, to customers at Tandika market in Dar es Salaam. She also sells soft drinks.

Amina purchases her business goods from the food shops and food market at Tandika. The business income enables her to pay her children’s school fees and meet her family’s daily needs.

Amina is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly Q. is from the village of Binahalan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Merly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Merly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German W. L. vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, uno de ellos en cantante en un grupo musical de la ciudad y su hija menor acude a la universidad. El señor German trabaja en la Empresa Nacional de Electricidad (ENDE) como topógrafo por más de 20 años. El señor German requiere el préstamo para la compra de una computadora que le ayudara con el manejo de su trabajo puesto que como él nos cuenta cada vez es más difícil por la manera como se actualiza y mejora la manera de hacer topografías.

El señor German nos cuenta que muchos sueños que tenia gracias a Dios ya se cumplieron pero que su próximo gran sueño es ver a sus hijos ser lo mejor que puedan y tengan un futuro exitoso, y poder estar algún día a lado de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sr. German W. L. lives in the city of Cochabamba. He has two adult children, one is a singer for a musical group that performs in the city and his younger daughter attends the university. Sr. German has been working for the National Electricity Enterprise (ENDE) as a topographer for more than 20 years. He needs a loan to buy a computer to help him manage his work, since it has become increasingly more difficult to create and update topography maps.

Sr. German says he has many dreams and thanks God that many of them have already been fulfilled. However, his next greatest dream is to see his children become the best at what they do and have a successful future. One day he also hopes to have grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for work

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Javier Antonio H. P., El trabaja como Gerente General en el Mercado Israel Lewite de Managua.
Es padre  de familia  de un hijo  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en gasto de medicamento de un familiar que esta enfermo.

Javier Antonio  dice que gracias a los financiamientos  otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Antonio H. P. works as the general manager of the Israel Lewite Market in Managua. He is married with a school-age son. He is asking for the loan to buy medication for a relative that is sick. Javier Antonio says that thanks to the loan from CEPRODEL he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medication for a sick relative

loans.name: Mr. Narong Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 24 members of this village bank loan live I. Preah Theat village I. Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for their own purpose.

Mr. NaR. Y., born I. 1958, was selected village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. Ven Sok, are farmers. They own a small piece of land and grow crops to sell to support their family.

Now they have a problem because their field is infertile soil. To improve production, Mr. NaR. Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay farm laborers.

He is a father of six childR.. Two are seamstresses I. a garment factory, one is a driver, and the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay farm laborers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia L. is from the town of Trento. She is 50 years old. Virginia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years. She wishes for her children to finish college and have a bright future. Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster-group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Promesse Plus Group

texts.en:
Virginie L. is the manager of the Community bank named “Promesse Plus”. It is composed of 23 members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Virginie started her business in 2003 with a capital of US$ 20 selling yogurt. Today, she operates a general boutique. She is 42 years old, widowed, and has two children whose ages are 13 and 15. Both go to school. She has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans nine times and has fully repaid them. With the profit of about $80 earned per week, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying canned goods, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other items to resell at a profit. 

Currently, Virginie is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loans she has received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells her goods in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: reinforcing her working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Bertha, es casada y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya mayores de edad que estudian en la universidad, el menor  todavía está en el colegio, es muy feliz porque que  todos viven aun en su casa.

Se dedica a la  venta de ropa, en especial la de niños ya que a ella le fascina esa ropa y dice que tiene más salida que las otras. Su estrategia de venta es de puerta en puerta. Empezó con muy poco y ahora su negocio ha crecido mucho porque tiene muchos pedidos.

Es así como va a emplear su nuevo crédito para comprar más mercaderías, en especial vestidos de niñas por que tiene varios encargados. Ingreso al Banco Comunal hace 46 ciclos y está muy contenta.

Su meta es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) gather together in Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for a great diversity of traditional products such as straw hats that are famous both inside and outside of the country.

Sra. Bertha is married and has three children, two of whom are adults and studying at the university. The youngest is still in high school. Bertha is very happy because they all still live at home.

She sells clothing, especially children’s clothes because she likes these types of garments and says that they are more popular than other types of apparel. Her strategy is to sell door to door. She started with very little and now her business has grown tremendously because she has many orders.

Bertha will use this loan to buy more merchandise, especially girls’ dresses because she has several orders for these items. She has participated in 46 loan cycles with her Communal Bank and is very pleased. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase girls' dresses

loans.name: Patricia Gina

texts.es: La Señora Patricia  se dedica a la venta de productos a pedido, desde edredones, ropa, vajillas  hasta vehículos a medio uso, es muy joven y trabaja con el capital propio y del esposo, solicitaron el préstamo ya que tuvo demanda de pedidos ella deja sus productos a crédito y va cobrando semanalmente o quincenalmente, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene dos pequeños hijos, quiere a futuro tener un negocio grande de vehículos a medio uso ya vio que en este negocio existe un poco mas de ganancia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia sells products to order, including comforters, clothing, tableware, and even used vehicles. She’s young and works with her own capital and that of her husband. They requested this loan because they have orders to fill. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or biweekly. She is very hard working and has two young children. In the future she wants to start a large used vehicle business, now that she realizes that this type of business brings in a bit more income. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Lê Thị (20209020025) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Huệ is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huệ owns a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4.200.000 VND a month from it.


In 2008, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.  The loan will be her fourth loan from SEDA.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ  Lê Thị (20209020025) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục đặc trưng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ  kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Huệ  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huệ  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M.  (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. S. and her husband are farmers and raise cows, earning an income of USD 5.00 per day. Two of her children are employed as a driver and a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 4.00 per day. The family has to spend USD 30.00 on food, USD 10.00 on public transportation, and USD 15.00 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cows and a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and cows.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria M., tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es casada y su esposo labora en un taller como fresador, ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de ellos adolescente y el mayor que estudia la universidad, la señora se dedica a vender Ropa, Plásticos, y Recargas telefónicas, desde hace 11 años, sus ventas bajan según las temporadas, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de Plastico que favorezca el aumento en las ventas, ella ha observado que esta inversión tiene bastante demanda en su emrcaxdo meta, puesto que la situación del país no permite que la población compren piezas de vidrio o porcelana en los Centros Comerciales, a corto plazo brindara un mejor solvento en el gasto en el que se incurre en la universidad del hijo mayor, que es una necesidad para su formación académica adecuada de su desarrollo socioeconómico en beneficio de su futura familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria M. is 42 years old and lives in the Sabana Grande district. She is married and her husband works as a miller in a workshop. They have two children, one is a teenager and the elder one is at college studying. For the last 11 years, Señora M. has been selling clothing, plastic items and rechargeable phone cards. Her sales fluctuate with the seasons. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy plastic items, which  will allow her to increase her sales. She has noticed that this investment has an adequate market demand, since the country's situation does not allow people to buy glass or porcelain items in shopping centers. In the short term this will allow her to better afford her eldest child's university expenses, which are necessary to provide him with academic training suitable for his socioeconomic development and for the benefit of his future family.

loans.use: To buy plastic items

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina J. is from the village of Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Marcelina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina plants and harvests corn for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Theodole

texts.en:
Theodole is 30 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Theodole sells clothing in Kabarondo district in Rwanda. This requires him to work hard so that he can provide for his children with all their needs.  Theodole has been working in this business for three years and his store is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Theodole has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to help expand his business and purchase more clothing to sell.  He hopes this will help increase his profits and allow him to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Daniel Mwania

texts.en:
Daniel, age 35, is married to Joyce. They have four children, ages 6, 8, 10, and 12. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells various food items like bread, cereals, sugar, milk, and many others. He sells items in small quantities.  

Daniel was introduced to Kadet through a public awareness effort organized by the local chief. He has been running this business for 10 years. He intends to use this loan to buy more cereals, cooking oil, flour, and other items. If the loan improves the business, he will pay school fees for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, and cereals

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en: Buyanhishig E., 52 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His youngest daughter attends a local high school and his wife is retired. Buyanhishig operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. Buyanhishig has owned this business for almost 20 years and over this long time he has gained a lot of experience. For the future, he plans to build his own house. He is a hardworking man and is requesting this 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for his construction decoration business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from the town of Plaridel. She is 40 years old. Wilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Wilma is just starting this business.

In 2002, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del banco comunal “Cuentas Claras”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua. Ella tiene una amasandería hace 3 años en un local cercano a su casa, sin embargo hace 30 años que trabaja en este rubro. Además vende colaciones para obreros de la construcción. Su hija mayor trabaja con ella en este negocio. 
Gracias a los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza ha ido adquiriendo diferentes máquinas como una congeladora, cortadora de cecinas y una máquina conservadora de alimentos, ya que su sueño es incorporar más productos a su negocio. Ahora que cuenta con las máquinas necesarias, con este préstamo comprará mercadería como por ejemplo: lácteos, pollos congelados y cecinas.
Su sueño es tener un mini restaurante para atender mejor a sus clientes de las colaciones.
Juana es maestra de cocina, le gusta mucho su trabajo y está muy agradecida del apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que con los préstamos que ha recibido ha logrado ir creciendo en su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Cuentas Claras" and lives in the city of Rancagua.  She has owned a bakery near her house for 3 years now, however, she has 30 years of experience in this profession.  She also sells snacks or light meals to construction workers.  Her oldest daughter works with her in the business.  Thanks to the loans from Fondo Esperanza she has been able to purchase various appliances such as a freezer, a meat slicer and a cooler.  Her dream is to incorporate more products into her business.  Now that she has the necessary appliances, with this loan she will buy  merchandise such as dairy products, frozen chicken and dried meat.  Her dream is to have a small restaurant so that she can better serve her customers that buy snacks from her.  Juana is a master in the kitchen and she really likes her work.  She is very grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza since because of the loans that she has received, her business has grown.  

Rancagua is in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that regulates the main fruit-growing and wine production and exportation in Chile.  It is also a mining city because, located its mountain range, is the largest underground mine in the world, "El Teniente", with its 4,500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: Dairy products. frozen chicken and dried meat

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est née à Tsévié et habite  quartier Adidogomé.  Elle est mariée et a  4 enfants à sa charge.  Elle fait le commerce de chaussures d’homme et de la femme. Elle les revend au marché d’Adidogomé et s’approvisionne au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle a commencé  en 2000 cette activité et a reçu 2 crédits  qu’elle a  parfaitement   remboursé.    Elle  sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  20 paires de chaussures d’homme et   25   paires de chaussures  femme.
texts.en: Akossiwa was born in Tsévié and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She is married and supports four children. She sells shoes for men and women. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and retails the shoes at the market in Adidogomé. She began this activity in 2000 and received so far two loans which she fully repaid on schedule. She applies for a loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes for men and 25 pairs for women.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She sells groceries from a small store in her parents' house. She will be using her loan of 600 PEN to purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies for her store. Business has been a bit slow during the rainy season, but she expects it to pick up once the school year begins in March. Elena is a member of the communal bank "Los Laureles," which is in its 38th loan cycle. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and was invited by a friend. She enjoys that the loan officers teach her how to save and have informal guidance sessions during bank meetings.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Tabethsu Finoh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Kiva's partners in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tabethsu Finoh” group. They are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Malikie S. is the leader of this group. Makikie is 33 years old and married, with 3 children who attend primary school. Malikie has been operating a business selling cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, and other items for five years. With the help of this loan, Malikie will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 54 years old and married with five children. Merilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merilyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Merilyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, etc.

In the future, Merilyn would like to expand her business and take care of family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Mwanamisi Ali

texts.en:
Mwanamisi Ali S. is 49 years old. She is married to Ali S. and they have been blessed with seven children. For the past three years, Mwanamisi has been in the poultry business. Her business is doing well. She is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more chicks to raise and sell. 

Mwanamisi will use the surplus income generated from her loan to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Til

texts.en:
Til S. has been in farming business for a long time.  She had learned from her grandparent when she was still unmarried. She is now married and has four kids, three of whom are unmarried and the other is married and lives independently. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Til S. is going to use her loan to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season. 

Note: Til S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). 

Harriet has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and she would like to start importing clothes herself. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica a la elaboración de repostería. Desde hace más de 12 años, es una persona muy entregada y disfruta de su negocio. Alba a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para poder brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente ella realiza su trabajo todos los días pues. A ella le gusta mucho trabajar en la elaboración de sus queques, pasteles, semitas, picos, bocadillos entre otros, aunque siempre le es difícil lograr complacer a sus clientes que le solicitan encargos muy complicados, pero los termina logrando. Este crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, colorantes, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a pastry maker.  She’s been in business for over 12 years.  She is a very dedicated woman who enjoys her work.  All through her life, Alba has worked hard to provide her family with necessary comforts so she currently works every day.

She enjoys making cakes, pies, semitas, picos, and bocadillos (types of pastry and rolls), among others.  Although it’s often difficult for her to please customers that make complicated requests, in the end she always manages to do so.  

This loan is to buy flour, eggs, food coloring and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, food coloring and tools, among others.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 51 años de edad. Es un hombre casado y vive con su familia en casa propia, ubicada en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de  Pitipo – Ferreñafe. La comunidad donde Pedro vive es pequeña y está en vías de desarrollo.

Pedro se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y de aves de corral (patos, gallinas, pollos) desde hace más de 10 años, dentro de su comunidad. Pedro cuenta con clientela establecida y desea invertir en mejorar los corrales en los cuales cría a sus animales, para que estén en buenas condiciones y para aumentar el número de estos.

Pedro cría a sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuenta con un gran espacio donde está construyendo varios cuartos de corral y para terminar la construcción de estos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, que le serán de gran utilidad para su actividad.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old.  He is a married man who lives with his family in his own home, located in a rural community in the district of Pitipo – Ferreñafe.  The community where Pedro lives is small but it is developing.

Pedro has run a business in his community raising and selling small animals and barnyard fowl (ducks, hens, and chickens) for more than 10 years.  Pedro has an established customer base, and he wants to invest in improving the corrals where he raises his animals, so that they will be in good condition, and so that he can have more of them.

Pedro raises his animals in the back of his house; he has a big space where he is building a number of pens.  To finish the construction of these pens, he requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will be very useful for his business.

loans.use: to build pens for his animals in the back of his house

loans.name: Nyabihoko Twebiseho Group, Kihihi

texts.en: Onesta is the leader of Nyabihoko Twebiseho group, Kihihi. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children and all of them are in school. She has a retail shop dealing in general merchandise in Bigiri Trading Centre and it has been in existence for 17 years. Onesta is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profits selling mostly to the local population. She is also involved in the sale of tea since she has a tea plantation as her source of capital for the shop. She best describes herself as very hardworking and she needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, soap, pens, pencils and other merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, pens, pencils and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old, married and has four children, nineteen, fifteen, twelve and eight years of age. She has been a butcher for two years. She earns a monthly income of about 6,000 KES, which she uses to restock her shop and take care of her family.

Jane has been loaned 20,000 KES by KADET LTD, her first loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to buy more meat for her butchery. She plans to use the profits from her business to open up another shop to sell her supplies of honey and wedding and special occasion beverages.

In the future, Jane hopes to send all of her children to college and establish herself fully in business.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her butchery.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal, natural de la ciudad de San Miguel, tiene 47 años de edad, es un hombre comprometido en su trabajo, esta casado con Alejandrina de 44 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa  donde reina la compresión y el apoyo mutuo entre si. Vidal, empezó su aventura como carpintero desde muy niño en el taller de sus padres. Su pasión  por el oficio le llevó a adquirir sus propias herramientas de trabajo donde viene puliendo las maderas desde hace 24 años en su propio taller. Juan a la vez trabaja para colegios, instituciones y municipalidades de la zona fabricando mesas, sillas, andamios, roperos, escritorios y entre otros muebles. Cuenta con 03 ayudantes en el taller quienes se encargan de pulir y barnizar, es así que se siente muy comprometido en su labor, su lema es la puntualidad, pues hace a tiempo los trabajos que le encomiendan sus clientes. Sin embargo esta labor perjudica mucho su salud, debido a que absorbe el aserrín, es por ello que sus tratamientos médicos lo realizan cada cierto tiempo. Otras de los problemas que tiene, es que no cuenta con  suficiente capital para comprar más madera, es por ello que recurre a la institución MFP, para que le facilite un crédito. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar maderas ya que es el factor principal de su producción. Este será su segundo crédito y esta muy contento de trabajar con MFP a la vez agradece por adelantado a los financistas por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo, en esta oportunidad también espera contar con el apoyo para así salir adelante. Con los 2,000  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará bloques de madera.
texts.en:
Vidal is a native of San Miguel.  He is 47 years old and is dedicated to his work.  He is married to 44 year old Alejandrina and they have three children together.  They live in a home of their own, where mutual support and compassion rules.  Vidal began his adventure as a carpenter in his parents’ workshop when he was very young.  His passion for the art helped him acquire his own tools which he has used to work the wood for 24 years in his own workshop.

Juan does work for schools, institutions, and municipalities in the zone, making tables, chairs, scaffolds, desks, and other furniture.  He has three helpers in the shop, who polish and varnish and he feels committed to the work.  His motto is punctuality and he completes his customers’ work on time.  However, this work takes a toll on his health because he inhales the sawdust and he gets his medical treatments periodically.  Another problem is that he does not have enough money to buy more lumber, so he has requested a loan through MFP.

His priority is to buy more lumber, which is principal for production.  This will be his second loan and he is happy to be working with MFP.  He is grateful to the lenders for supporting him in his work and he expects this support to help him come out ahead.  He will use the 2,000 PEN to buy blocks of lumber.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Lucero Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Lucero del mañana”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran negocios como la venta de ropa, puestos de bazar, pastelería, cocinería, costuras y almacén de abarrotes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Olga presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece sentada en el primer asiento de izquierda a derecha, se dedica al comercio en general, ya que prepara y vende empanadas, además de instalarse con un puesto de artesanía en una plaza, vendiendo artesanía en macramé, guantes, pantys, ropa de polar, todo esto desde hace 5 años. Ella también comercializa sus productos desde su casa y comenta que le va muy bien.
Su mercadería la compra en una importadora y de acuerdo a cada temporada. 
Con el crédito comprará calzas, calcetines, poleras y camisetas de polar, ropa principalmente para la temporada de invierno, además agregará la venta de anillos. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, para ofrecer su mercadería.
Olga vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, sus sueños son costearles una buena educación, de ésta manera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de participar de los servicios de Fondo Esperanza, ya que además ha conocido experiencias en los negocios de otras socias y la solidaridad existente al interior del grupo del Banco comunal. Considera que las capacitaciones le han servido para potenciar los valores de la institución en el grupo. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Lucero del Mañana” and has 18 members who all work in different fields including businesses such as clothes sales, market stall, confectionery store, cooking, sewing and grocery store.  All of the bank's members live in the city of Temuco.

Olga is the community bank president.  In the photo she is sitting on a chair on the far left of the picture.  Olga works in commerce.  She makes and sells empanadas and also has a craft stall in the town square where she sells macrame handicrafts, gloves, underwear and fleece clothing.  She has been doing all this for five years.  Olga also sells products from home and says that business is doing very well.  She buys her merchandise from an importer in accordance with each season.

Olga will use her loan to buy pants, socks, fleece tops and t-shirts, mainly winter clothing.  She will also start selling rings.  Her goal is to have an established sales location where she can sell her merchandise.

Olga lives together with her husband and her two children aged 16 and 10.  Her dream is to pay for a good education for her children and thereby provide them with a better quality of life.  She is very happy and grateful to be participating in Fondo Esperanza's services.  She has learned from other members' business experiences and enjoys the level of support that exists within the group.  She believes that the training sessions have helped her to promote the institution's values within the group.

Temuco is the capital of Araucania region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and a very beautiful native flora and fauna which can be found in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) of our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy pants, socks, t-shirts and fleece tops, mainly winter season clothes.  She will also buy rings to sell

loans.name: Bibiane Judith

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  18 mois et 7 ans. Compte tenu de sa charge familiale pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie.
Elle achète des ballots de friperie, qu’elle vend dans un marché, ses revenus sont de 15.000 et 60.000 frs.
Avec le nouveau crédit  elle va acheter des ballots de pulls, jogging pour enfants, des maillots et des body…
Sa stratégie est de faire des prix abordables et satisfaire les gouts de sa clientèle.
Très entreprenante elle pense à la longue avec ses bénéfices, épargner pour ouvrir une boutique  d’habits.
texts.en: This client is 29 years old. She is married, with three children, between 18 months and 7 years of age. Faced with household expenses, she has launched a business selling used clothing in order to help her husband support the family. She buys bales of clothing and resells them at the market. Her receipts are between 15,000 and 60,000 francs. With this new loan, she will buy bales of pullovers, jogging outfits for children, tanks, bodysuits, etc. Her strategy is to offer affordable prices and to respond to the tastes of her customers. Very enterprising, in the long term she would like to save enough money to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy bales of pullovers, jogging outfits for children, tanks, bodysuits, etc

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Amelita has a retail shop that sells fish. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials to fix the fishing net for fishing.

Amelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix her fishing net

loans.name: Alan

texts.es: El señor Alan trabaja como abogado en un buffet. El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de un ambiente donde instalará su oficina para poder independizarse profesionalmente. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Fatima en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Alan ya ha tenido una experiencia de préstamo a través de Kiva  y ahora desea hacerlo por segunda vez.
texts.en:
Sr. Alan works as an attorney at a law firm. The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire a location where he can set up his office and become professionally independent. He lives at the home of his parents in the District of Villa Fatima in the city of La Paz. Alan is single and has no children.

He has had one previous loan that was funded through Kiva and now he is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to acquire a location where he can set up his law practice.

loans.name: Diosdana

texts.en:
Diosdana, age 34, makes milk bars that she offers for sale in her retail shop. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for making milk bars. 

She and her husband have one child. 

Diosdana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Diosdana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making milk bars

loans.name: Mauricio Alexander

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven ecuatoriano de 24 años de edad nacido en la ciudad de Quito, vive al sur de la ciudad en el barrio "La Villaflora", un sector pintoresco muy transitado y comercial.

Es padre soltero, tiene un hijo menor. Hace algunos años trabajó para un fotógrafo de quien aprendió sobre el negocio de filmación y fotografía de eventos y fiestas. Hace tres años puso su propio local de organización de fiestas y filmación. El negocio le ha ido muy bien y quiere invertir en otro local para de esta manera expandir su negocio y tener mejores ganancias. Piensa abrir un local en una avenida principal del sur de Quito y de esta manera tendrá mayor clientela.

Nos comenta que el se considera muy joven pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante con este negocio; trabaja todo el día e incluso en la noche y fines de semana, todo depende de la demanda de sus clientes. Sueña con poder ampliarse a otras ciudades y así convertirse en un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a young Ecuadorian 24-year-old, born in the city of Quito.  He lives south of the city in the neighborhood, "La Villaflora," a picturesque area that is well traveled and commercial.

Mauricio is a single parent and has a young son. A few years ago he worked for a photographer from whom he learned about the business of filming and photography of events and parties. Three years ago he put together his own business of party planning and filming. The business has gone very well and he wants to invest in another location to expand his business and have better returns.  Mauricio is thinking of opening a store on a main road south of Quito and thus will have more customers.

Mauricio says that he is considered very young but he is eager to go forward with this business.  He works all day and even at night and on weekends, depending on customer demand. He dreams of being able to expand to other cities and thus become an great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to open another branch of a party planning business.

loans.name: Jaimes Octavio

texts.es:
El señor  Octavio  conviviente con la señora Esperanza  más de 12 años, saben leer y escribir con 4 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven hace 10 años atrás hacia el norte de Colomi comunidad Rodeo Alto-Candelaria como también tienen cabezas de ganado vacuno engorde y lecheras.
El señor Octavio nos cuenta, el dinero que tenía como ahorro lo está invirtiendo en construcción de su vivienda para vivir más cómodos, son agricultores anualmente producen papa, papaliza, haba, oca, por este motivo el vino para sacar un crédito para reintegrar de la compra de terreno agrícola.
Por último el señor nos cuenta que se sienten muy alegres por haber conseguido una respuesta positiva y tener siempre un buen futuro por delante, ahora va tener terreno para sembrar en más superficies ya que estaba cultivando en herencia de terreno de sus padres.
texts.en: Octavio has been living with his partner Esperanza for more than 12 years. They both know how to read and write and have four dependent children who are in school. They have lived in the north of Colomi, in a community called Rodeo Alto-Candelaria for the past ten years. They own some cattle (both for meat and milk). Octavio tells us that he is investing some savings that he had in building his house so that his family can live more comfortably. They are farmers and every year they grow potatoes, papaliza and oca (native tubers) and beans. He came to request a loan in order to buy a plot of farmland. Finally, Octavio tells us that they feel very happy to have received a positive response and to know they have a good future ahead of them. He will now have more land on which to grow his crops as the land on which he has done this up to now was an inheritance from his parents.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijas, vive con una hija de 22 años en Machachi. María se describe como una persona muy tranquila y muy responsable con su trabajo.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos blancos para su comercialización. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2004, el actual crédito es para la compra de pollos blancos y para poder ampliar los galpones, que le ayudará a tener mayor número de pollos y no tendrá olestias por que esten estrechos sus animales. Una vez hecha la inversión María podrá tener una buena cantida de pollo y así poderlos criar lo cual podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, que mejorará su calidad de vida.

Dentro de unos cinco años María quiere ser una distribuidora de grandes empresas.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old.  She is a widow and has three daughters.  She lives with her 22-year-old daughter in Machachi.  Maria describes herself as a very calm person who is responsible in her work.

María works alone raising white chickens to sell.  She has been working with Fodemi since 2004.  She is requesting her current loan to buy white chickens and to expand her chicken pens.  This will help her to have a larger number of chickens and not have problems due to her animals living in cramped conditions.  Once she makes her investment, María will have a large number of chickens and be able to raise them.  This will enable her to increase her sales and income.  This will improve her quality of life.

Within five years, María would like to be a wholesaler, selling to large companies.

loans.use: to buy white chickens to increase her business

loans.name: Dusengedukore Ii Group

texts.fr:
Ernest est un commerçant âgé de 30ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des articles divers de boutique(haricots,riz,savons,huile vegetale,souliers…) depuis 19 ans. C’est un métier qu’il commence alors qu’il était cultivateur.Il a fait ses etudes jusqu’en 6e annee primaire.Il est marie et père de 3 enfants dont 1 est a l’ecole. Il prend aussi en charge 1 enfant de sa famille proche et lui assure les frais de scolarité.
 Le crédit Kiva de 480,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’articles divers de boutique(haricots,riz,savons,huile vegetale,souliers…)à revendre  et réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Dusengedukore II»
texts.en:
Ernest is 30 years old and he lives in the Gatumba neighborhood in Bukumbura town. He is a retailer and for the past 19 years, he has been selling miscellaneous items (beans, rice, soap, vegetable oil, shoes...). Ernest began this business while he was also a farmer. He went to school up to the 6th year of primary school. He is married with 3 children, one of whom is in school. In addition, he is responsible for one child belonging to close family members, and he pays for that child's school fees.

The loan of 480,000 Burundi francs will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy miscellaneous items  (beans, rice, soap, vegetable oil, shoes...) for re-sale, and to make a substantial profit. Ernest belongs to the "Dusengedukore II" group.

loans.use: to increase his capital so he can buy miscellaneous items  (beans, rice, soap, vegetable oil, shoes...) for re-sale, and make a substantial profit.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is a 28 year old man who has been engaged in cattle breeding and milk products sales for the last 3 years. He is IDP and lives with his wife and two children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. His wife helps him to look after cattle and she makes homemade yogurt. Teymur`s profit from the business is 230 AZN. He applied for 1000 AZN to purchase one milkier cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.fr:
Joseph est un commerçant âgé de 52 ans qui habite la localité de Gitongo de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il est boutiquier et vend divers articles comme haricot, riz, savons, huile, sel, sucre, etc depuis 30 ans, un métier qu’il commence alors qu’il était cultivateur. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 5 è année primaire. Il est marié à Baranyuzuriye et ont ensemble 10enfants dont 2 sont à l’école secondaire et 3 au primaire.
Le crédit Kiva de 200,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles de boutique à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Il est membre du groupe communautaire TUZAMURANE
texts.en:
Joseph is a 52-year-old businessman who lives in the town of Gitongo in the Province of Gitega in the center of the country. He is a shop owner and sells different items such as beans, rice, soap, oil, salt, sugar, etc. For the past 30 years, he has been in the trade which began when he was a farmer. He was in school until the 5th year of elementary school. He is married to Baranyuzuriye and they have 10 children together with 2 in middle school and 3 in elementary school.

The Kiva loan of 200,000 burundi francs that he receives will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy a large quantity of shop items to resell in order to realize large profits and to increase his savings.

He is a member of the TUZAMURANE community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital in order to buy a large quantity of shop items to resell in order to realize large profits and to increase his savings.

loans.name: Villarosa

texts.en:
Villarosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
 
She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for twelve years. She earns more income from buying and selling oysters.

Villarosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a simple farmer with a simple dream in life--to have a happy family. But his simple dream was not achieved. Though it was not attained, because his wife left him, he still has the courage to continue life. He wants to live with his two children in comfort, so he is doing his entire best to provide them a good life.

He has been planting rice crops in his rice fields for 15 years and earned 10,000 pesos last crop. He wants to increase his rice production to meet his children’s daily needs. He is now asking for a loan amount of 15,000 pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland. Hopefully his fields can yield better crops to save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland

loans.name: Roxana Edith

texts.es:
Roxana Edith  en una mujer emprendedora , que no se deja vencer ante nada, vive en Ica, ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta de una buena lectura o ver en la televisión sus programas favoritos;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le agrada  a Roxana Edith  es la “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”. Roxana  es profesora pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  Ciencias de la comunicación; es Casada, su esposo es conductor de mototaxi y juntos tienen 3 hijos que  comprenden las edades de  4, 10 y 16 años, el menor de ellos se encuentra en nivel inicial, el segundo de sus hijos se encuentra en quinto de primaria y el mayor se encuentra en quinto de secundaria.

Roxana se dedica a la Venta de ropa y ofrece sus productos a las amas de casa de su barrio y a sus compañeras de la escuela donde tambien trabaja, se dedica a este negocio aproximadamente  2 horas diarias, quien incentivo a Roxana para que emprendiera en este negocio fue su esposo ya que vio en ella habilidad para la este tipo de negocio.
 
En un día atiende un promedio de 2 clientes y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 75 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 100 soles lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, su negocio tiene éxito ya que ella brinda un trato amable y su clientes la recomienda por el buen servicio que ofrece. Actualmente está muy agradecida con  los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo podrá  comprar más ropa para su negocio y tener más variedad de prendas.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener más variedad de prendas que ofrecer y con ello aumentaría sus ventas y de esta manera tendría mas ingresos y así poder en algunos meses tener un automóvil pero el sueño más grande que Roxana tiene y que anhela mucho es: “ Darle una buena educación  a sus hijos para que sean profesionales de éxito y tener una boutique para la venta de ropa y una empresa de transporte."
texts.en:
Roxana Edith is an enterprising woman who does not give up when faced with a problem. She lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in the sector of food exports, i.e. in farms, but also in the opening of new shopping centers which offer many jobs to residents of Ica. In her spare time Roxana enjoys a good book or watches her favorite TV programs. It is well known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world. One of Roxana's favorite dishes is "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca", a typical dish of southern Peru, made from pork, groundnuts, potatoes, noodles and chicken. Roxana is a teacher, but communication science is what she would have liked to study. She is married and her husband drives a motor taxi. They have three children, aged 4, 10 and 16. Their youngest child goes to kindergarten, their second one is in fifth grade of elementary school and the eldest in fifth grade of secondary school.

Roxana sells clothes to housewives in her neighborhood and to her colleagues at the school where she works. She spends approximately two hours a day with this activity. Roxana got the incentive to launch this business from her husband who had noticed her skill with this kind of activity.

On an average day she serves two customers, which gives her an average income of 75 new soles per day. On a good day she can earn 100 new soles, which helps her to pay for additional household expenditures. Her business is successful because she is friendly with her customers who recommend her for her good service. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan enables her to buy additional clothes for her business and have a greater product range on offer. 

This improvement will help Roxana to have more variety of clothes to offer and thus more sales and more income. In a few months she could have a car. However, her biggest dreams are to provide her children with a good education, so that they may become successful professionals, as well as to own a boutique for her clothing business and a transportation company.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes).

loans.name: Liliana Cris

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer de 23 años que tiene un pequeño de 4 años y está en la espera de un bebé, en este momento ella tiene 7 meses de embarazo, Liliana y su familia viven en la ciudad de Imperial, una ciudad muy acogedora que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Lima (capital del Perú), Imperial es una ciudad muy tranquila, en la cual se puede ver la influencia de la cultura afroperuana, ciudad dedicada a la agricultura y a la preparación del producto bandera como es el Pisco.

Ella y su esposo trabajan para poder brindarle lo bueno a su pequeña familia, es por esto que su esposo actualmente está trabajando como Panadero, Liliana también estaba trabajando, pero debido al embarazo por el momento no puede trabajar como ayudante en una bodega, lugar en donde le dan solo una propina por la ayuda que brinda. Para salir adelante e incrementar los ingresos que tenía, ella y su esposo pudieron comprar un vehículo, el mismo que alquilan desde hace ya dos años, Liliana también se ha dedicado a velar mucho el cuidado del carro y que le genere los ingresos necesarios.

En la actualidad Liliana ha logrado juntar un poco de cantidad de dinero, y lo que ella desea es que le presten la cantidad restante para reparar el motor de su auto, debido a que este se encuentra muy dañado; gracias a esta ayuda ella podrá terminar tranquila la etapa de su embarazo y no preocuparse ella ni su esposo por el problema que tienen con el auto.
texts.en: Liliana is 23 years old, has a 4-year-old child and is expecting another baby. At this time she is seven months pregnant. Liliana and her family live in Imperial, a cozy city south of Lima (the capital). Imperial is a very calm city where one can see the Afroperuvian influence. The people make a living in agriculture and producing the flagship product of Pisco (a liquor). Liliana and her husband both work to provide for their growing family, and it's for this reason her husband is currently making a living as a baker. Liliana also was working, but because of her pregnancy she can't continue as a grocer's assistant, where she only earned tips for her services. To make headway and to increase the income she was making, she and her husband were able to purchase a car, which they have rented out as a taxi for the past two years. She also has dedicated a lot of time to the car's care so that it generates the necessary revenue. Currently, Liliana has been able to scrape together a little bit of money, and she hopes you lend them the remaining sum to repair the car's engine, which is very damaged. Thanks to this help she will be able to finish her pregnancy peacefully and she and her husband won't have to worry about the car.

loans.use: to fix her car's engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would liketo buy Beadwork materials in large quantities

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Manuel A. and my primary job in the sale and repairing of bicycles. I have a small business located in the center of my community called "Repair Store:Super Bike." My store creates enough income to cover my family expenses and to other school costs of my children, with this business I have been able to advance my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola Mi nombre es Manuel A., mi actividad principal es la venta y reparación de bicicletas, cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad llamado taller de repuestos Super Bike, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, y demas gastos de estudio de mis hijos, ya que con este negocio he sacado adelante a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase replacement cables, seats,handles,tires,gears, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Njeri would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar is married and has two children – a boy and a girl. Her husband is distant from them looking for money in other countries, in Russia for example, where he decided to open his own business – he started to trade food products. In the beginning, his business was not big and could be placed on a small counter. Munavvar in that time was looking after her small son. Gradually the son became older and she started to help her husband to trade. She came to Microinvest 4 years ago, when they started from a small amount of $60. This money they spent as current capital. The business grew and it was time to think about their expansion of trade. The spouses decided to rent a small store. Today her business is a store with an assortment of goods, from food products to industrial goods. All their family is involved in the business and the spouses can live to trade with their children. Now they want to take a loan out to purchase a freezer and to renew their current capital. They need $120 - 200 for a freezer and $1000 to purchase other goods. The term of loan is for 14 months.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and to renew current capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his tomatoes stock.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Mrs. Joyce Bakare is a 36 years old woman, married with 3 children. She sells provisions and snacks to the people of her community in a semi-urban area of Edo State. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to enable her to buy more provisions. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more provision & snacks

loans.name: Munishon

texts.en: Munishon began working in her town's market years ago, when she was helping her daughter run a local business.  After her daughter's marriage, Munishon went into business on her own, selling goods she purchased from wholesalers. Munishon has made good use of loans from MicroInvest to expand her business, which has grown large enough for her to hire her younger son as an employee. She has come to us for a new loan which will allow her to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a single mom of three small children, she cares for them without any support. This is why she works on a daily basis as a laborer. However, the money she makes with this career is not enough to get through with the daily expenses that she has. For this reason she began selling jewelry by catalog to her friends and neighbors during her free time.

However, she currently has some requests that she is not able to fulfill because she doesn't have the capital. This is why Maria is requesting a loan of $700 and hopes to pay it back within 6 months. Her clients will be requesting and purchasing these products and this was she will be able to re-pay. With your help Maria will be able to move ahead in her life and help her three kids.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.>/b>

María de Lourdes es madre soltera de tres pequeños, de quienes se hace cargo totalmente. Es por eso que trabaja diariamente como obrera, sin embargo el dinero que gana con esta profesión no le deja suficiente dinero como para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos quienes al crecer van necesitando más cosas. Es por eso que comenzó a vender joyería por catálogo a sus compañeros y a sus vecinos. En sus tiempos libres.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de capital, es por eso que María de Lourdes está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses.
