Mrs. Sem is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest she feeds her family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are studying in a local public school. The youngest one is a 2-year-old.

She is a duck and chicken breeder, while her husband, Mr. Saren, is a teacher in a local school and he also owns a mill. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. To make this happen, Mrs. Sem is seeking a loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rose has a tailoring business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Rose hopes to own a salon. Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es una mujer trabajadora de 40 años de edad, ella está casada y vive junto a su esposo en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque.

Lucinda tiene una tienda en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, en ella vende abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite), golosinas y bebidas (agua, gaseosas). Es decir tiene una tienda surtida que cuenta con clientes fijos debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece.

Lucinda desea obtener más ganancias para poder ahorrar y así mejorar su calidad de vida es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para seguir surtiendo su negocio.

Lucinda tiene muchas metas que cumplir y este crédito le sería de gran utilidad. Ella es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad y ha cancelado correctamente sus préstamos anteriores.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a hardworking woman of 40 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband in the rural district of Túcume in Lambayeque.

Lucinda has run a grocery store from her home for the last 10 years, selling groceries such as sugar, rice and oil, sweets, water and soft drinks. Her store is stocked to cater for her regular customers who come to her for the variety of products on offer. 

Lucinda would like to increase her income so she can save more and improve her quality of life, which is why she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. She will use this money to purchase more products to keep her store well stocked. 

Lucinda has many goals she would like to accomplish so this loan will be very useful for her. She is a long standing client with Edpyme Alternativa and she has paid for her previous loans in full.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, sweets and drinks to keep her store well stocked.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silveria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Silveria,  indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer, pero en otro centro focal; y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ferretería que viene trabajando hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de variedad de herramientas y materiales de fierro) materiales que comprará por mayor en las tiendas y venderá en su puesto de la Extranca de Rio Seco. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo, ahorro y capacitación.
texts.en:
The “CONCENTIDAS” communal bank is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, headed by Silveria. The businesses carried out by the members are varied, including trade, production and services. 

Silveria indicates that she has worked with Pro Mujer for three years, but in another regional center. She joined the institution on the invitation of a promoter. Currently, she has a hardware business which she has been operating for three years. She learned the business from her husband. 

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her capital (buying a variety of tools and metal items). She will buy the items wholesale from stores and will sell them at her sales point in Extranca de Rio Seco. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is a single mother with three children.   

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes everything, the savings and the training.

loans.use: to buy tools for her hardware store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 57 years old and married to Sarah.  He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in Ndunyu Njeru market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour as he will employ casual workers to help him in planting.

In future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Inessa

texts.en: Inessa is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income, and it is very hard for the family to cover the daily expenses for the family of four. She lives with her mother, brother, and sister. Inessa would like to increase the number of livestock she keeps in order to increase her income in the future. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase cows. Additional cows will help Inessa earn additional income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es natural de Huancas, toda su vida ha vivido en su tierra natal y hoy en día a sus 50 años  vive al lado de su esposo y su  hijo. Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, sus cultivos principales son trigo, papa, cebada, arveja y maíz; así como también cría vacas y toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. Cuando llega la temporada de cosecha, sus compradores mayoristas son quienes la buscan en su misma chacra para comprar todo lo que ha producido. Así se genera las ganancias y se ahorra el gasto de transporte hacia el mercado central de su ciudad. Durante este tiempo, ella y su esposo han visto que  es una buena opción el trabajo que realizan, pues las dificultades fueron superadas a lo largo de los años, logrando cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y por ello seguirá trabajando con mayor ahínco para mejorar su calidad de vida. Lleva varios años trabajando de manera grupal con MFP y siempre ha demostrado su responsabilidad frente a los créditos e impulsa esta misma actitud con sus demás compañeros de su grupo comunal, porque tiene como experiencia el logro de una buena inversión de los créditos. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en el alquiler de terrenos de cultivo en zona de riego donde sembrará verduras.
texts.en: Carmen is originally from Huanca. She has lived in her birthplace her entire life and today, at 50 years of age, she lives with her husband and her son. She has worked in agriculture and cattle farming since she was 20 years old. Her primary cultivations are of wheat, potatoes, barley, peas, and corn. She also raises cows and bulls to sell them at the livestock fairs. At the time of the harvest her wholesale buyers come to her fields to purchase everything that was produced. This is how she generates an income for herself and she is able to save on the transportation costs associated with the trip to the central market of the city. She and her husband have realized that their business is a good field of work especially because the difficulties they have encountered throughout the years have been overcome and because they have managed to improve the quality of their life. She has been working with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) for many years and she has always demonstrated responsibility with her loans and she inspires the same attitude among the other members of the group. She has earned the experience of a successful loan investment. This time she will invest her loan in the renting farm land in an irrigation region where she will plant vegetables.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: En el hogar las mujeres parecieran tener una dotación especial D. fortaleza que las hace invencibles.  Pueden dedicar cualquier cantidad D. horas a trabajar incansablemente hasta alcanzar sus objetivos. Así es la señora Carmen Rosa ella tiene 52  años y está casada hace 30 años. Ella pertenece al grupo  María  Elena Moyano y está conformada por  nueve integrantes, tiene con el grupo 3 años. Es mamá D. cuatro hijos y su familia fue la mayor motivación para trabajar desD. la casa. La  satisfacción que le ha dejado el ser negociante es ver que sus hijos crecieron sanos y que ha logrado sacarlos adelante, y también gracias a la ayuda D. su esposo que día a día ayuda con la venta D. la comida y mazamorras. La señora Carmen aseguró que ahora va a iniciar su segunda etapa, lo que significa que podrá invertir sin ningún problema, con la implementación D. vitrinas en el negocio.
texts.en: In their homes the women would appear to have a special gift of strength that makes them invincible.  They can dedicate any amount of time to tirelessly work until they meet their objectives.  This is how Mrs Carmen Rosa is.  She is 52 years old and has been married for 30 years.  She belongs to the group María  Elena Moyano which is maD. up of nine members.  She has been in the group for 3 years.  She is mother to four children and her family was the main reason for her deciding to work from home.  The satisfaction that she has gotten from being a business person was from seeing her children grow well, getting them ahead.  Also she is thankful to her husband who helps her daily with the sale of the food and maize mush.  Mrs Carmen is now going to start her second phase with the implementation of display windows in the business, which means that she will be able to invest without a problem.

loans.use: to purchase display windows and supplies.

loans.name: Betty Del Socorro

texts.es: Betty Del Socorro tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya que necesitaba ayudar para los gastos del hogar. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado tener sus propios clientes y proporcionarle lo que ellos le solicitan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior, sabanas, cortinas entre otros. Sus aspiraciones son de ampliar su local cada día mas
texts.en: Betty Del Socorro, 31, sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over 10 years since she needed to help pay household expenses. With the passage of time she’s managed to attain her own customers and provide them with what they need.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear, sheets and curtains, among others.  Her hope is to expand the business more every day.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear, sheets and curtains, among others.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Зафар занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки масла, колбасных изделий, молочных продуктов и хозяйственных товаров. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Zafar is involved in retail sales.  He leases a retail outlet at a market, where he sells food products.  He has been involved in this type of business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, sausage, dairy products and household goods.  He wants to increase the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase butter, sausage, dairy products and household goods

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 27 años; vive en concubinato con Erminio. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Braham y Verenise; a los que cuidan y alimentan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia en la siembra de alverja, habas, papa y maíz; los cuales se sitúan en el caserío de San Antonio, donde todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas donde los sembríos ya se encuentran maduros, púes ve concretado su esfuerzo en la venta de sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos; por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza en el banquito comunal, pues le ayudan con el capital de trabajo. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de alverja y está segura que logrará buenos resultados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecha por el cargo de tesorera que ejerce. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en los pagos de su cuota. Luzmila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 27, lives with her partner Erminio. They have 2 sons: Braham and  Verenise, whom they care for and feed in their own home, located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo.  Her economic activity is agriculture and she has 8 years of experience in the cultivation of peas, beans, potatoes and corn.  The crops are located in the village of San Antonio, where every morning Luzmila rises very contentedly to take care of the crops, with the help of her husband and laborers that help at harvest time. 

What Luzmila likes best about her work are the seasons where crops are already mature.  Her efforts are complete in selling their crops in the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. Her main difficulty is the cost for the education of their children, so she feels happy with the work done in the communal bank because they help with working capital. Now Luzmila is preparing for the harvest of peas and is sure to achieve good results. 

Luzmila belongs to the Communal Bank "Señor de Muruhuay," and this is her fourth credit with MFP.  She is satisfied with her role of treasurer, it is the reason why she promises to be punctual in paying her dues. Upon receiving your support, Luzmila will invest the requested loan to buy 3 bags of pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizer for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of pea seed and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et père de 5 enfants. Il résidant avec son épouse et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est finalement initié à cette activité de tailleur couturier il y’a 24 ans. Son atelier de couture se trouve à Wayerema Zone où il dispose déjà 5 machines dont 2 machines de broderie et 3 machines simples. Monsieur Yacouba qui est couturier et brodeur est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son un premier prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter, 1 machine de broderie au Burkina. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Yacouba is 48, married and the father of five children. He lives with his spouse and his children in a big traditional extended family in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried several businesses without success, Monsieur Yacouba finally began working as a tailor 24 years ago. His tailoring workshop is located in Wayerema Zone and he already has five sewing machines: two for embroidery and three normal ones. 

Monsieur Yacouba who is both a tailor and an embroiderer is much in demand with his clientele for the excellent quality of his services. Wishing to satisfy that ever-growing clientele's needs, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first loan which will permit him to buy an embroidering machine in  Burkina (Faso). 

He expects to make a monthly profit of 125,000 F CFA with this loan, which will essentially be used to contribute to covering family expenses, paying the interest on his loan, and investing the rest back into his business.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga, se dedica  ala actividad D. venta D. ropa, es una cliente nueva, que vino a la institución por invitación D. un cliente bueno, que trabaja actualmente en nuestra agencia, en el momento D. la evaluación del crédito la Sra. demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, la Sra. Olga ni vive en la zona Tacagua bajo La Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos hijos, el esposo por razones D. trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, solicito  este crédito para surtir su mercadería en ropa D. temporada y D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo , su puesto esta ubicado en una D. las calles mas concurridas D. la ciudad D. La Paz, ella tiene su patente al día, venD. desD. horas  8:00 a 21:00, con el tiempo piensa mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa para el beneficio D. su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga has a business selling clothes. She is new to Emprender, having been invited by another good client who currently works with the organization. At the time of her credit evaluation, Sra. Olga demonstrated an excellent, cordial, and friendly attituD.. She lives in the District of Tacagua Bajo in La Paz, Bolivia, with her two children. Due to his work, her husband lives in the city of Santa Cruz.

Olga is requesting this loan so that she can restock her inventory with seasonal clothing, thereby increasing her operating capital. Her vending post is located along one of the busiest streets in the city of La Paz. Olga’s permit is up-to-date and she sells between the hours of 8am and 9pm. Over time, she plans to improve the infrastructure of her house so that her family will benefit.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El señor  Silverio conviviente más de 8 años con la señora Ninfa , ambos con  una instrucción de nivel primaria, tienen 3 hijos dependientes, la familia radica en la comunidad de Duraznos Pampa hacia el norte de Colomi hace 8 años atrás.
El señor Silverio y su esposa son agricultores anualmente venden papa y locoto en la feria semanal de Colomi, como también cuentan con un vehículo que lo utilizan para el traslado a su fuente laboral, motivo ellos quieren mejorar la producción agrícola y necesitan un crédito, se tuvo la iniciativa de pasar por la zona para otorgarle el préstamo que necesitaban el sr. Silverio y la sra. Ninfa.
texts.en:
Silverio has lived for more than 8 years with his partner, Ninfa, and they have 3 children together. Both Silverio and Ninfa have a grade school education. They have lived in the Duraznos Pampa community, north of Colomi, for 8 years. 

Silverio and his wife are farmers. They sell potatoes and peppers at the weekly market in Colomi. Since they have a vehicle that they can use to transport their merchandise, they would like to increase their agricultural production. That is why they are requesting a loan to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Modesta Del Socorro

texts.es: Modesta Del Socorro tiene su trabajo que es enfermera en un hospital. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento y piedrín. Ella no había podido realizar estas mejoras a su vivienda porque tenía que sufragar los gastos del hogar. Sueña con mejorar cada día y poder obtener el financiamiento que será utilizado para las mejoras necesarias.
texts.en: Modesta del Socorro has a job as a nurse at a hospital.  She is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, cement, and gravel.  Modesta is not able to make improvements to her home because she has to cover the household expenses.  She dreams of getting better each day and having this loan will help her make the necessary improvements.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand, cement, and gravel for making home improvements.

loans.name: Marjjie

texts.es:
Marjjie, de 48 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Convive con su pareja con quien no tiene hijos, pero ella tiene cuatro hijos con su anterior esposo. Ahora vive a lado de su conviviente en una casa propia, juntos trabajan para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Marjjie, tiene como trabajo el de la venta de bebidas en eventos de la ciudad, además ella vende comida y tiene un vehiculo con el que su pareja hace transporte de carga. Cada fin de semana, hay eventos, así que lleva sus materiales para armar ahí su puesto en donde se encarga de saciar la sed de los asistentes y también el hambre. Lleva realizando este trabajo por cinco años, lo hace sola, pero tiene la ayuda de su pareja para poder transportar sus cosas, además su pareja la ayuda en los gastos del hogar realizando el transporte de pasajeros en el vehiculo de ambos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, le da tiempo disponible para realizar diversas actividades en su hogar, le va muy bien hasta ahora ya que se va a muchos eventos en donde vende mucho y le alcanza con eso para pagar sus cuotas, además tiene un ingreso adicional con el alquiler de su auto, y espera mantenerse así y mas adelante mejorar su camión de transporte. Este será el crédito 12 con la institución MFP, le esta yendo bien trabajando juntos es por eso que lleva bastante tiempo en su grupo el cual son personas muy responsables y siempre son cumplidos, espera seguir trabajando juntos por más tiempo y poder así crecer con su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas para arreglar su vehículo y  además para arreglar su auto que lo da en condición de alquiler a un chofer.
texts.en: Marjjie, 48, is a friendly, hardworking woman. She and her partner have no children, but she has four children from her previous marriage. She now lives with her partner in a home of their own, and together they're working to have a better life. Marjjie sells refreshments at town events. She and her partner have a truck that they use to transport cargo. There are events every weekend, so she takes her supplies to set up her stand, where she ministers to the thirst and hunger of the attendees. She has been doing this work for five years on her own, but her partner helps her with transporting her things and also contributes to the family income by using the truck to tranport passengers. What she likes best about her work is that it gives her time to do a lot at home. Her business is going well, as she attends a lot of events and has good sales, enough to pay her bills. She also gets some income from renting out her car, and hopes to continue supporting family and in the future be able to improve their transport truck. This will be her twelfth credit with MFP. She and the other members of her village bank work well together, since they are all very responsible, conscientious people, and she hopes to keep working with them for some time and be able to expand her business. She will use the requested loan to repair her truck, as well as repairing her car, which she rents to another driver.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement used his previous loan well, as he bought additional stock of spare parts. His  business has actually improved and his monthly income is KES 13,000.

He is applying for a second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Clement will use the loan to buy more spare auto parts for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Clement will expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to buy a commercial plot that will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add a stock of spare parts to his business inventory.

loans.name: Twishingane Group

texts.fr:
Gaudence est une commerçante âgée de 44 ans qui habite la localité de Nyabitanga de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend la farine de manioc depuis 14 ans,un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusq’en 6 è année primaire. Elle est mariée à Bernard et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 6 sont à l’ecole.
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de farine de manioc à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses economies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TWISHINGANE
texts.en: Gaudence is a 44-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Nyabitanga, in the Gitega province of central Burundi.  She has been selling cassava flour for 14 years.  She started this professional activity when she was a farmer.  She is educated through the sixth year of primary school.  She is married to Bernard, and they have 7 children together, 6 of whom attend school.  The credit requested from Kiva, (50,000 Burundian Francs), helps her increase her capital in order to buy large quantities of cassava flour that will be resold at a profit in order to increase cash-flow.  She is a member of the Twishingane community group.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to buy large quantities of cassava flour to be resold at a profit, in order to increase cash-flow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
A very responsible and loving mother, Marilyn is 47 years old with two grown children. She is married to Romeo. Her spouse works as a farmer in the community. Marilyn is busy managing her store, where she sells different kinds of products. Marilyn is well known in the community and is a very responsible person.

Marilyn is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase a variety of products that she can display in her small store like canned goods, snack foods, and drinks so that her income increases and she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, spices, snack foods, and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio is 57 years of age and is married.  He has four grown children. He is a farmer who plans to increase his rice production so that he can generate greater profits every crop season. He has been spending his income on his family's daily needs, such as food allowances and electricity bills.

He is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for use in his business. He hopes to yield better crops through his purchased inputs for the development of their living situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his business

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business in their town. Tarcela also manages a small sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods, eggs, shampoo and soap. She works hard to improve their income.

She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Tarcela hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Leyla Evangelina

texts.es: Leyla Evangelina su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es al destace de cerdo y a la elaboración de nacatamales en cual ya tiene año de experiencia en el negocio, ella ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales en el cual buscan su producto. Leyla ya ha tenido crédito con  Fundación León 2000, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y emprendedora su mayores sueños es crecer en el negoción.  Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir nuevamente en el negocio en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Leyla Evangelina’s economic activity is butchering pigs and making nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales]; she has years’ experience in this business.  She has regular and walk-in customers who seek her product.  Leyla has had a prior loan with Fundación León 2000 and demonstrated being a very responsible, enterprising person.  Her greatest dream is to grow in business.  She is currently asking for a loan to once again invest in the business by buying pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Maria es miembro del grupo, y cuenta con una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos y personas de barrios aledaños. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio que le puso al negocio, ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo de a poco.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, hortalizas, bebidas, panes, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group San Ramon was born through the management and support of another group in the same town. The group is in the city of San Lorenzo and the main objective of the members is growth - both personal and financial. 

Maria is a member of the group and she has a well-stocked store where her neighbors and people from nearby neighborhoods get their supplies. She tells us that she started with a small business, but thanks to her hard work and sacrifice she was able to get ahead and to grow her business little by little.

She asks for a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, drinks, bread, dairy products and other things she needs to stock her business and keep growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, bread, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Jehovah's Way Group

texts.en:
John is a member of Jehovah's Way group. He is 68 this year and happily married with 5 children. All of his children are working now, except his youngest who is presently attending a teacher's training college. His other 4 children are also farmers. John lives with his wife in Abrakrampa in the Central Region of Ghana. 

John has been a farmer for 28 years. His farm is at two different locations. The first site is where he has  orange, cocoa and oil palm plantation and the second  farm, he grows cassava, plantain and cocoyam. He earns all his living from his farming activities.

John and all his group members belong to local registered Citrus Farmers Association that coordinates the marketing and capacity building of their members.

John finds it difficult to obtain micro loan locally to finance the cost of maintaining his farms. He used to maintain the farms alone during his prime age, however as he ages his physical strength cannot cope with the maintenance demands.  John is demanding for a micro loan of GHC 1,000 to hire labourers for weeding  and pruning the farm,  to buy fertiliser to improve crop yield and pay for insect traps to protect the crops from  pets. Without the financial support, John cannot have a better harvest to earn enough income to support his family. The loan will help John to increase his yield significantly, and his profits will far exceed the loan he needs to invest in his farms now. 

John thanks all his micro-lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs such as fertiliser and insect traps, and pay wages for labourers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Yawa Enyonam

texts.en:
Mme. Yawa Enyonam T., 41 years old, is a mother of 04 children. Abandoned by her husband, her current income does not cover her needs and that of her children who are all at her charge. Very enterprising and experienced in nutrition, she has undertook soy processing activities which provide for her a substantial income allowing her partly cover her household expenses. This project consists in strengthening her soy beans by-product processing and marketing activities, namely: soy milk, soy yogurt soy cakes and doughnuts, soy flour for porridge or for the soup made with the Moringa leaves very rich in proteins and vitamins and well appreciated by patients living with HIV/AIDS to strengthen their nutritional immunity. The production is surrounded with an exceptional hygiene and quality of the product is well appreciated by the consumers. The proof is in the increasing demand registered that the currently production does not succeed to cover. The market is growing and is far from saturated. The credit requested will serve to acquire the small material and production equipment (vegetable mill, Cooker, Stove…). It will also give her the working capital necessary to have a safety stock in order to assure the production of best quality all over the year.

Français Agée de 41 ans Mme T. Yawa Enyonam est mère de 04 enfants. Abandonnée par son mari, ses revenus actuels n’arrivent pas à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Très entreprenante et expérimentée en nutrition, elle a entrepris cette activité de transformation de soja qui lui procure un revenu substantiel lui permettant d’assurer en partie les charges de son ménage. Le projet consiste à renforcer ses activités de transformation et de commercialisation des produits dérivés du soja, notamment : le lait de soja - le yaourt de soja - le gâteau et beignet de soja - la farine de soja pour la bouillie ou pour la sauce associée avec les feuilles du Moringa très riche en protéines et en vitamines et bien apprécié par les personnes vinant avec le VIH/SIDA pour renforcer leur immunité nutritionnelle. Le crédit de $ 800 sollicité va servir à acquérir le petit matériel et outillage de production (Moulinette, cuisinière, fourneau, etc.), à disposer d’un fonds de roulement nécessaire pour avoir un stock de sécurité afin de garantir la production de meilleure qualité sur toute l’année.

loans.use: Soya beans by-products processing and marketing (Agribusiness)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire fish filet stock, refregration equipment and rent a store for his first time fishmonger business

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.en:
Gertrudis H. and her husband Juan Fulgencio live with their four children in San Pedro de Macorís. Gertrudis used her first loan of $300 to start her own clothing store, and she used her profits to send her sons to private school. Gertrudis has paid off her first loan and has developed a business plan to expand her inventory to include cosmetics. This new loan will give her the capital to purchase cosmetics and personal care products.

A high-quality education is something she and her husband value greatly, and they are focused on giving their children the opportunity to attend schools that offer much more than the public schools do. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can send her oldest son to college soon, as well as her younger children once they finish secondary school.

loans.use: Start a business selling cosmetics and personal care products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Ever since 10 years ago, Victoria started her own business. She offers her Hair Stylist services in order to provide for her expenses and that of her parents who are in their old age. She is young and entrepreneurial, with a great drive to move on ahead.

Fortunately, the good service she offers has helped her to maintain the business for such a long time. As she has taken courses to keep up to date, she has incorporated acrylic nails into her services. The demand for this service has increased quickly which has allowed her go grow as an entrepreneur.

In order to offer a quality service to her clientèle, Victoria is requesting a loan for $250 with which she will purchase the supplies required for her job. She is offering to pay back this quantity in 3 months. Today is the time to help. Victoria thanks the opportunity to grow and the support you provide her with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Desde hace 10 años Victoria inició su propio negocio donde ofrece sus servicios de estilista para poder cubrir sus gastos y los de sus padres que son de edad avanzada, ella es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación. Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a mantenerse durante tanto tiempo y al hacer cursos de actualización ahora también ha incorporado la aplicación de uñas de acrílico, la demanda por este servicio se ha incrementado rápidamente y esto le ha permitido crecer como microempresaria.

Para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, Victoria solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere en la elaboración de su trabajo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar, Victoria agradece mucho la oportunidad de superarse y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchasing Supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is originally from Chiapas, in the South of Mexico, but in searching for better opportunities for her family, she and her husband decided to relocate to Apodaca in Nuevo León. In order to improve the quality of life of her three sons, Araceli decided to start her own business in the sale of cosmetics and footwear by catalog after she arrived in the region. Fortunately, thanks to her gusto for sales and a personal character which allows her to easily relate to people, Araceli soon succeeded in increasing her number of clients and expanding her business.

Araceli knows that this is a good time for sales, so in order to able to cover the demands of her clients and offer them good service she is asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars, which she is committed to repay in 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to acquire products for the new season and continue expanding. You can play an important part in the development of this business. Araceli and her family thank you greatly for your confidence and aid.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Araceli es originaria de Chiapas, en el Sur de México, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, ella y su esposo decidieron mudarse a la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus tres hijos Araceli decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y calzado por catálogo desde que llegaron a esta localidad. Afortunadamente gracias a su gusto por las ventas ya su carácter que le facilita el relacionarse con los demás Araceli pronto logró incrementar su numero ce clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Araceli sabe que se aproxima una buena temporal de ventas y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses, con lo que podrá adquirir productos de la nueva temporada y continuar creciendo. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Araceli y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. sells yam. She lives in Benin City and goes to the villages to buy yams from farms and sells them to retailers in the open market. She is 56 years old, married with 8 children. She is soliciting the loan amount of  $800 to buy more yams for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 1985.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail, 37, owns a hardware shop inside the timber market in Tema. The past two months business has been a little bit slower, but it is picking up right now. She is hoping for a loan, as she does not have enough capital at the moment to purchase the stock her customers are demanding. With the loan, she will purchase laced cloth, jeans, watches, necklaces, and hardware. 

Abigail plans to save her profits to expand the store. She hopes by next year she can expand her stock with cement and roofing sheets. Abigail also takes care of her 10-year-old son. They are currently living in mission housing, provided by the church. If her business goes well, she will build a house for her family.

Abigail is a member of the lending group, Zion. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her stock by purchasing laced cloth, jeans, watches, necklaces and hardware.

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha, age 34, is married with 2 children (ages 12 and 14). She owns a business of selling drink items such as water and soda. She began this business in 2006 and now makes about $476 monthly from this business. She hopes for a loan to buy more stock of drink items.

Matha belongs to the group Nyota Njema, which totals 36 members. Together, they keep eachother accountable and ensure eachother in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy stock of drink items

loans.name: Sabaheta

texts.en:
Sabaheta was born in 1969 and she is a housewife. She is married and has 2 children who are 18 and 17 years old. Her husband works in a coal mine earning 200 KM, but sometimes he works a full season and then he can earn 2000 KM. When her husband does not work they live from their savings.

Sabaheta works at the marketplace and sells different goods. She wants to expand the range of goods that she is selling in order to earn more money and thus improve living standard for her family.This is her first loan, in the amount of 1200 KM.

loans.use: Expand range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mirna is a small merchant. She sells a variety of clothing, lingerie and cosmetics in the streets. She is a 53 year old single mother with 2 children, both now grown. She lives in the housing development Laureles Norte, a semi-rural, poor neighborhood where basic services such as water and, often, electricity scarcely exist. This mother launched her business more than 20 years ago, which allowed her to moved her children and family ahead, despite the difficult economic situation in which she found herself.

At the moment Mirna lives with her daughter who helps her with the household errands and in the business: The have both worked at marketing the products and they have a good number of steady clients. Mirna sells on credit and currently she is expanding her offer to include shoes for men and women. With the support that she receives from her daughter this mother has been constructing her home. Her wish is to set up a store in her home so that she wiil no longer have to walk through the streets offering her products; she is afraid she may be robbed. At the moment she needs a loan to buy children's clothing and also women's lingerie, one of the products that sells most rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Mirna es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica a vender ropa variada, ropa interior y cosméticos de manera ambulante, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, ambos son mayores de edad, habita en el asentamiento “Laureles Norte”, este es un barrio semi-rural, pobre, existe escasez de algunos servicios básicos como el agua y muchas veces luz. Esta madre emprendió su negocio hace más de 20 años, el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos, pese a la difícil situación económica en la que se encontraba.

En estos momentos vive con su hija la cual le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y le apoya en el negocio, ambas se han dedicado a comercializar los productos, cuentan con un buen número de clientes fijos, vende al crédito y actualmente se esta expandiendo ya que esta ofreciendo zapatos para dama y caballeros. Con la remesa que recibe de su hijo esta madre ha ido levantando su vivienda. El deseo de la señora es el de montar una tienda en su vivienda para ya no andar en la calle ofreciendo sus productos, ya que teme que le roben. En estos momentos necesita un préstamo para comprar ropa para niños y ropa interior para dama, ya que es una de las cosas que más rápido se venden.

loans.use: Purchase women's lingerie and children's clothing

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 42 years old. He is dedicated to the transportation of passengers. Mario has 3 children ages 4 years, 10 years, and 12 years respectively. His wife works in the home, although she has taken up a business selling hamburgers.

Mario is a very responsible person when it comes to his family and he thinks in the future to expand his income by dedicating himself to heavy transportation (fleets). Mario has been dedicated to auto transportation for a enough time (100 months) always showing responsibility and taking care in his activity.

There is a lot of competition in the area, nevertheless he has a lot of experience which permits him to guarantee his income and, even more, to provide his family with a stable source of income.

With the loan obtained, he will proceed to repay the legal expenses from the acquisition of a plot of land. Thus also will the client proceed to repay his balance with Agrocapital. This is the fourth loan for Mario. The previous loans where repaid in a normal manner, although his average payment time was 1 day behind schedule, but he can qualify as a good client to our institution.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario de 42 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Mario tiene 3 hijos de 4 años, 10 años y 12 años respectivamente, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa, sin embargo ella retomará su negocio de venta de hamburguesas.

Mario es una persona muy responsable con su familia y piensa en el futuro ampliar sus ingresos dedicando se al transporte pesado (flotas). Mario se dedica al autotransporte desde hace bastante tiempo (100 meses) siempre demostrando responsabilidad y esmero en su actividad.

Existe mucha competencia en el rubro, sin embargo este cuenta con mucha expereriencia lo cual le permite asegurar sus ingresos y más aun proveer a su familia con una fuente de ingresos estable.

Con el credito obtenido, procederá a la cancelación de los tramites legales producto de la adquisición de un lote de terreno. Así tambien el cliente procederá a la cancelación de su saldo con Agrocapital. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de Mario, los anteriores canceló con normalidad presenta un promedio de mora minimo 1 día de retraso pero se puede calificar como un bueno en función a nuestra institución.

loans.use: To repay the legal expenses from the purchase of a plot of land.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is the owner of a repair workshop in a well-known market called Mercado de Abasto in Ciudad del Este. A few years ago, Hipolito started selling different types of products house-by-house in his town. There, Hipolito gained experience and learned essential lessons about how to treat customers. Moreover, from the earnings of this business, he was able to save a considerable amount of money to invest in his present repair workshop.

Hipolito employs a boy who helps him when necessary.

In order to prosper, Hipolito wants to enlarge his repair shop. The expansion will benefit him, since he will have more space to work, and he will be more comfortable. Therefore, the money provided by the credit will be used in the amplification of his business.

loans.use: Amplification of shop.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28900&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Juana, Domitila y Aurelia son socias del Banco Comunal Belén

Juana es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 6 hijos, Juana vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de un colegio. Además Juana por las noches trabaja eventualmente en una empresa.

Por otro lado Domitila es madre soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Domitila vende comida de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad. Además vende canchas y gelatinas que ella prepara.

Mientras que Aurelia es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla. Además Aurelia se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y también vende comida en las ferias.

Juana, Domitila y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, jugos, aceite, papa, gelatina, frutas.

Los sueños de Juana, Domitila y Aurelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Juana, Domitila y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, jugos, aceite, papa, gelatina, frutas.

loans.name: Marivel Pamela

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34436&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Marivel is partner of the village bank Cielo

Marivel is 24 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner in a house made of rustic material. She bakes bread typical for the region where she is from, using the oven of her father-in-law, and sells it at the Santa Clara market without having a stall.

Marivel needs a loan of 1000 soles which she would be invest in buying flour and baskets .

Marivel dreams of buying a car to being able to sell her bread across the city, having her own house, and getting married.

loans.use: Marivel needs a loan of 1000 soles which she would be invest in buying flour and baskets .

loans.name: Yankadi( Ici C’Est Bon) Group

texts.fr:
The 9 members of the Yankadi group are, on average, 44 years old with 4 children. The majority live in traditional families in the Sokala area of Dagala (Region of Ségou, Republic of Mali). They sell charcoal, firewood, grains and condiments. They have come together because of friendship, family relations and professional ties. The Benkadi Dagala association, to which the Yankadi group belongs, has received many training courses in the context of support for rural organizations provided by the non-governmental organization FIDA. In search of financial resources, this group has already worked with several microfinance institutions but finally decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is receiving its second group loan after the first was easily repaid. The women intend to purchase 90 cartloads of firewood and 15 bags of charcoal, locally and in neighboring areas (Dougasso, Zenguena, Gachin and Fombougou), 15 bags of millet (in Dagala, Siguila and Mèfa), and condiments at the large market in the city of Ségou. They generally sell their products at retail prices for cash or on credit at the market in Ségou or door-to-door, for the charcoal and firewood. They sell the condiments door-to-door in the village and on market days in the neighboring villages. Their clientele is made up of all types of people (men and women, young and old). They would like to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and meet their families’ needs. They would also like to work to create a non-governmental organization to restore and protect their ecosystem.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les neuf (9) membres du groupe Yankadi ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 4 enfants, vivent en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Sokala de Dagala (Région de Ségou République du Mali). Elles exercent le commerce du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe, des céréales et des condiments alimentaires. Elles se sont regroupées en raison de liens d’amitié, de parenté et de travail. L’association Benkadi Dagala, a laquelle le groupe Yankadi appartient, a bénéficié de beaucoup de formations organisées dans le cadre de l’appui aux organisations paysannes par l’organisation non gouvernementale FIDA. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières, ce groupe ayant eu à travailler avec plusieurs institutions de microfinance décida de rejoindre finalement Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son deuxième prêt de groupe et le précédent fut remboursé sans difficulté. Elles comptent acheter 90 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 15 sacs de charbon de bois sur place et aux environs (à Dougasso, Zenguena, Gachin et Fombougou), 15 sacs de mil (à Dagala, Siguila et Mèfa) et les condiments dans le grand marché de la ville de Ségou. La vente se fait généralement à Ségou en détail au comptant et à crédit sur place au marché ou en ambulant pour le charbon de bois et le bois de chauffe. Quant aux condiments, la vente s’effectue au village à domicile et les jours des foires des villages environnants. La clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales (hommes et femmes, jeunes et vieux). Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la familles. Elles souhaitent œuvrer pour la création d’une organisation non gouvernementale pour restaurer et protéger leur écosystème.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, grains and charcoal

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Two years ago, Zoila sold dairy products and cosmetics by taking orders. However, she decided to rent a location and start a general store, since she wasn't making sales every day by taking orders. Now she has her own business very close to her home. She offers all types of basic products.

Zoila also continues to sell cheese and beef wholesale, according to the orders she receives.

She has used the loans she has received as capital to invest in her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 2 años, Zoila vende productos lácteos y cosméticos por pedidos. Sin embargo, luego decidió alquilar un local y poner una bodega, ya que las ventas por pedidos no eran diarias. Ahora, ella tiene su propio negocio muy cerca de su casa. Ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad.

Asimismo, Zoila sigue vendiendo queso y carne de res por mayor, según como reciba pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado como capital para invertir en su bodega.

loans.use: To invest in her general store

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur K. is 39 years old, is married, and has three children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who live with him) by selling fabric for traditional dresses. Temur has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Dushanbe. All of the fabric is bought from the neighboring town of Istaravshan. 

Temur is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. Temur, being a devoted father, is doing his best for his children to be well educated and to make them happy. Today, Temur feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) to jump start the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel B. sells clothing for both ladies and gentlemen near the Jubilee school in Cape Coast. Emmanuel has received a senior high education. He is not yet married and has no children.

Emmanuel has been selling clothing since 2002. He is responsible for paying his utility bills and other expenses. He will use his loan to buy more clothing to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business and increase his income so he can meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Thi Van

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Vân năm nay 55 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại hàng ngày  chị Vân còn đi làm đá thuê cho thu nhập 35.000đ/ ngày, Chồng chị ở nhà  đan thúng cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng năm gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ chăn nuôi khoảng 5.000.000đ. Với mức thu nhập này hiện nay cuộc sống của gia đình chị Vân đang ngày càng được cải thiện
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vuụcho việc chăn nuôi của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. P. Thi Van is 55 years old. She has been a member of TYM fund since 2004. Currently, she works as an ice maker for 35,000 VND per day. Her husband works has a basket weaver for an income of 1,000,000 VND per month. Livestock raising gives her family an additional income of 5,000,000 VND. At this level of income, Mrs. Nguyen's family's living standard is improved day by day. She wishes to borrow 6,000,000 VND to invest in her family's livestock raising business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.en: Mukaddam I. lives in the B. Gafurov region, but she trades in the Khujand local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades the children's wear that she brings from Istaravshan. Mrs. I. has been engaged in business for seven years and has good business skills. She brings good assortment so she has repeat customers. Mrs. I. asks KIVA for the business support loan of 400 TJS for three months for new seasonal wear importing. She thanks KIVA for it support.

loans.use: new seasonal wear importing

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio tiene 56 años, es soltero y vive solo, ocasionalmente lo visitan su hermana y sus sobrinos que se quedan por unos días. La única actividad que conoce desde niño es la agricultura, ha sembrado casi toda su vida hortalizas, y cuando su hermana, que también siembra lleva su carga en un camión, él se une a esa carga para de ese modo repartirse los gastos del flete (transporte). Artemio se levanta a las 4.00am, prepara sus alimentos, da de comer a sus cuyes y eso de las 9:00am ya está en marcha con dirección a su chacra. Todos los viernes se dedica a cosechar y luego sumerge en el rió para lavar las zanahorias, lechugas o espinacas, luego las pone en canastas, si son espinacas y si son zanahorias en costales, y eso de las 3.00 de la mañana, todos los sábados, las transporta para amanecer en la ciudad. Esta actividad es consecutiva para él, y para  todos los que siembran hortalizas, además le es muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de enero a marzo, después bajan los precios. El es cliente por sexta vez de Microfinanzas Prisma, y no ha tenido problemas en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que ha solicitado es para abonar sus chacras de espinacas y  flores, considera que le costará aproximadamente entre 1300 a 1500 soles, por lo que aumentará al dinero del préstamo.
texts.en:
Artemio is 56 years old. He is single and he lives alone. He is occasionally visited by his sister and his nephews who usually stay for a few days. He has been farmer his whole life. He and his sister grow vegetables. She usually takes her products in her truck, and also takes Artemio’s products with her so they can share their freight expenses. Artemio wakes up at 4 am every morning. He prepares his food, feeds his guinea pigs and, around 9 am he is already heading to the farm. Every Friday, he harvest his items and then he goes to the river to wash the carrots, lettuce, spinach, and then he puts the spinach in baskets, the carrots in sacks. Every Saturday, around 3 am, he transports them to the city. This activity is very important to him, as it is to every person who harvests vegetables. Besides, it is very profitable, especially during the months of January and March, as after that season the prices always drop. This is the sixth time he requests for a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has never had a problem making his payments. The money requested will be used to purchase fertilizers for his spinach and flowers farm. He believes he will need around $400 to $475. This is the reason why this time, he is requesting for a higher loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Francis Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Francis C. desde hace 12 años se dedica a su actividad económica de elaboración de productos lácteos como lo son el queso y cuajada siendo comercializados por ella misma en su tramo el cual es muy visitado por sus clientes. 

A través de los años y gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos el negocio de venta de lácteos ha venido mejorando su condición y hoy en día es una de las mejores comerciantes que ofrecen deliciosos quesos y cuajadas. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado con el propósito de comprar los lácteos para seguir elaborando las deliciosas cuajadas  y queso del mercado.
texts.en:
In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Francis C. has dedicated herself for 12 years to the production of dairy products, such as cheese and curd, sold by Francis herself at a location well-visited by her clients. Through the years, thanks to her great effort, her business selling dairy products has improved. Nowadays, it's one of the best businesses that offer delicious cheeses and curds. She hopes her loan will be granted so that she will be able to buy more milk to continue improving her delicious cheeses and curds.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa E. owns 1.75 hectares of land. She dreams of acquiring 5 more hectares someday. Her husband, Domingo E., is the one managing their farm; he is helped by their children. All of her children are studying, so the net income of their harvest goes to school fees and the books that her children ask her to buy. She has been a CEVI client for almost 2 years already and needs additional capital to run her farm.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides in her farm. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. Consequently, she will have more support to give to all her children.

CEVI helps entrepreneurs build and start their own businesses. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Kudzo

texts.fr: Kudzo K. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient depuis 3 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome, un petit village situé au sud ouest du Togo. Avec ce crédit il souhaite accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kudzo K., age 35, is married and the father of 2 children. For 3 years, he's been running a grocery store in Womé, a village located in Southwestern Togo. With this loan, he wishes to increase the capacity of his store, by purchasing new products to better meet the needs of his clientele.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his store

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
S. Tolib, who lives in Pendjikent, Tajikistan, is dedicated to the cattle business to which he attends very diligently in his community. From very early in the morning he tends the animals and he returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all this. He does this in order to bring food to his table for his spouse and beloved four children. Tolib says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education.

Now, Tolib would like to expand his business and purchase two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for $400 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Tolib’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар молодой мужчина 30 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. У него среднее образование. Музаффар занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Музаффар кредитуется 1 год. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Музаффара немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Музаффар планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Muzaffar is a young, 30 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. He has a high school education. Muzaffar fattens and sells livestock, his wife processes and sells milk. Muzaffar has been a borrower for 1 year. When he came to take out a loan for the first time he had a small quantity of livestock. Now Muzaffar’s quantity of small livestock has increased. His wife only has one dairy cow. Muzaffar plans to buy his wife one more cow with a calf and he is grateful to our creditor for their help in bringing his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow and calf

loans.name: Tamtemneh Group

texts.en:
This is John T., Brima K., Fatu K. and Isatu F.. They named their group Tamtemneh. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a significant impact in the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, each of them is requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living. 

John T. (second from left) is the leader of this group. He is forty-three years of age. He was born in Makump Bana village, five miles from Makeni City. He is married with eight children. One of his children is in secondary school, five in primary schools and two are not of school-going age.  John has been a businessman for over fifteen years now. He sells rubber bowls, fishes, cottons, shoes, rice, and so on.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

loans.name: Joan Jean

texts.en: Joan Jean is 29 years old and a single mother.  She and her child are living with her supportive mother in Luna, Isabela. Every day, she wakes up very early in the morning to open her store in the public market of Cauayan City. She has managed a clothing business for almost 13 years and her mother is also helping her. She is doing her best to become a successful entrepreneur for the education of her child.  For this reason, Joan Jean is asking for the support of the lenders by borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000. She is hoping that her loan will be granted as it will really benefit her business and her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Bozoma

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2006 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, très vite elle a réussit à conquérir des clients. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, voulant les satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 5 cartons de spaghetti, 5 cartons de détergents « OMO », 7 sacs de riz « PATRON », 05 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve, 5 bidons d’huiles de palme et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who got started in the commerce of grocery items in 2006. She soon was successful in winning over her customers. Her merchanidise comes from the grand marketplace of Lomé. Her customer base is growing from day to day. Wanting to satisfy her customers appropriately, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy: five boxes of spaghetti, five boxes of OMO detergents, seven sacks of PATRON rice, five boxes of canned tomates, five drums of palm oil, and various grocery items. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Đào Thị

texts.en:
H. Đào Thị (335991066) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business venture raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1999, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by her from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma H. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pigs or pork in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Stephen Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Stephen K. is 28 years old and married with one child. His runs their business together with his wife Jackline in the busy Uthiru area.

He got to know about KADET through his friend and he had never borrowed from other sources before. He will now be servicing his third loan.

He plans to stock a wide range of clothes as well as shoes so as to meet his customers' needs and requests. This will also distinguish his business from the rest and hence give him the upper hand.

loans.use: Buying more clothes so as to increase profitability

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty - one years old. She is a married mother of five children. Two of her children are currently in school and the rest have completed school and are working. She is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband maintain the home. Grace runs a grocery store and sells shoes along side her grocery business. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store by the street. She has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy more provision to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hog raiser for three years and still hoping for business expansion.  She wanted to purchase additional piglets to raise for additional income.  Aside from raising hogs, Flora is also engaged in the direct selling business of AVON, Natasha and MSE products which she sells and delivers to her friends and customers in their village. 

Flora is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 that she can use to improve her two businesses.  She hopes that she will be able to avail the loan for the growth of her business towards progressive living. Flora also aims that all her children will someday finish their studies. 

She have two children and her youngest is in high school level.  Her eldest stopped from her college education since she had the chance to go to abroad and work as an Overseas Filipino Worker or OFW in the Middle East. Flora really hopes for the good future of all her children with the help of her business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Purisimo

texts.en:
Purisimo Z. - 49 years old - is from the village of Kimaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. Purisimo is married and has six grown children. He has owned and operated a sari-sari (general store) for over ten years. The food and household products sales are his main source of income. Purisimo earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Purisimo joined HSPFI to access their financial services, which will help him operate his business and improve his living situation. Purisimo has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 7000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Purisimo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve/expand his business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She sells cooking oil to make a living. This is the high season for sales and she wants to take advantage of it to increase her profits. She is hoping for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Josphine's Group

texts.en:
Josphine K. is a single woman who owns a food stall at Madaraka Market in Thika.  She sells rice, beans, maize and peas to restaurants and families.  Her main business challenge comes at the end of the month when her customers are low on cash. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more rice, beans, maize and peas.  

Ultimately, she would like to expand her business into wholesaling in order to supply local vendors so that each vendor doesn't have to go individually to Nairobi for supplies.  Josephine describes herself as hard-working, honest, a Christian, and intelligent.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, peas and maize

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger V. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and is single.Roger owns and operates a business venture in services sector.While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing "habal-habal" or motorcycle services to local community members. He has also income from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Roger joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair the motorcycle used in his business.
