Roger is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts and portion of the loan finance for his corn production. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Roger from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spareparts/corn production

loans.name: Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
Luz lives in San Pedro de Macoris, in the Dominican Republic. She is the group coordinator of “Bendicion de mujeres trabajadoras”, and her story is representative of the other group members.
Luz makes a living selling clothes on the street. She spends several hours daily walking along the streets and offering her merchandise. She has also started to sell snacks made of rice and oil. Diversifying one’s business, as small as it may be, is a means of improvement and allows borrowers to make their incomes steadier.
Luz took her first two loans with Esperanza last year, after her cousin, who is also a member of Esperanza, told her about the microfinance institution. That was the very first time she was given a loan, and she was able to repay it successfully. With this new loan, she is planning to go to the capital city (Santo Domingo) to buy her merchandise. 
She is the mother of four children, ages 7 to 15, all attending school. Her dream is to be able to finish building her house, and to keep expanding her business.
Thanks for your support.

loans.use: To go to Santo Domingo to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
Victoria T.  de 35 años vende papa y chuño (papa deshidratada) negocio que aprendió de su madre y que le ha permitido generar ingresos para sustentar a su familia, Victoria compra su mercadería de los diferentes pueblos ubicados en el Altiplano y los vende en la feria 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, también vende en la feria extranca de Rio Seco los días viernes y martes. Las compañeras de Victoria tienen sus propias actividades económicas como la venta de mochillas, ropa, confección de prendas de vestir y atención de tienda de barrio.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, materia prima y en algún caso activo fijo.
texts.en:
Victoria T. is 35 years old. She sells potatoes and chuño (dehydrated potatoes), a business that she learned form her mother and that has helped her bring in income to sustain her family. Victoria buys her merchandise from different towns in the Altiplano and she sells them in the 16 de July market on Thursdays and Sundays. She also sells in the Rio Seco market on Fridays and Tuesdays. Victoria's fellow lending group members have their own economic activities, such as selling backpacks, clothes, tailoring and tending to their own neighborhood stores.

They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, primary materials and fixed assets.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, primary materials and fixed assets

loans.name: Jhomaira

texts.es: Jhomaira de 23 años, vive en su casa propia con su papá Fortunato de 55 años y su pequeño hijo Rubén de apenas 1 año y medio, quien es su motor que la impulsa para salir adelante.Debido a que tuvo que mantener a su bebé sola se convirtió en comerciante de abarrotes (productos de primera necesidad), le ayuda su papá en el negocio ;desde hace un año atrás también vende prendas de vestir; es consciente de que tuvo a su hijo muy joven, tenía muchos planes profesionales que se quedaron truncos , pero supo asumir el rol de madre, porque su hijo es la razón de su esfuerzo; con la venta de ropa se hizo de varios clientes , y siempre le hacen mucho pedidos de los últimos modelos que salen al mercado, lo cual le permite mayores ganancias, por lo que considera bastante rentable su actividad; para el futuro ha pensado en ahorrar para brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su hijo y sobre todo buena educación, asimismo planea aperturar una tienda de prendas de vestir que distribuya sus productos al por mayor y menor , e incluso realizar desfiles de moda con sus posteriores creaciones, ya que desea estudiar diseño de modas.Este es el primer préstamo que Jhomaira tiene con MFP y esta segura que pagará sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos que le permitan crecer económicamente y así mejorar si situación en general; dice  que le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque los conoce muy bien.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de  prendas de vestir  y calzados, que ya fueron solicitados por sus clientes conocidos aprovechando la época navideña, y espera tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jhomaira, 23, lives in her own house with her 55 year old father, Fortunato, and her small son, Rubén, who is barely one and a half years old. Rubén is the motor that drives her to get ahead. Because she had to support her baby by herself, she became a merchant selling groceries (basic needs items). Her father helps her in the business. She also started selling clothes a year ago. She is aware that she had her son very young. She had a lot of professional plans that were thwarted. But, she knew how to assume the roll of being a mother. Her son is the reason for her efforts. She has made various customers by selling clothes, and they always place lots of orders for the latest styles in the market. This allows her to get greater income, and she considers her activity profitable. For the future she plans to save in order to give her son an adequate quality of life. Above all, she wants to give him a good education. She plans to set up a clothing store to distribute her products wholesale and retail. She also wants to have modeling shows with the creations she will make later. She wants to study design and fashion. This is Jhomaira’s first loan with MFP. She is sure that she will make her payments punctually because she wants to access more loans that will allow her to grow economically. That way she will improve her general situation. She says that she likes to work with the members of her communal bank because she knows them very well. She plans to use the money from the loan to buy clothing and footwear. Her customers have asked for these items, and she will take advantage of the Christmas season. She expects to have good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a 36-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of two children. Both her children are in school. She is a food vendor who serves food like waakye. Waakye is prepared from local rice grain mixed with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoy it as it has local taste and standards. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for four years now to take care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her children's educational needs. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more meat and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 6 kids' tubs, 6 kids' playsets, 6 electric grills, 5 electric fans, 3 batches of plastic flowers, 5 dozen brooms, and 6 45-liter trash cans.

loans.name: Luaupua

texts.en:
Luaupu F. is 35 and married with 3 children (ages 1 - 5).  She owns a business venture, running bingo games.  Luaupu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Luaupu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase game prizes.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of bingo in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/Bingo#

Luaupu joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Luaupu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Luaupu F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase game prizes

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. She has owned a shop since 2007. She sells toys for children, dishes, home cleaning products, groceries and many other things. When she first started her business, she wasn’t able to offer a large quantity of merchandise, therefore she decided to have various kinds of merchandise and offer all she could to her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists.

She decided to open her shop because she always wanted to have work of her own and to be self-reliant. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new merchandise for her store. This is the first time she has requested a loan. She plans to keep on improving her store to attract more clients and to expand it by making it a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her store

loans.name: Silbera

texts.es:
Silbera tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Actualmente tiene su casa propia en la comunidad llamada “San José” en un zona de ceja de selva.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, negocio al que le tiene mucho cariño, ya que le dio la oportunidad de hacerse reconocida en su comunidad, es por ello que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles. Ella labora desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, siendo una actividad cómoda y a la vez le brinda las ganancias económicas necesarias para su hogar. Aun así para el futuro piensa ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un tipo de minimarket con una ambientación atractiva para los clientes.

Este es su decimo sexto préstamo con MFP, asegura que estos créditos le han traído muchas satisfacciones, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente fortalecida y contenta con su banco comunal. 

Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá más mercadería acorde a la demandada, ya que con ello tendrá bien surtida su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Silbera is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. She currently has her own home in the community of San José, which is in a jungle area.

For twenty years Silbera has been managing a grocery store, a business for which she has a great attachment. It gave her the opportunity to become recognized in her community, since she has many loyal customers. Silbera works from 5am until 8pm in what she feels is a comfortable activity that provides financially for her household necessities. In the future, she plans to expand her business and convert it into a mini-market with an attractive environment for her customers.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. Silbera assures us that these loans have brought her tremendous satisfaction. Therefore, she promises to continue making her payments on time. She also feels stronger and happier with her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to acquire more merchandise so that she will have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
L. señora AdeL. es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 45 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 12, 8 y 3 años, se dedica a L. venta D. variedad D. productos en una librería – bazar llamado “NICOL”, desD. hace 11 años, se inicio con un puesto en el Centro Comercial D. Gamarra vendiendo prendas D. vestir, hasta que L. desalojaron y se vio obligada a poner el bazar en su vivienda, además cuenta con un locutorio desD. hace 3 años llamado “NAYELY”.
AdeL. nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido D. mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, sus ingresos cubren los gastos D. pago D. servicios, alimentos. El gran sueño D. AdeL. es implementar más su negocio.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar mercadería (cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc.).
AdeL. agradece toda L. ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
AdeL. is 45-year-old married entrepreneur. She has three children, age 12, 8 and 3. For 11 years, she has been selling products at a bookstore in the Nicol bazaar. She started out selling clothes in Gamarra's Commercial Centre, but had to move her shop to her home after she was evicted. She also worked in the Nayely call centre for three years. AdeL. says these loans have been very helpful. She has been able to improve her family's living conditions and raise their income enough to cover the cost of all the services and food they require. AdeL. wants to be able to put more into her business. Her new loan will go toward stationery supplies (notebooks, pens, books, etc.). She appreciates all the help she has received from the lenders who have allowed her to move forward. Because of their help, she has been able to use her loans carefully, grow her business, and grow with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stationery supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. feels great about the career she is working on presently. She enjoys her role of being a support to her husband and children as well as in managing her own small business, which is a “sari- sari” (variety) store. Three of Rosalie’s four children go to school, one in high school (secondary) and two in elementary (primary). The expense their education incurs is supported by the small profit of her business and her husband’s salary, earned from being a utility worker in one of the government offices in town. 

Because of the low economic status of their family, Rosalie’s eldest 18-year-old son chose to quit studying and become a fisherman instead to help his parents earn more money to cope with the growing needs of the entire family. Rosalie is somehow happy for her son’s being responsible, yet she felt guilty for not graduating him from college, which is her greatest goal as a mother. Nevertheless, she wants to grow her own “sari-sari” store business until it becomes profitable through a loan she is requesting through Kiva's field partner, ASHI. Profits from her store will be used to support her children’s needs, including her eldest son’s desire to grow his own fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other commodities to sell.

loans.name: Karamo Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NIAFOR est un groupe féminin composé de personnes issues toutes du même village. Un village situé environs à 90 kilomètre de la ville de Ziguinchor. Le Groupe de solidarité KARAMO créé en octobre 2002, fait partie de l'un des 8 qui composent ledit Banc Villageois. Les femmes membres du groupe de solidarité sont moyenne âgées de 40ans et mère d'au moins de 4 enfants.

La présidente, numéro 03KD3211081038 est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge et responsable d'un enfant de sa coépouse. C'est une femme très engagée et qui cultive l'esprit de solidarité dans le groupe. Elle développe un petit commerce de poisson frais, d'huile de palme, de balais faits de feuilles de palmes. Par ailleurs, elle fait également du maraîchage et son objectif est d'améliorer les conditions de santé et alimentaire de sa famille 

Le groupe reste très solidaire lors des remboursement de prêts, ce qui fait que jusqu'à présent, aucun retard de payement n'a été enregistre en leur sein.
texts.en:
The Villager Bank of Niafor is a female group made up of people from the same village. The village is located about 90 km from the town of Ziguinchor.The Mutual Group Karamo, established in October, 2002 forms part of one of the 8 groups which make up the aforementioned Villager Bank.The female members of this mutual group have an average age of 40 years and are the mothers of at least 4 children. The chairwoman, number 03KD3211081038 is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She takes care of and is responsible for the child of her co-wife. She is very engaged and cultivates the spirit of solidarity in the group. She does petty trading of fresh fish, palm oil, and brooms made of plam branches. She also equally does truck farming and her goal is to improve the health and feeding conditions of her family. The group remains united during payment of loans which indicates that, until now, no late payment has been registered from their part.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote the commercial activities of the group

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia B. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old. Lucia is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun P., 36, is a local farmer growing a rice crop. She is married with four school-aged kids, while her husband works on the farm with her.

Chun P. is happy to pursue a loan from Kiva in order to plant rice crops during the coming rainfall season which is a great time for cultivating.

loans.use: To plant rice crops

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia R. is from the village of  Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Remegia is married and has 5 adult children. Remegia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Remegia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remegia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remegia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kariakoo Group

texts.en:
Mwana Asha L., age 40, is single and has one 17-year-old son.  She lives with her parents.  She sells food like tea with snacks in the morning and lunch at Kariakoo place in the city.  She has been in this business for ten years now. She works from 5am to 5pm daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $473.

This will be Mwana’s 6th loan and her 1st Motisha loan.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended at Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to start selling chips from 5pm to morning.
	
Mwana will share this loan with her loan group, Kariakoo, which totals seven members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Mwana is at the far right.

loans.use: To start seling chips from 5pm up to morning

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en:
Denisa P. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Denisa is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Denisa owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Denisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Denisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Denisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Denisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Denisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
K. Yusuf is a 47 year old man. He is married and has two children. Yusuf owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. He is requesting a loan of $1000 US to increase his stock. Yusuf is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman who has been selling clothes and operating a shop for six years. With the Kshs. 40,000 loan, Mwanasha wants to buy clothes as well as more maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

She also sells fruit juice, which forms her other source of income. Her major customers are passersby and her neighbors. Transport presents her with a challenge as she transports her items in bulk from the market. She hopes someday to open a boutique from where she can sell her clothes.
			
Mwanasha rents her home which has electricity and piped water. She joined Yehu so as to access loans and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy clothes, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina se dedica a una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Pues siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Realiza sus compras de contado en Managua y a camiones repartidores, ella compra la mayoría de sus productos en el mercado ya que los precios son más baratos y le generan más ingresos, sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, para la compra de golosinas, refrescos y jugos  el cual está generando ingresos favorables, la señora vive de manera moderada  y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Argentina runs a pulpería [a small grocery store] out of her house. She is always looking for ways to generate more income for her family. She makes her purchases with cash in Managua and from distribution trucks. She buys most of her products at the market, as the prices are the lowest there, which creates the most profits. She makes her sales by cash and on credit. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business, in order to buy candy, soft drinks, and juices, as these items are generating good profits. This woman lives in moderation, with all of the basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Kealy

texts.en:
Kealy P., 50, and her husband, Chamroeun Khen, 55, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers from the city. They have been married since 1977 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Five of her children are married and live separately, and the other three live in the family house. 

Kealy is a rice farmer, while her husband has been a primary school teacher for 35 years. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics to support her daughter's tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabrics for her daughter’s tailoring business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Kobusinye is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. All of her children are currently in school. Juliet has a business of selling drinks, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and passion fruits. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business to a shop. Juliet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and passion fruits to sell.

loans.name: Amalyn

texts.en:
Amalyn G. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   general store, buying and selling of crabs and shrimp, and transportation businesses. She lives in Brgy. 2, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her general store, buying and selling of crabs and shrimp and transportation businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP16,000. Amalyn is now borrowing PHP 27,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Amalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Delmar

texts.en:
Delmar A. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City.  He is 23 years old.  Delmar is married and has 1 infant-aged child.  To make a living, Delmar owns and operates a transportation business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community.  Delmar has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Delmar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI.  Delmar is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Delmar from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Nuevo Renacer 1 Group

texts.en:
Balbina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Nuevo Renacer 1 (Women of a new reborn). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is the plan she has to get a divorce. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying sharing with her entire family (parents and others) and cooking.

Balbina is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting with a loan she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different beauty and cosmetic products. She will use the profits to buy some medicine for her mother and save because she wants to have a bigger locale for her business. Her goal is to have a bigger salon and a clothing store.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she prefer Esperanza's payments and the unity it creates by having group loans, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with six children. Five of her children attend school, while one is still too young. Biasha owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and other customers. In addition, Biasha also sells firewood to contribute to her income. Biasha’s major business challenge is the season, as during the rainy season it is difficult to get fish to sell. 

Biasha decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase thirty kilograms of fish and a refrigerator for preserving fresh fish. In the future, Biasha hopes to establish a seafood market stall.

loans.use: to purchase fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Dieu Donne

texts.en:
Dieu Donne is 32 years old and is single. Dieu Donne is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of traditional art and handicrafts, which he has been doing for 2 years. His shop is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day and he employs two people.

Dieu Donne has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of art and handicrafts as they are high in demand. With this large quantity he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Dieu Donne hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to renovate his house and save for secure future.

loans.use: To purchase more handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Razakan's Group

texts.en:
Razakan J. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Toktogul. She is 50 and married. Her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. Together they are bringing up a daughter and two sons. The youngest son studies at school and the other children are employed.  

Razakan herself works as a teacher at school. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future Razakan wants to purchase a piece of land for farming.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 27 años de edad y tiene su pareja, ella vive junto con su pareja en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La socia Norma y su pareja tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de granos secos, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de “El Molino” de la ciudad del Cusco. Norma requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, maíz, etc.

Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is 27 years old and has a partner. She lives with her partner in the city of Cusco, Perú. Norma and her partner have a small business selling basic grains. She has a stall in the “El Molino” market in Cusco. Norma needs the loan to buy more grains, such as barley, wheat, corn, etc. 

Norma belongs to the “Juntas Caminemos” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more grains

loans.name: Abelino

texts.en:
Mr. Abelino has been married to his wife for several years. They have 4 older children. Together, they've created a general store business in their home, which is located in a very good place in their neighborhood.

At first, they started with little investment capital, that he had saved up working in different places in the past.  Besides his business he has a cassava plantation which also generates income. Thanks to their labor, they were able to build a bigger, more comfortable shop. This helped them increase the sales in their business.

Mr. Abelino has demonstrated to be a very responsible, honest person who keeps all his payments up to date.

loans.use: The buying of merchandise.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca H. is from the village of Kapalaran, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Rebecca is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling spices, food seasonings, cooking oils, vegetables & eggs in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & spices. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & spices

loans.name: Felipe Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe Ángel es una persona muy seria, trabajadora y responsable en su trabajo, el desea el préstamo por que quiere acabar de construir  el cuarto que les esta haciendo a su familia ya que se preocupa por el bienestar  de  ella  y desea que tengan  una  excelente  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Mr. Felipe Ángel is a very serious person, hard-working and responsible in his work. He would like this loan to finish constructing the room he is building for his family as he is worried about their well-being and would like them to have an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy K. owns and operates a bar business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Teddy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerycans of local gin to offer to her customers. The main business challenges for Teddy are thieves and defaulters. 

Teddy and her husband live in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda, in a home that they own. They have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school, and Teddy also cares for additional family members. The family has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerycans of local gin to offer to her bar customers

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira S. is the leader of this group.  She is a resident of Kochkor – a small village in Isykul region. She is 53 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons; the first son works as a taxi driver and the second is a farmer.

Four years ago, with the initial investment of 7000 soms, Damira started to breed cattle and then resell it at a higher price after fattening. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save some money and purchase a fridge. With money received from the loan she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the near future Damira plans to purchase a vehicle for her younger son, to make him able to work as a taxi driver. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma, 38 years old, lives in Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has two children aged 15 and 3.

Herma is a farmer. She grows rice, corn and vegetables. She sells her harvest to the market. Herma has a cow that helps till her land. Herma always does her best for her farm to be productive.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide maintenance repairs to his car.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor se dedica a elaborar refresco de mocochinchi (durazno seco) para luego envasarlo en bolsitas y luego sellarlo con su maquina selladora, aparte envasa tostado de haba y maní  estos tres productos los reparte en los puestos y anaqueles de la universidad donde se encuentra sus principales clientes a los cuales provee con sus productos, el se dedica a esta actividad hace 3 años indica  que es  una fuente de ingresos para su sustento y de sus hijos; el señor  es separado vive junto a sus hijos en domicilio ajeno el cual se le encomendó cuidar con la condición de que pague el consumo de electricidad ,  el señor indica que el dinero que le otorgamos lo empleará en compra de una maquina selladora y una heladera ya que una de sus maquinas esta fallando y la heladera la empleara para refrigerar los refrescos, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor Víctor is engaged in making mocochinchi (a popular Bolivian drink made from dried peaches, sugar, cinnamon, and water) which he puts in little bags that he seals with a sealing machine. He also packages toasted fava beans and peanuts. He distributes these three products at stalls and shelves at the university where he has the main customers to whom he provides them. He has been involved with this business for 3 years and states that it is a source of income for the support of him and his children.

Señor Víctor is separated. He lives with his children in someone else’s house, which has been entrusted to his care under the condition that he pay for the electricity.

Señor Víctor states that he will use the money we loan him to purchase a sealing machine and a refrigerator since one of his machines is failing, and he will use the refrigerator to cool his drinks. He is a very hardworking person and thankful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to purchase a sealing machine and a refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 41 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Juan se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children. He resides in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Señor de La Salud” (Lord of Health) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Soloma, which is part of the canton of Echeandia. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn and rice. His purchases are made in Ventanas and he sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially acquire the supplies he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to buy an automobile.

Juan enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters). Aisha has a business of a food stall.  She has been in this business for three years and she works six days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market at retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava, bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through her motorcycle. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are building rental houses. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes, and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Erlinda De Rosario

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 33 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación, por lo que es una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue la razón por la ella dio inicio a este humilde negocio que ahora es su medio de vida, y la necesidad de proporcionarle a su hijo lo necesario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, jabón, detergentes, leche, jugos y refrescos naturales, a pesar de que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir al mercado para realizar las compras y recorrer los diferentes establecimientos donde le ofrezcan los productos más baratos siempre sonríe con mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 33 years old. This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación Leon 2000 since she is an excellent client. She manages a store that she established because she wanted to have her own business. It now serves as her livelihood and helps her provide for the needs of her child.

This loan will be used as operating capital so that she can buy sugar, soap, detergents, milk, juices, and natural refreshments. Despite having to wake up very early to go to the market and travel to different establishments to get the cheapest products, Erlinda is always smiling because she is able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, detergents, milk, juices, and natural refreshments.

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, viven por el cantón Sigsig, este cantón es muy visitado por la belleza de sus paisajes y por su naturaleza, la mayoría de su gente se dedica a fabricar sombreros de paja toquilla, también trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y con una gran hospitalidad.
 
Doña María tiene 36 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 15 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo transporte pesado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María tiene una tienda de comestible en la que trabaja hace 6 años, su tienda la atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. También desde muy niña se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, embutidos, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Toquilleras Communal Bank.  The members live in the Sigsig canton.  This canton is frequently visited for it beautiful scenery and its landscape.  Most of its inhabitants make panama hats.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  They are very amiable and hospitable people.

María, age, 36 is married and has three children.  They children are 16, 15, and 9 years old.  The first two are in high school, and her last daughter attends a school in the area.  Her husband is a driver, and he works driving heavy transport.  Through their joint efforts they have managed to build their own house.

María has a grocery store, and she has worked there for six years.  She tends to the store from six in the morning until ten at night.  Also, she has been making panama hats since she was a young girl.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, sausages, detergent, and other basic needs items.  She will do this to stock her business more.

Her goal is to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, sausages, detergent, and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Daliass" se ubica en el estado de Puebla, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes la señora Belen es integrante del grupo. Tiene 19 años estudio asta la secubndaria y es soltera. Su negocio es una tienda que inicio hace 1 año ya que debido a la falta economica dejo de estudiar, actualmente pretende retomar sus estudios con ayuda de su negocio que poco a poco va creciendo y cada vez tiene mayor numero de clientes. Sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran todo lo que necesitan y a buen precio. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada ya que surtirá nuevamente su tienda, quiere este prestamo para comprar enlatados, articulos de limpieza y refrescos ya que es lo que más le solicitan. Tambien espera tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ganancias para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Las Daliass".  It is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is composed of 9 members. Belen is a member of the group.  She is 19, has a secondary school education, and is single. Her business is a shop that she started a year ago, since she had to give up school due to lack of money.  Now she is trying to take up her studies again with the help of her business that is growing little by little and has more customers all the time.  Her customers prefer her because they always find everything they need at a good price.  At the time she requested this loan, she felt enthusiastic because she will be able to restock her shop.  She wants this loan to buy canned goods, cleaning items, and soft drinks, since those are what people ask her for the most.  She also hopes to have more customers and improve her earnings in order to provide herself and her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, cleaning items, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es: Maritza Elena tiene 54 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio desde muy joven ya que necesita proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario.  Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que buscar las compras y elaborar los diferentes platillos que elabora. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, pan, platos, café, gaseosas, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Maritza Elena is 54 and she has been selling prepared food for more than 22 years.  She started when she was very young since she needed to give her family daily meals.  She rises early and then has to go shopping and prepare the different items that she makes.  She will use the requested loan to buy rice, beans, bread, plates, coffee, soft drinks, juices, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, plates, coffee, soft drinks, juices and more

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old man. He is married and has two children aged six and two, whom he hopes to give a good education up to the university level. 

He operates a motorcycle transport business and serves the local people at Magongo in Mombasa. He been running this business for two years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is he only owns one motorcycle, thus he has a small business. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

He is using his loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy another motorcycle to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to buy a fleet of rickshaws in the future. He also hopes to build a residential house for his family. He describes himself as a person who loves and is committed to his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa que le heredo su madre junto a su hijo Maycon y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Maximiliana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de papa y alverja, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. Además de cuidar a los toros y ovejas que tiene, los que vende para cualquier eventualidad. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde sabe que tiene que pagar toda su cuota puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Maximiliana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 bolsas de semilla de alverja y si el dinero le alcanza también comprará fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 54-year-old mother of a very happy and hardworking family. She lives with her son, Maycon, in a house inherited from her mother. Her biggest wish is to improve their quality of life. 

The products that Maximiliana has farmed with so much effort and dedication have helped her to progress in life. Every morning, she starts to work on her fields. She knows that the quality of her harvest will depend on the care she brings to her potato and pea crops. 

What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops because she feels pleased when the harvest is large and abundant. Maximiliana has been been farming for 24 years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying her harvest to the market in Tarma, the place where she sells, because the sacks are extremely heavy. She also raises bulls and sheep, which she can sell if necessary.

Going forward, she hopes to improve her produce as a means to obtain better prices. She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank. This is her fourth loans with the MFP, where she knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.ru:
Иболя – из Виноградово, Западная Украина. Она торгует одеждой секонд-хенд на центральном рынке своего родного городка. Три торговые точки Иболи находятся практически в самом центре рынка, конкуренция практически отсутствует. Иболя работает с этим типом товара уже 13 лет. 

Иболя планирует использовать кредит в сумме 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить 200 килограмм одежды, увеличить количество реализуемого товара, а, значит, и свой доход. Иболя не хочет оставаться на одном месте, она хотела бы развиваться дальше и расширять свою торговлю. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ibolya is from Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine.  She sells second-hand clothing at the central market of her native town.  Three of Ibolya's retail outlets are located practically right in the center of the market, where there is no significant competition.  Ibolya has been working with this type of merchandise for 13 years.  She plans to use the loan in the sum of 20000 hryvnia to purchase 200 kilograms of clothing, increase the quantity of her merchandise and, therefore, increase her income.  Ibolya does not want to remain in one place, but wants to develop and expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilograms of clothing

loans.name: Macedonio

texts.es: Macedonio tiene 39 años, está casado con María de 43 años, con quien 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en Sivia Alta. Él es un hombre de buenos principios, no por algo es presidente de su comunidad, y eso le favorecio mucho en su negocio, pues se dedica en la venta de maderas, distribuyendo a carpinterías y/o empresas de construcción. Considera que éste negocio es rentable, siempre y cuando uno trabaje de manera formal, pues sino estaría infringiendo la ley. Él está feliz con su trabajo, aunque al principio, le fue difícil, pero ahora su negocio esta en su apogeo. Para el futuro desea comprarse nuevas maquinarias, para facilitar su trabajo, de esta manera abastecer a todos sus clientes. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, comprará una maquina cortadora de madera.
texts.en:
Macedonio is 39 years old and married to María, aged 43. They have three children and live in their own house in Sivia Alta. He is a man with good principles. It is not without reason that he is the president of his community, and this helps him a lot in his business. He sells timber to carpenters and building companies. He believes that his business is profitable as long as he works in a formal way, because otherwise he would break the law. He is happy with his work, although at first it was difficult, but now his business is running perfectly.

In future Macedonio wants to buy new machinery to facilitate his work and in this way serve all his customers. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He is committed to pay off the installments on schedule. He will invest the 2000 soles of his loan in a wood cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn  is married. She has four children. Marilyn  is 45 years old and she  lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental.

Marilyn sells candies, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and corn grits,can goods and other to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell for her store. Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC this year only. In the future, Marilyn striving hard for the education of her children because she has two daughter now in college and she want to continue renovate her house. She is hoping that her business will give return doubled.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell for her store

loans.name: Judith Fabiola

texts.es: la  cliente Judith  es una clienta antigua ya esta en la tercera secuencia tiene 2 niñas de 9  y 12 años ella las educa y se encarga de su manutención sola, ya que su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero hace cinco años y no le manda pensiones para sus niñas la Sra. Judith tiene como actividad principal la venta de cosméticos y promotora de ventas de una importante empresa que ofrece sus productos por catalogo,  y como actividad secundaria esta la de salón de peinados, vive en la casa de los familiares del esposo por tal razón no paga alquiler ni anticrético la cliente no presento atrasos en sus anteriores créditos. También cabe recalcar que  la cliente vende en la zona de la 16 de julio los días domingos y  jueves, cosméticos, el dinero del crédito es para la compra al por mayor de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción y así poder venderlos al precio original y tener un poco mas de ingresos, es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Judith has been a customer for a long time and this is her third loan.  She has two daughters, aged 9 and 12, who she educates and provides for since her husband has been overseas for five years and doesn't send money to support the girls.  Judith's main business is selling cosmetics by promoting sales for an important company which offers products by catalogue.  Her second business is a beauty salon.  She lives with relatives of her husband so she doesn't have to pay rent or a mortgage.  She has never been delinquent on previous loans.  

On Sundays and Thursdays, she sells cosmetic products in the "16 de julio" neighborhood.  She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale cosmetics which are on sale, so she can sell at the original price and earn more income.  She is a young woman who wants very much to get ahead, and is very grateful for the support received.

loans.use: To buy wholesale .

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun and her husband, Sokhann, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. Two assist in their parents' farming business and the other two are in school.
 
Saroeun and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflower, cucumbers and other crops on their farmland in the village. 

Saroeun is requesting another loan of $1,200 to continue her farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and paying for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 60 years old and a mixed crop farmer who is married to Gabriel. They are blessed with four adult children. 

She has been in the farming business as the primary business and fish rearing as the secondary business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Esther will use the loan to buy fish food and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand the fishpond. Her hopes and dreams are to buy commercial land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fish food and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Chebin A W Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chebin A W Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Irene takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Irene is the facilitator of the Chebin A W group. The photograph shows Irene with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Chebin A W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Mrs Loh is 56 years old and a diligent mother, living in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh.  To earn a living she sells mixed products from home for profit.  There are many types of products she sells such as shampoo, detergent powder, groceries, drinks, and snacks.  From this business, she typically earns in the neighborhood of $3.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has got only one daughter, who works as sewing staff in a garment factory. 

Mrs Loh is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to provide good transportation for her daughter to get to work without taking the motor-taxi service any longer. Through using this loan, some expenses of the family will be reduced and Mrs Loh hopes that she will be able to make more income for living.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is a small framer who lives in Roma Norte. He is married to Norma, and they have two children who attend school. He has been in the business for 25 years and this has made him an expert in this field of work. According to him, he still needs to improve his farming practices so that he will generate more output.

He has insufficient funds, so he wants to borrow P25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.  Isidro would like to send his children to college so that someday they will earn a degree and seek better employment.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Khassim

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire , chauffeur de métier.Il s'active dans le commerce et la location de véhicules.Il achète des véhicules d'occasion, les retape et les revend à un bon prix.Il loue également aux touristes des voitures pour leurs circuits à travers le pays.Il accumule deux ans d'expérience dans cette activité qui lui rapporte des bénéfices consistants lui permettant de prendre en charge ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs.Afin de renforcer ses revenus, il sollicite un pet de 300000f pour réparer un véhicule destiné à la vente en achetant des pignons, des portières neuves et des coussins. Son ambition est de créer une agence de voyage et de location de voitures.
texts.en: The lender is a young single man, a driver by profession. He works in the vehicle rental business. He buys second hand vehicles, renovates them and resells them for a good price. He also rents cars to tourists, for their journeys across the country. He now has two years experience in this business, giving him consistent profits which allow him to support his two parents, as well as his brothers and sisters. In order to increase his turnover, he is seeking a loan of 300,000f to repair a vehicle for resale - to buy parts, new doors and car seats. His ambition is to create a travel and care rental agency.

loans.use: to buy some car spare parts, new doors and seats

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, de 62 años de edad, esta casado con Domitila de 52 años y fruto de su relación concibieron  02 hijos  Hernán de 23 años y Reina de 14 años. Juntos habitan en su propia casa  donde reina la felicidad. Julio, es un hombre que se esmera cada día por dar lo mejor a sus hijos, su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno donde cultiva plantas de cacao. Viene trabajando durante 15 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos y comercializa dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada productos son vendidos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos; con el crédito solicitado contratara jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que aquejan sus plantaciones.
Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar mas semillas de cacao ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente para cultivar. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles contratara jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que aquejan sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Julio, aged 62, is married to Domitila, aged 52. As a result of their relationship they have two children: Hernán is 23 years old and Reina 14. They live happily together in their own house. Julio is a man who puts a lot of effort every day into providing the best for his children. He is a farmer with 6 hectares of land, where he has been growing cacao plants for the past 15 years. At harvest time he counts on the support of hired day laborers and thus the fruit is quickly harvested and sold to wholesalers who pay him a very good price for each kilogram of his goods. Julio says that his biggest challenge is to transport the goods from the farm to the city of San Francisco, a place where he gets a better price.

Julio applies for this loan of 1000 new soles to hire day laborers to weed his plantations. But currently his highest priority is to buy cacao seeds because he has enough acreage to plant them. This is his first loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. He is committed to pay the installments on time, because later on he wants to have access to another loan. He is very involved in his communal bank.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty sells newspapers at the roadside on a retail basis. She generates additional income through a pay phone. Resty has been in her business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more newspapers so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenge is seasonality and price fluctuation. Her aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also to become a newspaper agent. 

Resty is divorced with one child who is in school. She has two additional family members (a sister and brother). She lives in Kampala, Uganda, in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers for resale

loans.name: Aranas

texts.en: Arnas is a 19 year old woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes which she will sell. This will help to expand her current business. She would like to increase her income so that she can have a better standard of living. Since Arnas is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell
